text:
It was ok. I had the Loco Moco and it was good, but wasn't that great. I'll probably go for a steak and egg breakfast or one of the waffles or something next time. The serving for the chicken and waffles is huge too, biggest I've ever seen.

However, for being a breakfast place, they need to step up their coffee game. This is some of the weakest and worst coffee I've ever had and that alone makes me not want to come back with so many options nearby.

I've heard a lot about this place and wanted to give it a try , and I'm happy we did . Food is amazing with big portions so make sure you bring an appetite!! Love the fact that the servers wear pajamas, flower umbrellas as fans is a very cute idea !! Don't remember our servers name but she was awesome !! Very attentive and knowledgeable !! Will be back every weekend !!!

I am updating my original review on this restaurant because the service and food have declined SIGNIFICANTLY since my first visit. I will NEVER eat here again. On my first visit I ordered the chicken and waffles. The service was GREAT and the food was awesome. I was so excited, I told everyone! I took my husband just a few days later and the experience was night and day! 
 I've tried it four times since then and the service has been AWFUL. Most recently, I found HAIR IN MY FOOD!! 
 The cashier, who identified herself as "Lace" was RUDE! 
 I am so disappointed because I thought that this would be my new breakfast spot. It WON'T! 
Small businesses really need to be careful who they let operate their establishment. I've seen so many good places driven into the ground because of people like "LACE". .

A friend and I visited Rise and Shine a few days ago for the first time. We arrived 30 minutes before they closed and asked the host if they were still seating and apologized for our late arrival. The kind gentleman assured us that it wasn't an issue and got us seated right away. The waitress was also extremely polite and very helpful. But most of all, the food was fantastic! An all around great experience.

Great place for breakfast. They are who they say they are. Steaks cooked to the proper temp and a comfortable family environment. Wait staff are dressed in pajamas so casual is the go to move. Try the potted bread. Very good. They have a French press option for their coffee and is well worth it. They make fresh smoothies at the bar, very yummy. I will continue to come here. Everyone? should give it a try. Why not 5 stars? They can get overwhelmed at times (weekend mornings).

We've been going here every Sunday for brunch for about two months now. The food is amazing and the portions are huge. They have a ton of great options to please everyone. I highly recommend the food ! The place is also very cute. The only downside is that you will wait a very long time , not only to be seated but to get your food as well . We're typically are there for an hour and half to two hours when we go and most of that is just waiting . Despite this fact I still would really recommend them !

This place is the worst!  On my third attempt at giving it another chance, I showed up and was greeted with "we have been very busy this morning so the cooks are all on break for a while". 

The wait staff is generally rude and snippy.  These people really don't enjoy what they are doing for a living. 

Don't waste your time with this place!

This was my first time here. The service from  Madison & Betty was spectacular!! The food was AMAZING!!! My daughter & I had Steak Burgers, SO GOOD!! My son had the chicken. I tasted it & it was FABULOUS! The service is above and beyond!!

My wife and I arrived early on Saturday morning and were promptly seated. We ordered coffe with nutella and were brought a small shot of chocolate syrup not nutella. I tried the corned beef hash which tasted metallic, probably from a can.  We also tried the "pot of bread." It was in a double espresso cup, not a pot,  and undercooked. The toast slices were very small and the bacon grease was not drained properly. The coffee and eggs were very good. Probably will not return. There are too many problems to fix including menu issues.

Gorgeous day for some breakfast outside! Steak benedict and biscuits and gravy were on point!  Poached eggs were over cooked but easy to overlook since everything else tasted so amazing! I'll definitely be a frequent flyer here!

Probably the best breakfast I've had in my whole life. We went there because they allow dogs on the patio, but now, I don't think I even want to try other breakfast places in the area. The pot of bread is one of a kind - I could eat the icing on its own!

ABSOLUTELY PHENOMINAL!! Our server Kris was amazing, first time dining at the flamingo and 215 location and will return for the great service and perfected food. So upon our arrival we ordered the gogo green and watermelon strawberry juice and they were some of the best juices I've ever had. We explained to Kris that were so torn between all the wonderful dishes and asked her to just choose whatever dish she likes the most, for both of us. Well she chose the pot of bread to start and then the steak and eggs and chicken fried steak; what an amazing choice!!! loved every minute of our visit.

This is my favorite spot for breakfast. The service is always great and the food is delicious.  I love the casual atmosphere.  The background music caters to all.  Ashley is my favorite server! You will not be disappointed. Oh yeah they wear PJ's as their uniform. Awesomeness.
Wanted something  off the strip and found this gem via Yelp. Excellent food, fast and friendly service. Definitely worth the little drive to get fresh and filling meals.

After having breakfast one day I returned for lunch the following day. My waitstaff were outstanding, the decor was interesting, and the food was good.  Although there is a complete breakfast menu, the lunch menu is very limited.  I would highly recommend the Rise and Shine for breakfast but suggest selecting a different restaurant for lunch.

Should of know to go somewhere else when the place was empty.  The service was great but the food was so bad. An egg white omelette should not look like a whole egg omelette over cooked. I just couldn't finish, we also had a Benedict that was just as bad the hollandaise sauce made the muffin soggy and it had balsamic or something sour you really shouldn't mix sour with creamy. The only thing I enjoyed was the pot of bread and the latte.

Hands down the best breakfast menu steak I have ever had "Spice-Rubbed Ribeye Steak Chilaquiles". If you like a good rub on your steak, this is a must try. Just the right amount of marbling to give the ribeye a great flavor. It compared to some dinner menu ribeye steaks at some fine dining restaurants I've dined at.  The chips were a little salty for my liking, but still delicious! My girlfriend had the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak, which she enjoyed also. The house coffee had a nice fresh taste also. There were several healthier menu options we will try on the next visit.
Steak and eggs are filling and flavorful.  They offer actual hash browns, not just cubed potatoes.  Service was kind and attentive.  I'll becoming back for breakfast again.
Food Is amazing! Portions huge! Staff very friendly maybe because they came work in their PJs !! Kris needs a raise she is awesome!!!! Get the pot of bread!!!

Not from the area but all I can say is whenever I'm back in the Vegas area I will definitely eat here again! A very clean and welcoming environment with excellent breakfast! It's always nice too when the waitress is nice and helpful! Ashley did an outstanding job recommending items on the menu and took care of us! Thank you Rise &I Shine for a great visit
Amber was an amazing server she made our experience so pleasant. We will definitely come back and request her as our waitress.

So sad that I haven't eaten here sooner!!! Came here after the gym hoping for some basic steak and eggs but we got so much more!! Ordered the chilaquiles and it came with steak and eggs on the side. Such a great portion for the price. The chicken wrap was great as well. You could tell the ingredients were fresh. Great recommendations by Chelsea, our server, and great service. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and friendly. The atmosphere was very calming and friendly for breakfast-goers.  A++++

Located near the LVAC, so a workout and breakfast here is easy. Friendly service, good food, it arrived fast and hot. Atmosphere is meh - formerly a Joe's Crab Shack. Large patio is great though, and the place is huge so you should be able to get seated fairly quickly. Lavazza coffee...brewed OR French Press sooo good. Server kept it topped off (thanks G, we thought you were amazing!) Turkey kielbasa v. good, frosted flake banana pancake is worth a try at least once - one pancake and it's huge. Eggs cooked to perfection. The chicken fried steak on a scale of 1 - 10 was a 6, was as big as the plate but a bit on the tough dry side. Going back to try a few other dishes. I'm on the fence with this place for now, am a devout breakfast person!

Update...went back, french toast stuffed with the eggs n bacon - a delicious original. OJ was watery and too tangy...the server warned us though, as the oranges they had were out iof season. Classic pancakes - 2 huge hotcakes so plan to share. Syrup was warmed - nice! They were wearing their PJ'S on Sunday morning...fun idea! Oh and they had steak n eggs on kids menu.

All these reviews about the food, how good it is and how bad it is.
My suggestion is take a look at the back of the place and you will see how dirty it is. No fan on when the rear door is open, boxes all over the place, etc. etc. The restrooms are disgusting.The food itself is so, so. The Mexican dish they offer is so bad that it is disgusting. If you don't know how to make it, don't offer it. Unless they start cleaning up the place they will not last. Please clean up and offer your customers a nice clean experience.
Food and service are great once you are seated. Just a little frustrating waiting 30 min for a table when there are so many table waiting to be bussed.

I should start this review by stating the Rise N Shine WAS one of my favorite places to eat. The food WAS great and the staff WAS amazing. This time was much different. My parents and I decided to enjoy this beautiful fall day and have a great lunch outside. When we arrive at the flamingo and 215 location, we were informed the outside was closed to clean. We informed the hostess we were going somewhere else to eat outside and it was only then that she reluctantly stated "if that is what it takes to get you to stay, you can eat the outside".  We were seated outside and our server Corey attempted to take great care of us. My mother and I both ordered the patty melt which was spot on in the past but not today. My father ordered the corned beef hash which also was usually great. After waiting an inordinate amount of time, which we would allow for perfect food, we received our orders. My mom and I fought our way through half of our patty melts.  The reason it was such a fight was do to the unbelievably salty over seasoning. When we informed our server, he said that since we ate half he would see what he could do. He came back and said he would give us a 15% family and friends discount. That was better than nothing but not appropriate. No manager came to speak with us even though I know that is the way any restaurant should respond to complaints. We do not fault our server because we know he was trying his best under less than ideal conditions. My father who white knuckled his way through his corned beef hash exclaimed after the fact mentioned his meal was way too greasy and below standards. I am sad to say that we will not be dining at Rise N Shine again unless they can repair their now broken systems. Please fix it so I can return.

First time going , shitty service and was scared to go back 2nd time going back all the employees just looked at us like they where stupid took us 20 mins of standing when it wasnt busy and still didn't get a seat ... WE ENEDED UP WALKING OUT THE DOOR SINCE WE GOT NO HELP OR SEAT 
Wouldnt recommend this place to anyone until they change employees and staff and focus on there job !!!

Great food!!! We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Did not have to wait for a seat, even though it was busy. My husband ordered the chicken fried steak and I had the biscuits and gravy. Everything was good. The steak was easy to cut with a fork and had just a little spice to give it a great flavor. The biscuits and gravy also good, but barely ate them as we shared the chicken fried steak because it was a huge portion. Also recommend trying the pot of bread, super yummy with warm cream cheese frosting.
Heathy tasty drinks, warm syrup, gigantic pancake, delicious omelette! Not to mention the friendly services.
Really slow and disorganized at the front of the house. Took way too long to clear tables, seat parties and create flow. Once we had a table the food was great and service was just fine.

I will never patronize this restaurant again.  I went to Rise and Shine on Flamingo with three of my friends and arrived at 10:30 a.m.  we were told it would be a 45 minute wait.  After an hour I went to the hostess stand and she said 5 minutes more we were next in line.  There were empty tables on the patio and in the restaurant.  15 minutes later I was still waiting.  I went to ask for the manager and a young girl said I am the manager.  I asked her name and she refused to give it to me.  I asked what the problem was and she said the kitchen is backed up, we have just opened and we have problems.  I asked since we were next on the list could we at least sit down and have a cup of coffee.  She said no and that if we don't like waiting we could leave.  I asked for the name of the owners and she said we are a family business and I don't give this information out.  she then proceeded to cross our name off the list and I asked if she was refusing to serve us.  She said oh I assume since you are not happy that you are leaving.  My friend said this is not the way you treat customers who are asking you a question and she said Oh Well you don't like it leave.  She said this in front of all of the customers who were also leaving.  In the parking lot all the customers leaving were telling people who where arriving not to both because management is rude and the wait is now over two hours.  There are many restaurants in Las Vegas and when you are treated rudely by managers there is no reason to return and give them hard earned money.  We left and went to I Hop on Tropicana; we were greeted by the manager who was friendly, the waitress was delightful and the food was delicious.  Plus we got to use our 2-1 coupons found online.  What a difference.  The owners of this restaurant need to go in and see what is going on.  I am the manager of a restaurant and if I found any of my team speaking to customers in such a manner they would not even see the door on the way out.

Although the wait was 30 minutes it was well worth it and completely understandable for being brand new. Congrats to Rise&Shine for being so busy right from the start! 

Alright well coming from Northern Utah and growing up with a few tasty Home Style restaurants; Rise & Shine has sure taken me back! The quality and flavors of the food are completely worth the wait! Biscuits&Gravy with two eggs! Mmmmmmm!!!!  As I'd like to say I've found myself a Diamond in the Rough. The sausage gravy was perfectly crafted on two very moist buttermilk biscuits. I recommend trying the B&G!!

Just tried Rise&shine for the first time with my family, we all were very pleased.  We all ordered something different and everyone was extremely pleased. The service was top-notch, our server Desiree was phenomenal, she was very knowledgeable and welcoming.  GREAT FOOD and SERVICE.  We will definitely return.

Today was my first and last time dining here. I went here for a late lunch today with my family because my kids wanted pancakes. The place is decorated cutely and the food was okay. However the service was so bad, it was almost comical. My food and my children's food came out but we weren't given any utensils or syrup. Our server never came by so we had to get up and ask someone else for help. They told us we couldn't have utensils until they were wrapped in napkins. We again asked politely for at least 2 forks for the kids. We were told no so we simply took the forks ourselves (about 10 minutes later someone brought us over utensils wrapped in napkins). We never got syrup so we had to ask the booth behind us if we could use theirs. My mom's food came out a few minutes later, but her side never came. When we got the receipt her side was still on there so we got them to take it off & mentioned our bad experience...they gave us 10% off but really a few dollars off didn't make us feel better about the situation. As we were talking and standing up to leave another family heard us and said "you didn't get any utensils either?" 

The food is not bad so if you don't mind waiting forever for everything and having to hassle everyone for things then don't let my review discourage you. But if you have kids or a tight schedule (or just want to be waited on) then this is not the place to go.

I've been here several times.  It is a solid breakfast place.  My favorite is the smoked salmon benedict.  It is SO good!  The pot of bread is good and it just looks really cool.  The staff is always friendly.  We try to go early - not too hard when the little ones wake us up at 6:00 a.m. - because it gets busy and there can be quite a wait.

Tried this place for the first time with my parents. It was great service-We had Amberlee as our server, she was very friendly and on top of things. My parents shared the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet and I got the Biscuits and Gravy-good sized portions. Will most likely return.

We have eaten here four times since its opening. The food is good but service  is slow.  Today (5/29) we were there around 8am. They weren't very busy but we still had to wait 30 minutes for our food. To make matters worse the steak was well done and I ordered it medium rare.  The manager came by to make sure everything was fine.  My partner ate his breakfast while I waited for mine.  What bothers  me is this would have been a good opportunity to offer a complimentary beverage or discount the meal for the inconvenience. 
  
There far too many breakfast places around to have this kind of poor quality. We will stick we Egg Works.

Love going to this place post workout LOL! Get my protein on 
Waitstaff is informative on the menu, dressed in PJ's, they are still moving like they're  not asleep 
Juices taste fresh, great flavor. Food is simply amazing. Hubby ordered chilaquilles, looked so good I had to take a chip....even their chips were marinated in poblano sauce and seasoning! Who does that ?!?!? They do and it adds a whole new/amazing taste experience
My eggs benni hit the spot...with the addition  of avocado,tomato, spinach and hash browns...so so ono!!
A little on the pricey side but every once on a while, that's ok

Ambiance: This was definitely the highlight. From the spinning flowers hanging from the ceiling (which were just umbrellas on fans) to the extensive juice bar, this former Joes Crab Shack has come a long way in terms of its aesthetic appeal. 

Food: Will 'meh' suffice? As I heard one lady say as we left, "would have rather had a breakfast sandwich at Starbucks..." All six meals on our table were overly seasoned and greasy. As for the highly publicized Pot of Bread, it's actually just a small cinnamon roll that, while warm and flaky, severely lacked sweetness.

Service: Dreadful. The initial wait was 35 minutes for a table of six, but hey, understandable for a new breakfast joint on a Saturday morning. What I really struggled with was the time between ordering and receiving our food. It's new, there's sure to be some inexperience, but 50 minutes from when you order to when the food gets to your table leads to an upsetting experience.

My husband and I just moved into town and were looking for a nice place to have a family breakfast. I was so pleased that my steak and eggs were cooked perfectly and Amber our server kept the coffee full, and made us feel  comfortable. Loved the red velvet pancakes as well!

This place has very good food. I have eaten here twice. The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because each time I've been there I've had to wait about 20-30 minutes before getting seated in what looks like and almost empty restaurant. Overall after I have been seated everything has been good.
Phenomenal breakfast sandwiches. Great coffee and excellent service. Huge menu

I've been to their first location in southern highlands and finally decided to try out the one on flamingo. All I have to say is food was amazing I had the banana fosters waffles ( which are by far the best thing I've ever had) and a fresh squeezed watermelon & strawberry juice ( it was super refreshing). I would recommend this place to anyone in our outside of the general area because it really is that good

This is the best breakfast spot I've been to in Vegas. There meat is not frozen, fresh delivered every morning!
I've had the country fried steak and eggs and also the chicken and waffles. It would be impossible for me to compare the two because they are both fantastic.
Highly recommend this place!

Two months ago this was one of my favorite places for breakfast but like typical Vegas, service and quality are gone.  Before we ordered we asked the waitress if we could split the bill between 5 of us.  She said the menu said it could only be split by two but since we told her early enough she could do it.  She put it all on one bill.  Two of us ordered the Nutella Cappuccinos which are $4+.  The waitress came by to offer us refills of regular coffee; she filled my cup up half way.  What she didn't tell us was that there was an additional $2.95 charge for the refill, two months ago, there was not. I ordered a Loco Mocco, it was terrible.  So salty, the eggs were under cooked and the burger was burned (I ordered medium).  When we checked out, the girl at the counter asked how it was. As we started telling her about the coffee charge she really didn't want to hear it so she walked away and asked someone else to deal with us.  We explained the coffee refill and service issues with her but she just wanted to argue saying that it's the owner's rules to charge for refills.  Again, I explained we were offered refills but never told we would be charged for them.  If this is policy, you should at least let the guest know.  A simple "I'm sorry" was all we needed.  She offered to take off the charge for the coffee but again let us know it was their policy.  She missed the whole point, we told her we would never come back but at this point she didn't want to listen, she told us we could just leave, there was no charge.  We weren't complaining to get free food; we were trying to let them know they had a customer service issue they needed to fix.  Needless to say, we won't be back.

I ordered the Roast Turkey California Bagel and my boyfriend ordered the Chicken And Waffles. We were both underwhelmed. The chicken on the chicken and waffles was probably the worst thing that came to our table. It seemed way over-battered and almost nearly undercooked. The texture was mushy and off-putting. My bagel sandwich was okay. The portions were large and the service was very good, although we will not be returning.

The overall ambience is great. Although when we arrive on a Sunday morning there were many used tables unattended. But there were many server that day but it was sort of unorganized. I was excited about the order of country fried steak but then when I saw how small the serving were I was very dissappointed and  it was dry and too much peppers. The next few orders came the same way. I wouldnt waste my money here again..left hungry and disapointed but spent almost $100!
Fresh made carrot and green apple juice for me  and waffles with powdered sugar for my sons  A little for everyone.  Nice setting.  Good place to eat after the craziness of Thanksgiving.

I was excited to find out that they opened a location on Flamingo. We are big fans of the location at Southern Highlands. I'm still in love with the steak and eggs! We also get the home made corn beef hash, well done. I'm giving a 4 star only because the 3 times we went there the wait to be seated was too long and the AC was blasting. Hopefully the wait won't be so bad. I still recommend this place for a great breakfast/brunch!

My first breakfast by my self was over $21. Second time we waited 20 min. Before i got up to find a waitress. Three of us was almost $65. Third and last, the eggs Benedict had vinegar hollindase sause with shaved deli ham smoked and liquid smoke drisseled all over it. Never again. Back to egg works down the street.

What a great place for breakfast! I went there two days in a row, and the hostess remembered me!

The first time I went I ordered the ultimate steak and egg breakfast. The steak is a ribeye, a bit thin, but was delicious. It took up a big portion of my plate. The eggs are cooked perfectly and the hashbrowns are large shreds instead of small shreds nice and crispy on the outside tender on the inside.

The second time I went, I had the buffalo chicken with eggs breakfast. Now buffalo sauce for breakfast didn't sound great to me, so I asked for gravy instead. The size of the piece of chicken fried chicken I received was huge. It overtook my plate. I could only eat about a third. The batter was wonderful! I think this is the best fry batter I have ever had. It was light and crispy, not oily or greasy at all.   It had a little little flavoring of the buffalo sauce and the better, and that was just right. I think I might order it the next time as presented on the menu.

They have a lot of nice things on the menu, including a many different kinds of pancakes (mmmm..chocolate chip!), original omelettes such as lox and cream cheese, or you can make your own. They also have French toast and The  normal breakfast fair.  They offer a different variety of sausages for your choosing. Not just the patty or regular pork sausage. They offer chicken sausage and another type that unfortunately I can't remember! If you have a chance, get online and look at the menu. There's just so much there I can't describe it all!

The servers are all dressed in pajamas, so you can tell who is a server and who is the patron. The service was great by the way.

They offer French pressed coffee which I ordered the second day, and let seep a  little too long. It was very strong. They give you three timers, so you can decide whether you want it mild medium or strong. I normally like very strong coffee so I went for it.  Next time, I will choose a different timer. 

There are lots and lots of breakfast places here in Las Vegas, for me to go to the same place two days in a row, that pretty much says it all. I love to eat breakfast out and plan to try just about everything on the menu there.

Delicious food. Good variations on standard breakfast items and the waitresses are attentive and friendly.

The one big issue I saw (and one that almost had us walking out in the first 5 minutes) was the young blonde hostess. What a disaster. We get there with children in tow at 10am on a Friday morning (not even a weekend) and we were immediately greeted by someone who seemed frazzled and a bit stand-offish when asked the wait time by saying "I know that I have a ton of tables open but I don't want to slam the kitchen so I need you to wait up here for 10-15 minutes". You clearly had the staff and the tables free yet she was ill-equipped either by training or lack of common sense to seat us immediately. Then she begrudgingly seats us and then asks if we need a booster seat. We say yes and she says "Can you wait here at the table and I will be back in a few minutes as I need to cash these people(who just walked up) out". So I got my own damn booster seat and we sat down instead of waiting for her to bring us one from across the restaurant. A horrible impression.

The young lady is not hostess material and she certainly is not a good first line for your restaurant. She is better suited for the tanning place next door.

The food was great. I had the Salmon Benedict and everything was very tasty. Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant. Overall a good experience until we go to pay the check. The hostess asks if we want to add a tip electronically and we say yes and the amount and then she prints us out a bill with $0 added to the tip. Again, might be a serious lack of training or she might not be a good fit but the coming and leaving from your restaurant was unpleasant at best.

Found this place, Great atmosphere, clean. Waitresses & Waiters wearing PJ"s lol. Huge plates of food but also delicious, Hot! Love the gravy alot...Try it you want be disappointed. I had chicken fried steak, wife has chicken & waffles. Great food and employees....

The place looked nice and the staff was friendly.  I ordered biscuits and gravy with two eggs and has browns.  It was was supposed to be sausage graving.  Hardly any sausage flavor.  Hash browns were under cooked.  The food was cold.  I think the waitress forgot until I asked because people that arrived after me were getting their food.  I was told the Kitchen was backed up.  I will never return

Bf and I decided to try the newest breakfast spot in our neighborhood on Memorial Day.  When we arrived the wait was 45 minutes, but were pleasantly surprised when they called our name in only 25 minutes.   The decor is cute!  Food servers in jammies...clever!   The pot of bread was unique...a cinnamon roll baked in a small coffee cup with a side of butter and cream cheese glaze.  Mine came out hot of the oven, so of course it went down the hatch with no trouble.  Omelet and potatoes were also tasty.  The food was a bit slow in getting to the table after we ordered, but our server was very friendly and attentive.   I dont know if the food stands out from all the other breakfast places, but its just as good.

Large portions..good flavor and fresh tasting. 
Kids meals were a perfect fit for the picky kid.
Staff was curious and knew the menu...I would recommend coming here
Best breakfast place in town hands down..Christy the bomb and so nice! Get them eggs country scrambled yeah man.
This is my first time here......super busy on the weekends. Staff was super friendly and offered some good healthy choices. My wife and I sat at the bar and had a wonderful time
This place is as confused as trying to find your way out of a casino with blind folds on.  they will do better i just went too soon.  food just ok  egg works is the way to go
The food was so bomb. The steak chilaquiles was definitely mouth watering. Our waitress was super friendly and she took great care of us. Shoutout to Ashley!!!

This is a great breakfast place. However before you commit to going, be prepared for a long wait to get seats and a long wait to get your food!  Our server, Ashley, was very good and real friendly.  Made our wait pleasant and the food was worth the wait!

I tried Rise and Shine for the first time today from a recommendation from my friend.  The staff was very friendly and we had great service.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.   The gravy really made the dish very good.   Hash browns are really tasty as well.  Definitely going back for more.  Nice decor and there's a very friendly atmosphere here.  Highly recommend.
my go to breakfast spot. the buffalo chicken breast is hands down the best i've ever had. the service is amazing & i envy the fact that the servers wear pajama pants. lol will always come here!

Great staff, always nice and polite. Even if they're busy they acknowledge you and bring you the food fast. Been to the Southern Highlands location and they're both always consistent with their menu and service. Highly recommend this place.

In terms if service, we arrived on a Saturday around 10 am, and there was plenty of seating, however we had to wait 15 minutes. We asked to be seated outside. The outdoor patio is pet friendly, which is both good and bad. Although I would love to bring my furry friends, I could do without the pet hair blowing around my eggs.

We ordered an iced coffee for $4, which we won't order again. Received the coffee to find out it was coffee, chocolate syrup, and nesquick powder and a ton of ice. Would have been good except they didn't stir the powder and with the shape of the glass and amount of ice they used, it makes it almost impossible to stir, so you get big globs of powder.

We ordered the bacon wrapped steak and two egg breakfast. We also got a pot of bread which was delicious.  Generous portion of bacon and good potatoes. Potatoes could use a bit more salt though...

Great venue overall..nice space between tables. Two people for breakfast cost about $40.  We would go back again.

I heard that the food was good at Rise & shine and was happy I finally had the opportunity to try it. I decided to go to the Flamingo location. I walked in and loved the decor and seeing the staff in their PJ's. The place wasn't packed at all but for some reason we had to wait for the hostess to seat us. When she finally did approach us, there was no smile on her face and a lack of enthusiasm to say the least. She almost looked as though we had disturbed her. Whoa! She grabbed the menus and told us to follow her.. still no "hi welcome in" nothing.  Since she didn't ask, before I followed her I asked if there was a booth available, she snapped at me and said we were headed to a booth. Whoa again! That alone left a bad taste in all of our mouths. Our waitress was very friendly and upbeat. After waiting some time for our order, I was disappointed with my chicken and waffles. The chicken was bland but my waffle was yummy. My friend loved her french toast and everything else was mediocre. To be honest for 3 people and a $86 tab for a ok breakfast with a side of bad attitude I think this will be my first and last visit to Rise & Shine.

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in town.. I've had the Portuguese sausage and eggs, Buffalo fried chicken and eggs and of course steak and eggs twice! Just sayin.. the food is good and the service is excellent! Bruce was fast and accurate also.. they have the best pajamas!
Great food, nice people. Lovely space. I only wish they did a side salad:(. Otherwise a very welcomed edition to the 'hood.
Krys is awesome one the best servers and the rest of the staff was really nice as well too . The food was really delicious especially the French toast and the steak.

The food is delicious.  BUT. It's also very pricey and the serving sizes are super small for the kids plates. For a family of 4, 2 adult and 2 kids, it's an over $50 bill just for some breakfast. I'd rather go to Blueberry Hill that's also delicious, yet affordable (a $30 bill), and the portion sizes are better.  This place nickel and dimes you for everything, they charged $1 for a small side of ranch.  So while the food is incredibly tasty, it's just not worth it for the price. We won't be back anytime soon. 4 stars for taste 2 for price.
The food is AWESOME! The service is GREAT! Big country style plates & very affordable! Me and my fiance will definitely be coming back!!!

Being a breakfast lover at anytime of the day, I was happy to see that they serve it all day long.  We waited (four of us) for about 20 minutes (arrived at 1:15 on Memorial Day) and ended up at an outside (non covered) table.  Thank goodness the desert heat hadn't started yet and the clouds from Mt.Charleston were drifting over us as this would not have been acceptable.  In fact..for Las Vegas..you can have outdoor dining but it really should be 100% covered.  The hostess took our drink orders and served them promptly, but had to wait too long to place our order.  But the reason why I didn't give this place a 5* rating was because it took so long to get our 3 (2 adult and 1 child) meals!  Way.  Too.  Long.  It took almost 45 minutes!  Plus, I had to ask the hostess for water and coffee refill at which she quickly (the only speedy part) did and felt bad about our wait time and comped us 2 more apple juices for the kids.  

The food finally arrived and all very good: Buffalo style chicken breast and eggs, build your own omelette and silver dollar pancakes for the kids.  In fact..all the food was so tasty and plentiful..but the wait was too much (albeit nothing arrived cold).

My first time here I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs with my steak temperature being medium rare. When my food came to the table, it was made as requested if not better than I had asked for and it was so good that I had to come back for it again. Unfortunately the second time I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs the steak was absolutely terrible. As the first time I came in, I ordered my steak at a medium rare temperature and my steak came out completely burnt. I tried to use A1 sauce for my steak but because it was so burnt the A1 sauce couldn't take out the charcoal taste. I wasn't able to take another bite of my food because I was so disgusted. Being a place for steak and eggs, it's definitely not living up to the name and I'm definitely not going back.

Great service from Tyler!   Wonderful breakfast with my mom & grandma.  This place has only been opened a week but they have breakfast down to a tee!  Chicken & waffles were cooked perfectly and service was fantastic.  Definitely will be back :-).

Kaysea told me about this location when we were both in line at Starbucks yesterday, she is an amazing person. I ordered the spice rubbed rib eye chilaquiles, the flavor was amazing and I got a colorful mixture. The squeezed orange juice was great. The waitresses and all the staff had the place going like clockwork, things ran smoothly from what I observed. I recommend this place for sure. One small thing, I must have misunderstood the menu; for I had three squeezed orange juices and I didn't see anything about being charged each time for an orange juice.
The food was good. The restaurant was too dark. I need to see at morning breakfast place. It felt dirty. My son and his family love the place. I won't go back
First time here at rise and shine. Ordered me a "loco moco" . Best one I've ever and customer service great! Definitely will be coming back .
Over priced breakfast for mediocre food. They don't know if they want to sell socks or meals. Pick one and master it. Their uniforms(pajamas) show in the service "lozy". Never again

Amberly was my waitress and she was awesome . She helped me choose what to eat since I was so indecisive. And she recommended the steak house omelette which was delicious ! Perfect for when you want some steak but not too much . She always kept making sure my coffee was nice and warm and the service was great ! I will totally be eat here again !

Went there this morning. I had the chicken and waffles, and my friend had the s'mores waffles. We were both blown away. I was given the cinnamon stick infused bottle of maple syrup, and my friend was impressed by the way the Cinnamon Toast Crunch (the graham crackers on her s'mores waffles) were baked into the waffle. The marshmallows were toasted, much to her delight, and the chocolate chips were infused into the batter of the waffle. 

My chicken was fried exactly as it should be. No extra grease dripping off of it. The waffle was baked and crispy, I was very impressed. The maple syrup was good, although while infused with real cinnamon stick I couldn't really tell much of a difference.

The waitress we had was excellent, and while not so friendly, was a perfect server. I personally don't want conversation and strangers pretending they're my friends at breakfast, so this was perfect for me, although lonely hearts that need serving staff to be their new buddies will be disheartened. Be wary if you're a Millenial that needs everyone to be approving of their alternate lifestyle and requires everyone to care about it. These people don't, they have a job to accomplish and do it both rapidly and exceptionally.

Five stars for the staff and the food. Kudos to the cooks that I couldn't personally tip and congratulate.

I ordered the Rib Eye. It was cooked to perfection! The pot if bread is delicious. The cream cheese dipping complements the pot of bread perfectly. The hasbrown is fresh and crispy. Coffee is strong just as I want it. Tyler, the chef - family owner, is very knowledgeable and friendly. Jerry, my server, is great. Will definitely be back with my family.

Went to Rise and Shine at around 1030am this morning and was quoted 30 to 35 min... But if we chose to ask for 1st available it would more than likely be sooner. It is after all a soft opening and was willing to give them a break when it hit the 60 minute mark. We heard the hosts saying we were about to be sat next... We like to keep an eye on things UNTIL a group of 3 walked in and approached the hostess. They said something to the host who walked away then came back and told them they would be sat next. Thinking this HAD TO BE some sort of mistake I waited to see what would happen. A minute later the host called them to take them to what was suppose to be MY TABLE!!!! So I went to ask the hostess's what happened and why they got sat first and so fast... They told me it was the owner's best friend and therefore had priority seating.WOW  oh and that I would be seated shortly... Hmmm no thanx you obviously don't want my business. This is my first and probably only yelp review ever... Being in the restaurant industry myself in usually very understanding but this just set me off..Off to Bite around the corner

Service was terrible. Our waitress, Katie, took ten minutes to take a drink order and then another ten to bring it. It took her ANOTHER 30 minutes to take our order, after having to be asked, and another 35 for it to come out (obviously that wasn't her fault). The food was delicious, however the service was awful. The girl at the register didn't ask how it was and when I offered up that our service was horrible she said "well that's okay." When I told her I would leave a review online she said "thank you." 

We will not be returning as this is not the first awful experience we've had. Another time we came and the kitchen was flooding, and on another experience we had horrible service as well. It's unfortunate because the food is so good.

A go-to place for a great breakfast! They have an extensive. Menu with lots of healthy choices...like make your own yoghurt parfait with fresh berries. Also have all the traditional items as well - and make sure you try the "pot-o-bread" - yum!

Horrible food and service waiters are horrible my kids drinks was empty food burnt my girls food tasted like dirt only the steak was ok just horrible Brody as are waiter did not check on our table if we needed anything like drinks or napkins witch was very much needed very bad waiter I can't believe that he even has a job there patty melt very oily and everything over cooked under staffed under educated about the restaurant bizz I will make every effort on spreading the word that this place is horrible I should have went to egg works
Food is Delicious!! Ordered French Press, Go go Juice and Ribeye Steak and Eggs. Everything was bomb diggity!!  our server Ashley was amazing and took great care of us!
Amberly provides great service on top of serving great food. The crew and I recommend it!

This experience is definitely a lot better than the last..

Shocked it isn't packed, seeing as how it's New Year's day.  Got sat right away. Our server, Roy, did an amazing job taking care of us. I ordered the California Turkey bagel sandwich with the turkey and bacon on the side (vegetarian) and added grilled onions, which came with fries, and the bf ordered a Belgium waffle. My sandwich was huge, and tasted delicious. However, there were barely any grilled onions :( he enjoyed his waffle, and ordered a French press, that was tasty. I hadn't been here in a while and forgot they drown EVERYTHING in parsley, and my fries were covered in it, which destroyed the taste.  Only 4 stars for the parsley and skimpy toppings, everything else 5 stars.

This is my go to breakfast place whenever I'm in the Vegas area.  Ashley has been my server at least twice now and she's excellent and takes care of all of her customers.  Oh yeah, and try that Bread in a cup... it's awesome
Food is good but they are slow getting it to you. But the good service makes up for them being slow. Worth another try.
Came about noonish and got seated right away. They have the best tomato soup with grilled cheese toast! They also get to wear the cutest pajamas!! Our server Sarah was also so nice and attentive

Wow, wow, wow!! Amazingly delicious food, generous portions, super friendly service, and cute ambiance inside this restaurant. We tried it for the first time this week, and will certainly be back. Best french toast ever!!

Food was okay, a bit over cooked. The orange juice was great and fresh squeezed. The service was good, people were really nice. 3 stars because I think it's a bit over priced and over rated for what it is, I would still rather go to Egg Works down the street!!

I went here for my birthday and it was maybe the 4th time we had been there. It was nice as usual. The only downfall I would say is paying $5 for a glass of orange juice. The "cup of bread" is delicious. I usually get the chicken, avo, spinach egg white omelette. It is usually very good, but the last few times the avocado was hard and tasted weird. It might just be out of season. Otherwise, this is a great place to eat breakfast!

This was our first time here and we both ordered the same thing, so I can't speak for their entire menu, but what we ordered was great.  And the portions were HUGE!!  Great service too.  Ashley was the best!  Answered all of our questions and was extremely pleasant.  Will definitely be coming back to try different things on the menu.

This place is total scam!!over priced and food was cold!!!the first impression I had from this place was when I saw the parking lot and place was so busy,so I thought it had to be great place to get the decent breakfast,the service was good so the coffee,but I can be careless about the rest....!!
Save yourself some time and money and don't waisted at this establishment!!
I like this place. Thought i had reviewed before. Very good food, great service and nice breakfast spot feel.. i go there about once a month.

Cheerful ambiance, but with quarter filled restaurant, service was more than inadequate. We sat and waited at length before we were greeted and waited even longer for our beverages. Prices were steep for basic breakfast. Food was not memorable. It will be very unlikely that we visit agin.
Had a great breakfast yesterday. Food was so yummy and our server Ashley was awesome, so sweet and kind.
Great food!!! Great service! Ashely (Red hair) was the best!!!!! Checked on us constantly made sure we were taken care of. Best of service I received while visiting Vegas. Go Broncos!

Better than I thought it would be. When we sat down I was a little taken back by the higher prices but the portions and the quality more than offset the prices.Coffee was excellent,  food was excellent and the service was excellent, well worth it.

I totally love that the serving employees were wearing pajamas.
Great new breakfast place very needed in the area. Huge patio seating and healthy portions of good food. We will be back!
Second time here and luckily we sat in the same spot with a great view. It was a bit warm inside today but our Server Jerry was just as cheerful and fun as we remember!  Well be back!

Visited this place for the first time. The breakfast are delicious, the service is quick. I had the make your own omelette with hash browns. My husband had the cornbeef hash. Umm. You must try their pot of bread which is a combination of cinnamon roll with a biscuit.  This place is good  for the entire family.

On the menu

2  Ultimate steak and egg breakfast plates.

Not enough can be said for good food but poor service
Puts a damper on the whole experience.

The steak was juicy and tender, right do beds
Hash brown  potatoes average...need seasoning 
Eggs cooked fine

Coffee cold and lacked strength 
Waited for creamer...never came
Waited for toast. ....never came 
Waited for apology...never came

We won't be back...other surrounding options better.. we came 20 miles away from Vegas based on reviews
Never Again.

I have been here before so I decide to return for lunch. The place had a few tables sat and wasn't that busy. The food took longer than it should have and my guest ordered chicken fingers and was charged for ranch. My burger was plain, no lettuce, tomato, just the cheese and bacon I ordered on it. To many other places to go in Vegas for better food sand service.

I agree with all of the other reviews. The food was excellent. The service was as expected in a place like this. The portions were fair for the price. I had the ribeye and eggs. My daughter ordered off the kids menu. My wife got a fried  chicken sandwich. We were all happy with it.
Best breakfast place in Las Vegas.  The strawberry and watermelon fresh juice was refreshing. I had ultimate steak and eggs and it was delicious.  My kids loved the cinnamon pot bread.

Really like this spot. They always accommodate  my special requests no problem. My daughter LOVES the red velvet pancakes and the s'mores waffles. I do the ham steak and egg whites with fruit. Always perfect

This is my first time eating at this restaurant and the atmosphere is really nice. They have pretty flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Right away, Amberly, assisted us. She recommended the Hazelnut Nutella coffee and it was delicious. She was very efficient and has great customer service. I ordered the S'mores Waffle platter and it was very delicious. We had a great server and great food -- this is defiantly a go-to breakfast restaurant with your family!

We came here after failed attempts at other brunch places: griddle cakes, dw bistro and biscuits 2 burgers were all full. We'll  be back to b2b since we got a Groupon. It was busy here but not bad like the others previously mentioned. The place was really big, especially in comparison to the others and that's why we decided to go here. We came in and it took a little while for the people ahead of us to be seated and when they were the maitre d took a phone call instead and tried to help someone with a misplaced bracelet? Now, why do some  establishments preference people who call to someone who is either next in line or already being helped? I'll never get it. A good business would put the caller on hold. We decided to to sit down at the waiting area because I thought this might be the proper way to get help and plus my arms were getting tired of holding the baby in her car seat. But as you would've guessed, as soon as i sit down a couple comes in and gets help right away. It's s good thing they wanted to sit at the bar, so it didn't take long for me to be seated when I stepped back to the line. These people need to be more aware on who got there first and at least acknowledge that you were. This is our 2nd time here and it seems like majority of 5he staff are stressed out. My server was just ok nothing above average. Didn't ask if we wanted more to drink from our skinny glasses of juice and smoothies, which I do have to commend them for their taste. The ribeye was supposed to be medium but seemed dry at the same time, maybe it was because of the sear. I would recommend medium rare if you like medium. The chilequilas were good and tasty. The salmon on the benedict was too salty but the poached eggs were done just right, especially the yoke. Not too dry and not too runny. And the pot bread is always good. The cooks might be shortstaffed  and rushed and the maitre d and servers have room for improvement, other than that the place is nice, roomy and good for kids and the amount of food you get for your buck is a deal.

First time here. Service was good but food was just okay, nothing really special. I ordered their ultimate steak something (medium well) and it has a burnt taste. Latte wasn't good, Sambalatte is way better. Waffle was burnt too! Wouldn't mind giving this place a second chance.

Wow! Love this place! Amazing food, I had the New York Benedict Bagel and the eggs were perfect.  My husband had the melt-in-your-mouth ribeye. Every detail is there down to the Cinnamon sticks in the Maple syrup. And the service? Home away from home. Laid-back Christmas morning at Grandma's kinda breakfast. Our server was so fun! We can't wait to bring our kids to Rise-and-Shine (a.k.a. Nicole's place) to meet the family and enjoy a good food coma. Don't miss this place!!!

First off, food is always a 5 star. Service however is usually a 2 at best. This Sunday, I actually had a good server, which Is why I waited to do a review. I wanted to request to no be sat in a certain persons section since the last 3 times I have gone here, I've sat in his section. I got a new guy this time and wish I remembered his name. He was attentive and did his job properly and they were moderately busy. 

The "other" server, in the past has been outright rude. Not the best way to start a morning. We sat outside, waited about 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. By then we were ready to order food and our drinks. While I was giving my food order, he was texting on his phone and missed my order. I had to do I again, then the meal was wrong. I got a rude look as he took my plate back instead of just fixing the one wrong item. So I sat with no food for about 10-15 minutes while the amazing cooks replaced the meal. 

The next time I had this server, it was barely busy, but apparently 2 servers called in sick, it was a holiday weekend. Waited over 45 minutes for our food, this same server never came to the table to fill drinks or explain. I walked to the kitchen to get my own coffee where he grabbed the cups from my hands to fill it. Also, greeted with an attitude. When I was asked by the manager how my meal was, I said "food was great, service and server were terrible. " she replied simply "oh".  I think the service here needs to be put on attention. If you're not a morning person, a breakfast restaurant might not be a great career choice franky.

I visited here on February 18th, 2017. I am underwhelmed with the service. I arrived with my group around 10:00 AM on a Saturday and waited inside with the 35 other people waiting for their tables. Since it was pouring rain and there wasn't anywhere to stand everyone was packed like sardines inside the waiting area (which wasn't a problem, as no one can control the weather.). I was quietly chatting with my group and was rudely told to "move away from the counter so people can pay" by the cashier Braden. We ignored this comment and went on with our meal. Food was great and our waiter was awesome, I believe his name was Roy. He is the reason this review is getting 2 stars instead of one. When we finished our meal we met again with Braden to pay for our bill. He rudely told us he would not split our check and then went on to embarrass us as we tried to figure out the situation by shouting to the entire line of people behind us that he would "be right with them after us.". We paid for everything and left quickly to get out of the awkward situation.

Unfortunately he ruined our experience and we will not be returning because we don't feel very welcome. He seemed to be training possibly but was left to handle a busy Saturday morning by himself without a manager and didn't do well at all. I am disappointed in the way he handled our situation and the way he embarrassed us. He should not be handling cashier if he doesn't have the people skills to keep a situation under control without publicly embarrassing an entire family. Hopefully he will continue to learn and will hopefully not do this to anyone else who visits.

I will be sharing my experience with my friends and family.

My family and I ordered the famous steak and eggs, eggs Benedict, cinnamon toast crunch French toast, and pot of bread. The pot of bread was recommended on yelp but I was disappointed that it was smaller than the Yelp descriptions. It was still delicious and my husband also loved the steak seasoning. In fact, everything was delicious and we would definitely go back again.
Desire was an awesome waitress. Best breakfast place in Vegas. Try the cup of bread. The eggs are cooked just the way you want. Love the fresh juice too

Always good and consistent. Staff is incredibly friendly, there's never any wait because the place is so large. Definitely one of my favorite for breakfast joints. Special thanks to amberlee (not sure of spelling) for the amazing service! Definitely would recommend and definitely will becoming back

Recently I treated my daughter to breakfast at Rise and Shine. It has a lovely rustic look, very clean and neat. The staff was very friendly. Now let's talk about the food, can you say Delicious. Yes it's a  little  pricy  but it's  well worth the price. Go check it out and check out the pj's the servers have on. Also love those umbrellas

Great breakfast spot if you're looking for something off-Strip. Kudos to the cooks for substituting the chicken in my Chicken Avocado Egg Whites omelette for sausage. The kid sitting across from my table was killing the fluffiest pancakes I've ever seen in Las Vegas. I'll try not to care about carbs the next time I come.

I love this spot! The great decor is only slightly less pleasant than the staff, and that's just because they're always on point. I love having this place so close to me, which makes it even easier to roll in with my ridiculous pajamas on. Even though there are a few awesome breakfast joints around here, this is always my go-to. The food is the best pre-noon fare I've found in a long, long time. I've now had almost every item on the menu, and can honestly say there isn't a single thing I don't love here (the red velvet pancakes take the cake though, [pun only slightly intended]). The only downside is the occasional wait, but that can't be helped when you find a gem like this.

Rise and Shine is very good.  I've visited this location 3 times in the last couple months, and it never disappoints.  Food is freshly prepared, and the service is good.  I really like how you can order a fresh French Press coffee that they bring to your table.  Not your typical breakfast joint watered down coffee.  Cup O Bread is a must.

This is my new favorite breakfast place in Vegas. We both ordered a steak and egg variation, I had the steak and omelette and Lily had the ultimate steak and eggs. First off, the steak was a quality cut of meat. I've been to more that my fair share of breakfast places that serve you a grissled piece of meat that represents what should be steak, this place is not that. Our eggs were delicious and the hash browns were a perfect blend of crispy and soft. I ordered a blended fruit drink and was pleasantly surprised by fresh fruit drink, not a sugary canned drink. And finally on to the biscuit, as soon as I saw it I knew, it was just like my grand mother made, delicious. If I had another hand they would have three thumbs up... Eat here...

My husband and I ate here a couple of months ago and we totally enjoyed the busy atmosphere, great service, and the food that was plentiful and delicious.  Breakfast for 2 set us back $50+ with tip.  So, we decided to keep it as a special occassion, not an eating out frequently ( as we do) kinda place. Ironically, our waitress told us prices were set to go up soon.  I inquired if we could purchase 6 of the pot of bread to carry out.  She checked and told me $1.75 each, which seemed reasonable.

Yesterday, I invited a friend out for lunch, raving about how great it was.  We arrived, and the first thing I noticed was how empty the place was...I ordered the 3 eggs on top of corned beef hash dish.  I chose this over 2 other selections, located in the same area in the menu, because it included that delicious pot of bread...after asking the waitress how much it would be to order  separately...$3.50! (after being quoted $1.75 few weeks before.)  That was kind of a turn off.  My friend ordered a banana parfait, (for $9.50) it looked, and she said tasted delicious, however I noticed that the cook threw a couple of sliced banana at the bottem of the glass, no pudding, just 2 lonely banana slices at the bottem, and pudding at the top, no layering of the pudding.  It looked skimpy.

My corned beef dish arrived.  Again, skimpy portion, and no sliced potatos, just chipped beef and onions, I asked the waitress and she had no clue or offer to remedy the problem.  Only that thats the recipe, they make in-house.  The flavors were not what I expected, alot of sage, very disappointing.  Oh, and yes, they did raise their prices.

We were so excited for a new place to go and relax, and to take our friends to, and, unfortunately, their clever touches are not enough for us to go back again.  They had a good thing going, but have lost us as customers, greedy pricing, and shorting of food does not keep diners.

I have to say I was excited to try new place for breakfast. The interior looks really nice and servers were also good. Unfortunately the organization isn't very good. Wait to be seated is kind a long and not to mention 20 minutes wait to get our meals .. All that might be forgiven taking in mind that the place is new and needs to find its system yet . However when we got our gogo fresh juice with rotten cucumber as decoration and also bluberies in the fruit cup were all rotten..that just killed my taste buds.. Our server offered us new juice as we didn't drink even half of it but I just couldn't. . At least I was expecting not to be charge for something that should not even leave the kitchen which we were.
So ... long wait to be seated , long wait for food which tasted good, that yes ..but fruit and veggies should be fresh in my opinion .. Would not go back ..

**** management has responded and basically said, that the diaper changer is properly installed  a with two of four bolts pulling out of the wall. Riiiiight. ******

Let me start by saying that this review will have more to do with management's complete and utter disregard for child safety, and less to do with the food/service, which has always been adequate, but nothing to rave about.

About nine months ago we ate breakfast here and I needed to change my baby's diaper. I put him on the diaper changer and notice it kind of jerked out from the wall and seemed unstable, I finished the diaper change and realize that the four bolts that hold it into the wall were completely stripped and the whole changer was pulling out of the wall. This is obviously completely unsafe, and to me, an emergency, considering that this charger is over 3 feet off the ground, an infant could easily fracture their skull should they fall onto tile from that height. I immediately informed management of the problem, and instead the manager made up a flimsy excuse about teenagers breaking the diaper changer.

About 3 months later we decided to try again, changer was half fixed, the screws in the top had been replaced, but the bottom screws were still pulling out of the wall, I mean, you can literally pull the changer away from the wall, which of course will eventually cause the top screws to pull out again.

I mentioned it to a different manager and she took the opportunity to tell me how awful and crazy the old manager was, instead of just fixing the changer. She did then tell me that it was okay because two of the screws were in. I nicely explained that those changers are supposed to be installed correctly, using all four bolts, so that they are safe, and can hold the weight posted. She ensured me it would be fixed.

Guess what? Three months later, still not fixed. Still pulling out of the wall. Rise and shine complete lack of care for infant and child safety makes me question what other things they do that are less than safe.

We will never, ever be back, as I have given management almost a year to correct this extremely unsafe situation, and unfortunately it's going to take someone's infant getting injured or worse before they take this seriously. If you aren't going to fix it, at least remove the changer all together, instead of risking the safety of every child placed on that changer, whose parent may not notice the loose bolts.

Shame on you rise and shine! I will encourage all my friends and family with small children to avoid your restaurants now, and in the future.

Super cute restaurant with so many wonderful options! First of service was amazing Frankie took very good care of us and helped us with our many questions.  Strawberry juice is the ticket!!! Waffle was everything and def will be recommending this to my friends
portions were really really big! ham was dry I had to drown it in ketchup. they gave us the wrong bill, orange juice tasted funny,

I have been trying eggs Benedict all over town and now have a favorite. The Avo-Veggie eggs Benedict was amazing. I could eat it every day. The eggs were cooked to perfection and still hot. The avacado was mashed so it didn't slide all over and just the right amount of hollandaise. The balsamic drizzle sent it over the top. 
My only disappointment was my soda was flat. But not a big deal.

I went here for breakfast this morning and was truly disappointed! The service was awkward, the server came back twice to ask us about our order. Both mine and my boyfriends meals came out cold and his corned beef and hash was slightly burnt. We asked for the check halfway through our meal and left without finishing. I was hoping to like this place with all of the great reviews but I will not return !
Perfect friendly place for families!  Only no changing tables, but it's made up by the friendly staff!  Thanks Tyler for your awesome service!

Absolutely incredible! My son had the bananas foster Belgian waffles, I had the crispy cinnamon raisin French toast. He finished everything on his plate, from the orange zested whipped cream to the bananas to the Belgian waffle, the ice cream. EVERYTHING!!!
Mine was just as good. The first impression as I walked in the door was that we would probably have to wait for a table. Nope, seated right away. Order was taken in a timely manner, drinks as well as meal. 
Make sure to look up toward the sky while there. You'll see what I mean. Great meal, great service, great place. We will be back.

Went in for Sunday breakfast, it was delicious! The chicken and waffles are amazing!  Chicken was fresh breaded and cooked to order, no frozen fried chicken here!! Service was ok, she was friendly just not overly attentive (especially with a coffee drinker at the table) but for great quality I can overlook having to ask for EVERY refill of coffee! Check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

Had breakfast here for the first time. Arrived about 11:30a on Monday and was seated immediately. Server wearing pajamas came right over to take our orders. The menu is expansive and has lots of great and different choices. Portions are large. The chicken fried steak was the best we've ever had anywhere and was very tender and came with the gravy on the side. The smoked salmon eggs Benedict with spinach was amazing too. We'll definitely be back.

Really good food, friendly staff. I really enjoyed my fried new York steak and eggs. The steak itself was a little overdone, but delicious non the less. Will definitely return for the chicken and waffles.

I ordered the Lox omelette.  Huge disappointment given the $14 price.  They over cooked the eggs to the point of leatheryness.  It was way salty too.  I did say something and they offered to make me another omelette or something else off the menu, however I didn't have time for a redo.  Probably not going back, at least for a while.

Walked in the back door like we had been there before, but no it was our first time.  My bestie Jeff C. & I were starving & really excited over the breakfast pix we saw on Yelp.  

Love the decor & colorful upside down umbrellas & humorous other knick knack (socks, pix).  Every meal we past was fried or covered in whipped cream.  Possible that's what they are known for & why they got so many stars.

As we were seated, I had to grab a napkin to wipe off my seat, which I hate to have to do.  It has become a pet peev of mine.  I do like that as a breakfast place they have the jelly, hot sauce & sugar on the table.  

Collin our server was very nice & quick.  He also had recommendations when we asked what to drink & about their specialty 'pot of bread.'  I was not impressed w/ the taste of the pot of bread, but the presentation was very cute.  It tasted like bread w/ a slight hint of cinnamon, nothing special.  

My friend usually gets iced tea so is a great critic of it so when I saw his face after the first dirst drink I knew it wasn't good.  He described it as iced tea made w/ regular tap water.  Gross!  Collin recommended the Watermelon Strawberry juice, which was probably the best part of Jeffs meal.  He got the Bangers Omelette & I did the Lox Omelette, which I perfect at home.  My omelette was ok.  It was unevenly filled.  One bite was cream cheese, one salmon, on capers & horrible onions that I picked out.  They serve Lavazza coffee which is ok.  

I will give this place one more shot.  My dad loved the Loco Moco & I see its w/ beef & spam so dad needs to try it!  Also, next time I'll try something fried like the country fried steak.

Horrible service, got in around 11:45 tons of tables open still waited a good 5 mins to be seated. Indoors were incredibly cold, we decided to move towards the outdoors seating. Waited to even get water to the table, had to go inside myself and get silverware. Over 45 mins later looking around for our food, we were told the large parties food just got pushed out ours will be next. & the prices are rather high for an off the strip breakfast place.
This was our first time at rise and shine a steak and egg place and we loved it! Amberley was super fantastic, Service was outstanding and the food was amazing! Can't wait to come back

Came in this morning looking for a quick bite and ended up with biscuits and gravy, sausage, and hash browns - and let's not forget the cup o bread! 

Service and food were great - can't wait to come back!

We were looking forward to trying this place. After being told it was a 45 minute wait the hostess never put our name down. Once we finally sat we waiting for nearly an hour and never got our food. The waiter came over once and told us our food would be right out, 20 minutes later it wasn't. We asked for the check because we were sick of waiting and the manager said she would take care of everything (I found this extremely funny being we never did get our food so what was she actually taking care of) and she asked us come back sometime. (Ha)

On the plus side, the orange juice ad the French press werr great.

My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and really liked it. Last Friday my mom was in town and we decided to come here for breakfast before going to do some touristy stuff. My mom ordered the carrot apple juice. When the server, Freddy or Frankie? brought out the drinks he dumped her juice as well as my orange juice all over us. My mom was wearing a white shirt and I light shoes. He was very apologetic and came back with a busboy and cleaned up. However when we got our bill all that was applied was a friend's and family discount which came to about $8. My mom's shirt was ruined, my white sneakers were ruined, and we had to go home and change which messed up our plans. 
We understand accidents happen but no manager came out and when we told the girl at checkout what happened and that we'd like more of a discount she initially did not want to help at all. She ended up giving an additional $20 off but did not seem concerned when we showed her our clothing. This was not enough to replace the stained clothes and shoes and even after several washes they're ruined. Disappointed in how this was handled. Expected more from a non chain restaurant.
Its our first time at rise and shine and were glad we tried it :) , theyre very generous on serving and the price is not that bad ...i highly recomend it ....
Food was real good, service was a little slow. It was nice to sit outside and look at the mountains. Definitely will be back for the pot o bread, delish.
Service was very slow and price was a bit on the steep side for breakfast.   Food was good when we got it. May try it again before we leave.

I like to think of myself as a breakfast connoisseur. I love breakfast, it's my favorite meal of the day. This place is top notch!  Occasionally there's a short wait, but trust me, it's worth it. The atmosphere is fun and unique. In the waiting area they sell funny knee high socks and pajamas. 

There's big bright flowers on the ceiling that spin. The waiters and waitresses wear pajamas. I've been here 3 or 4 times now and I've had excellent service every time.  

My favorite things to order here is the French press coffee and the pot of bread. What's a pot of bread you ask? It's pure heaven in a little ceramic cut. Similar to a cinnamon roll but no icing. It's usually served with butter and warm cream cheese like sauce for dipping. It will make your tummy really happy, I promise! Once you try it, you'll be hooked! 

Now hurry up and get on over there and order yourself a pot of bread!!
Wow!!!!  Huge pancakes!!  Make sure you realize that the pancakes are HUGE. You can put in a half order, or maybe share. Great food. Great service!!!  Loved our server, Amberly!

Oh my! We LOvE this Place!!!! At first I didn't think it would be as intimate and lovely as the one in southern highlands.... But it exceeded my expectation. Now that I live on the west side I'm so HAPPy they have this location!
The service was outstanding! I cannot remember our servers name for the life of me... ( I wanna give her the recognition she deserves... She was a beautiful African American woman with pink pjs on who was just a delight!) 
... She answered so many questions for us with the new additions to the menu! ... The fresh juice was delish! 
My steak was so good ;-) the pancakes OMG I swear they're sprinkled with Angels dust!!!!!! So Good!!!!!!!!!!!!
.... The burrito is the bomb also! Yum yum yum!!!!!!!!!! 
You gotta check this place out... Pot-o-bread is TO DiE FOR!!!!!!!!! 
We  this place!
Really good food! Get a lot for your money. Amber was our waitress. Extremely sweet and helpful.
Went here with 6 friends for breakfast. Was amazing! Great service and reasonable pricing. Will be going back

A really fun place to have breakfast! The food is good and the atmosphere makes the experience enjoyable! 
All the waiters and waitresses wear pajamas which I think is a really fun touch. :) 
The food is decently priced very comparable to egg works or ihop price range. 
I went for lunch and had a chicken Caesar salad which was very good and the portion was large. A member of our party got the steak and eggs which he also enjoyed. 
A cute place and service was fast and friendly. Will return :)

Service is, well, non-existent. Went in on a Wednesday, late morning--not busy or crowded, and sat in our booth for 10 minutes before I managed to flag a server. She said she'd bring out coffee for us and have a server take our order. Waited another five minutes, watching a server walk past us half a dozen times, with no coffee or server. We walked out. Won't go back. Egg Works is a couple blocks down the street and consistently delivers great service and food.

I've been here about three times and each time has been different. The food taste and quality is inconsistent and the wait is pretty long usually. The last time I went, it seemed like they didn't have enough tables to fill the dining space, thus slower turnaround.
Great food (can't go wrong with pot of bread)!!  Desiree was wonderful!! Super genuine and kind!

We've been here several times and never had a bad experience. Today was no exception. Food is delicious and service is excellent. Our server today was Ashley, she's super nice and has great customer service!

For my first time all in all was not a bad experience. Restaurant was very clean and we were sat right away. The menu has a good variety, although the beverages were a bit overpriced. The food portions are good for what u pay. The steak I had was charred to much but under cooked on the inside. I would come back, just need to try something different.
Horrible service.  Waited 10 mins for seat, then 15 mins to order, then over 35 mins for food which never came.  We left after almost an hour of never getting our meal.  Never trying this again.

3.5. Big portions, delicious breakfast bagel sandwich, friendly service, and didn't get crazy busy. Food came out a bit slowly, but it wasn't unbearable. Was a tiny bit annoyed that my sandwich came with potatoes instead of french fries as listed on the menu; otherwise I might've rounded up.

I want to give a 3.5 star as I keep switching between 3 and 4... but not an option! Came here on fourth of July for breakfast around 8am. This restaurant is HUGE, tons of seating both indoor and outdoor. We were seated immediately, no wait. The interior is so cute and colorful. and the servers are in pajamas, creating a unique experience. Our server Ashley was awesome! I would give her 5 stars alone but the food was not great. I ordered an omelet with sausage, jalapeno and onion, nothing standout about this... could probably make a better one myself. The hashbrown are where they lost major points. They were literally potato chip shreds. They were sooo hard and burnt, I think honestly the worst hashbrowns I have ever had. The toast was the highlight of the meal somehow, although the butter was not soft. This place is pretty expensive for breakfast and although it is cute and the service was good I was completely disappointed by the food.
Great service and great food.  The bread pots are delicious!  Love their chicken fried steak and turkey sausage.  Big servings.

Great food for reasonable price. I had the chilaquiles. Very good. Couldn't finish it cause it was so huge. Only thing that could have made it better was if they went a little easier on the sauce. Otherwise great. Had a bite of my moms steakhouse omelette and fell in love. Definitely getting that next time I come. And the hash browns are to die for. Not to mention they freshly squeeze their juices here. My new favorite breakfast spot.

I was really expecting a lot from this place and came out feeling very disappointed. To start, I could t believe how long we had to wait to get seated. We waited roughly about an hour for our party of three to be seated. Once seated we waited a while to be helped. Our waitress was not friendly or attentive, her attitude towards. As for the food, I ordered the breakfast burrito (steak and chorizo) and the pot of bread. The burrito was ok, nothing special or tasty, and the pot of bread was very tasteless. It was literally a plain piece of bread with a bit of cinnamon inside and a side of butter. I don't think I'll come back, or recommend the place to anyone else.
