I did not like the insane amount of time one has to wait to be seated, the quality of the food or the poor service.

Service was great. Cup of bread was delicious. I don't remember the name of the waffle I got but it was basically a smores waffle with cinnamon toast crunch on it, delicious even though they didn't bring it out with syrup and took forever to actually get it and start eating.
Steak was cooked perfectly, just how I asked. I asked for over medium eggs and received fully cooked fried eggs. I really wanted my steak with some yolk.
For the waffle dish we asked for over medium eggs and sausage, we received scrambled eggs and bacon. That error is hard to over look because it is in no way similar to what we ordered. Paid $35 for those two meals and it definitely was not worth it in my opinion. The steak and eggs were a good portion for the price but definitely not the waffle. Probably won't be coming back.

Food was great, and Ashley did a great job! The only reason I give it four stars is that we were sat but no one came to our table for a while. Not sure who our server was supposed to be but we are glad we got Ashley. She was very friendly and efficient. The loco moco which she suggested was really good.
Great start and chilequilles and red velvet pancakes. Don't forget the bread in a cup... delicious!

This location sucks. Unfriendly servers and the price I paid for the nasty food I got wasn't worth it. I ordered their corned beef hash and I didn't even finish one bite because it was so gross! I paid $13 for eating just the eggs that came with it and the pot of bread, which the server forgot to give to me and had to remind her, and it tasted like it's been reheated because the bread was stale already. Never going back to this location. The one at Southern Highlands is wayyyyy better!
Great place for breakfast but be prepared for a wait, this place is always busy! The service is more often than not, excellent and the servers have great personalities! I love the Go Go Green Juice.

This is my new favorite breakfast place in the city! I tried their S'mores Waffle & definitely didn't need to add syrup, it was sweet enough. 

I also tried their fresh juice, ordered watermelon & strawberry juice, great complement to my meal. 

Service was excellent! I will definitely come back whenever I'm in town!

We went here for the first time on a Saturday morning, me, my daughter and her two 5 year olds. We had about a 15 minute wait, which isn't bad for a breakfast place at 930 in the morning. We were seated and our waiter brought menus and took our drink orders quickly. The Orange juice is fresh squeezed and tasted amazing. The downside is that it's $4.25. I got biscuits and gravy, it was very good and the biscuits were outstanding. My daughter got eggs Benedict, which were good, but she said next time she'd order then without the balsamic vinegar. The hash browns are unique and so good.  The twins shared a 1+2+3 breakfast (eggs, bacon and pancakes) and it was the perfect amount for them to split.  The pancakes are yummy and the maple syrup is real and comes to the table warm with a cinnamon stick in the bottle. Delicious, but I would probably ask for it without the cinnamon next time. Service was quick and our waiter was attentive without being annoying. For the 2 adult meals, 1 kids meal, 2 sodas, 1 tea and 1 juice the bill was $45.

Wooooo-Hooo  I've had chicken fried steak in 9 different states and this is by far my absolute favorite! Absolutely in point, it was so good a tear almost came down my eye from the party in my mouth , the gravy was flavorful with a mild kick. My other half had the chicken and waffles and let me tell you that waffle was crack, the syrup dispenser had cinnamon sticks in there which added another dimension of lip-smacking flavor I didn't want to end. The portions are HUGE so good luck finishing the entire plate. It was our first visit and our server Samantha was very helpful and nice ( nice smile )since the menu is big and my wife is finicky. We will definitely be back for more of this deliciousness. If you want a party in your mouth and not worried about calories go by put that food in your mouth and enjoy it'll be worth it.

Great food, huge portions!  Definitely get the Ultimate! 
Eggs over easy! Pot bread just ok. Good coffee too!

The ribeye steak was tender and flavorful in the ultimate breakfast!  The watermelon and strawberry juice was bland and overpriced.  The waitress was average and the wait was long. I give the restaurant a three because it's just average.  I could take it or leave it on coming back again.

My friend asked, "you like steak, right?" I responded with a "DUH!" .. She said she had the perfect spot in mind for me, as I was in town visiting from Sacramento.

Instantly fell in love with this place. The ambience is super cute and the employees all seem upbeat and in a good mood. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table on a Saturday morning.

First things first - they were ON TOP of the coffee game, yo. I rarely had to wait for a coffee refill, it just kept coming around.

My second fave thing about my experience, was that I told my server about my "dilemma" - that I really wanted a steak but that I REALLY wanted an omelet too (fat kid probs) and she said oh yeah, just order the steak and eggs, and we can make the eggs into an omelet for ya, and you can just pay 50 cents per each veggie you want to add. Wow! Super awesome. So it stands, I had a steak cooked medium with a 3-egg omelet with veggies. It also came with a side of toast, and of course, potatoes. This place is the real deal, I fell in love with it and will be back soon! :)

I went to their new location this past Thursday with my wife (had gone to their other location once before). Come hungry! The portions are as good as they are large.  I had the ribeye and chilaquiles; the ribeye was cooked perfectly, the rub was delicious, and the meat was tender and flavorful; their take on the chilaquiles left nothing to be desired... just the right amount of spicy, cheesy, and delicious. I also tried some of my wife's banana frosted flakes pancakes; what a treat!

Pot o'bread was ridiculously good. Had a chicken and egg white omelet and it was delicious. Hubby had the ultimate steak and eggs and practically licked the plate clean. Our server Brody was helpful with the menu and was on top of drinks and coffee. Highly recommend them for breakfast. Left feeling happy and full.

My friend and I went to breakfast on a Thursday morning at the Flamingo location.  The staff was very friendly.  Adam was our server, who was helpful about the menu items and very attentive about our particular requests (water no ice, Cooking spray vs butter for the omelet, etc).

The steak and eggs breakfast was some of the best I have had in a while.  I enjoyed a treat with the Pot O'Bread, requesting the cream cheese syrup on the side instead of butter.  It was yummy-moan-worthy-goodness.

Their organic hot sauce has sadly spoiled me from all others.  If I use Tapatio, Cholula or Tabasco at another restaurant, I find myself thinking fondly of Rise & Shine's hot sauce... which I had to purchase.

My husband and I were so excited to try this place out! We LOVE breakfast!! When we arrived the hostess was pleasant enough and we were seated fairly quickly considering they only had maybe seven tables of customers. Our server was very nice, however this seemed to be his first server job. We ordered our food and no joke waited 25+ minutes for it to come out. This wasn't a huge deal as we were in no rush however the server NEVER checked in on us or offered anything while we were waiting. Zero acknowledgment that the food was very very late. We were so happy when it finally arrived as we were starving and it looked really good! Looks can be deceiving. I ordered the eggs Benedict and the sauce was awful! It tasted like it was a mix, which I think is super sad at a breakfast restaurant, also one of my eggs was hard! My husband had the steak omelette and he barely touched it. The icing on the cake was when we went to pay we asked for change and our server never returned or acknowledged us again even though we sat there waiting for almost 10 minutes! He stole his tip that's for sure! Overall very very disappointing as the location and restaurant style were perfect. Hopefully they figure out how to operate a successful business soon as we would love to come back if they overhaul the staff and menu!

First time in Vegas. We were looking for a breakfast place close to our stay. Rise & Shine was less than a mile away so it was perfect. 
First off, the restaurant is beautiful. Flowers everywhere! The staff are dressed in pajamas, which is fun, and they are so friendly. 
The restaurant was also busy which is a sign of good food :) 
Anyways, it was very difficult to make a selection but I finally settled on the pancakes. However, these were no average pancakes. They were huge!!!! Also, they tasted like cake. We asked the waitress what they were made out of... SWEET CREAM pancake mix. So delicious!!!!! 
The service was wonderful, the food was marvelous and the atmosphere was perfect for a casual morning. Will definitely go back if I ever find myself in Vegas again.

When you walk in to a breakfast place at breakfast time and it is EMPTY you have to think twice I did and after having a rude hostess tell me I had to have biscuits and gravy with eggs I guess she didn't have any knowledge of the menu as it showed them as a stand alone side then treated as a second place customer I took my advice and LEFT.

Great breakfast! We found them on Yelp and we were not disappointed! 
Great atmosphere and unique menu .   Can't wait to return to try their other delicious looking unique menu items...

Went with sisters on a saturday morning. 10 minute wait. Was pretty busy, but not that busy and server took long to get to greet us once seated and a long to return with drinks. Waited over 25 minutes for our food and I noticed some people who were seated after us go their food before us, but the fancy omelette made up for it. It comes with a steak the size of your palm, hash browns and biscuit. Delicious! Sisters liked the red velvet pancakes but the ham steak was not good. Overall cute place with big portions and outdoor seating. Friendly, but slow service. I recommend just ordering take out.

First time here today and will definitely go back. We had 8 people (4kids) and Jerry our server was amazing. He was so extremely  patient with us ordering and us changing our order for the kids. He was quick with drinks and any extras we asked for. He was funny and not annoyed at the kids like at most restaurants. I ordered the BLT salad and the biscuits and gravy and it was fresh and tasty and the food came out quick for an 8 top. The portions are large I took enough home for two more meals for my daughter and I. Prices are reasonable so Jerry and Rise and Shine get 5 stars. He was so great we double tipped him too he deserved it for his great attitude and quick service.

Great place!!! The food was delicious. I got the salmon eggs benedict and my boyfriend got the chicken fried steak. Both were very tasty!  Love the decor and the huge outdoor patio (we sat outside). Friendly punctual service too. Would highly recommend!!

I've been really excited to come try this place since I looooovvveeee breakfast and it's only five minutes from my house. Although it will admit the previous reviews made me a little nervous about the wait. 

We came at about 10 am on a Friday and we were seated right away. We got coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. I thought the juice bar was a great touch! I ordered the ultimate steak & eggs w/ pot o bread and it was divine! I ordered my steak medium rare and it was closer to medium but I didn't mind. And the pot o bread was yummy and very fluffy. The hash browns and eggs were just as delicious. Definitely a little bigger portion size so be prepared to leave full! Overall I really enjoyed the whole experience and I can't wait to come back! Especially since it's so close!
Excellent  service and friendly staff. Food was perfect and fast. Definitely my new place to eat breakfast in vegas.

A friend recommended this breakfast spot when coming to Las Vegas and the food is above average. If you have a sweet tooth and in need of a fix, this establishment has you covered. 

Ladies, if you have a man with an appetite, this is the place. I ordered their pancakes and to my surprise, their pancakes are larger than the plate. $10 pancakes and he'll be full lol. My mom ordered their waffle and her taste buds were delighted.... What I like that stood out was their maple syrup. It had cinnamon sticks in the jar and it was served warm. Sweet tooth was satisfied. 

Would come back and try their steak next time. :)

I loved this place in the past but no more service has changed and I don't like being charged for toast that is given after the meal is done but I spoke with the manger who just happen to be checking me out and asked how was my meal after I explained she removed the toast and gave me and my son 2 $5 off coupons I will be returning and recommend to all just bad day toast

Came here for a late breakfast on a Sunday.  Had a party of 5 and had to wait about 25 minutes.  I had the crunchy cinnamon French Toast and it was awesome.  Portion was huge - would up taking half home.  My sister in law had the steak and egg bagel sandwich and enjoyed that as well.  
We had a 5 year old with us and her silver dollar pancake were delivered 5-10 minutes AFTER the adults' food.  That was a bit frustrating but may have been bc they were so busy. 
Very good place for breakfast!!
Good was amazing especially the philly cheese steak and egg breakfast and the smores waffle. Yummy! Service was great, never had to wait too long for anything. Would definitely come back again.

Ate breakfast today at the Grand Opening of the West Flamingo store with my wife we were told we were the second paying customers...some what of an honor.  The place is very roomy plenty of tables and booths, the decor is nice there are parasols of various colors hanging from the ceilings a very nice look.
The menu had numerous selections for breakfast, steaks, ham steaks, chicken fried steaks, rib eye steaks, omletes, traditional bacon and eggs.  We had the rib eye and eggs, comes with hash browns and toast however they have an item called "bread in the pot" it's a small hot cinnamon roll in a small cup with butter it was hot and delicious.  Our servings were nice large portions with 3 eggs.

My wife who is a coffee lover, said that their coffee was Outstanding.  They offer French Pressed Coffee too, somewhat of a nice different approach and they have a juice bar and all the juices are made right at the bar...the juice bar also makes smoothies to order.  

Breakfast is breakfast... there are numerous places to eat in this area, I would highly recommend try this one and compare to the others, this will be on the top of your list. The staff was very friendly and very attentive to our needs and well versed on all the items on the menu.

They also serve a lunch and have a very appealing lunch menu, I'm looking forward to trying it out.

We went on Saturday, May 2nd around 9:00am. We were a party of six. The hostess (if you would call her that) advised us it would be a 20-25 minute wait. So we sat and waited. People came and also waited. After 25 minutes, we were going to inquire about the wait when another gentleman very politely spoke with the "hostess" to inquire about why no one was being seated when there were plenty of tables both inside and out that were available. The "hostess" stated that no one was being seated until all the tickets were cleared in the kitchen. While we were sitting waiting, the wait time increased significantly for newcomers. Some times were quoted at 45+ minutes. We felt this was unacceptable as we were never informed of what was happening and were not offered anything to drink, perhaps a discount for the long the wait or at the very least an apology. The gentleman asked to speak with the manager to which the "hostess" stated the manager had told her 10 minutes previously not to seat anyone. She apologized however she would not make eye contact when the apology was given. In fact, she completely looked the other way when she apologized not once, but twice. We ended up leaving. We advised the other patrons that were also waiting inside and out what had transpired and they left as well. The "hostess" had no business being in a hostess position as she had absolutely NO customer service skills. The manager should have come out and advised us what was happening and she never did. In fact, she never made eye contact to any of us. There needs to be more training or more staff. I had been there once before on a weekday morning and had a pleasant experience (other than the fact we paid almost $30 for a party of 2). Hence the reason I recommended to my family we should go. I was very disappointed at the experience we had. We won't be going back any time soon.

Love this place... Comfy and clean. I have a few favorites... Carrot/apple juice, corned beef/eggs, pot of bread and Chris is the greatest. I apologize if I misspelled her name... She checks on you and remembers the details. Love her... Want great breakfast, here is where you need to be.

I've been to Vegas a few times and have been looking for a great breakfast spot that wasn't on the strip or an all you can gorge fest. We randomly came by Rise & Shine and it is hands down my new favorite spot in all of Vegas. 

They have a fresh squeezed juice bar. The meals are filling and they have the best hash browns I have ever had in my life. On top of the fact that they specialize in steak and eggs they also have a lot of healthy options from vegetarian to the meat lovers. 

Even if it's not an option make sure to try the 'pot of bread.'   Thanks guys you made my trip!

Food is excellent! Hands down the best pancake I've ever had.  I would have given 5 stars but I subtracted one because the wait was very long and the waitress was ok but not great. 

FOOD : 5 STARS
SERVICE: 3 STARS
Ordered the fresh orange juice, for the $$$ I'd expect a larger glass. My wife had the chicken and waffle, much better than Hash House!!! I had the S'mores waffle, loved it. Plan on going back.

This was our first visit and we were excited to try it. I ordered a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. It was not worth $4.25. I ordered the steak and eggs and my husband ordered the the steaks wrapped in bacon and eggs. I forget the menu name. The steaks were good and properly seasoned but the eggs were small and the potatoes lacked seasoning. I didn't like that we didn't receive our toast with our meal. We were 1/2 way done when the toast arrived after we were assured "it was coming up". I used the lady's room here and it was very very dusty and lacked supplies. It needs a deep cleaning for sure!! I also didn't like the lack of uniformity of the staff. The hostess' wear regular street clothing, the waitresses wear PJ's, the cooks and busers wear an identifiable shirt and khaki pants. I bring this up because when we needed something we didn't know who to ask we couldn't tell who's an employee or a patron. Also, the PJs worn by some were a bit disheveled. Not very professional. All in all this place is nothing special and the food wasn't great. Stars for decor and some of the food.

Initial impressions upon walking in the door is that the restaurant is very spacious. On the other hand, the menu is a bit busy and doesn't really lead me to any particular area of the menu to order. For a place with "steak" in the name I was expecting more "steak" entrees. Service was a bit slow given that the place wasn't that busy. Staff were also not the friendliest, but not the worst I've experienced.

As for the food, it was ok. My steak was cooked to how I ordered it, although it was bland. I somehow feel like Denny's is a step above this place. There was nothing that wowed me about the food. Service improved towards the end. My coffee was refilled before dropping below half. Overall this place is okay. Would I necessarily return here again? No, but if the only choice was between here and McDonald's for breakfast, I'd probably go here instead.

Love this place. The service is awesome. I had my bridal party here for breakfast and they are amazing! Analisa really made an effort to cater to us, they are so patient with the huge group. I just want to thank you guys for being so awesome and helping us kick off our beautiful day!!!! I will definitely be back! =]

Really enjoyed this place. It's about a 10/15 minute drive the strip headed towards the mountains which will give you some good scenery. The service was great and the food was even better. I got the two eggs bacon and hashbrowns and my party got the s'mores waffle and chicken and waffle. Everyone loved their food. Would go back next time I'm in Vegas!

Really great service and experience all around.   Love a good breakfast place, especially one close to home.   We were seated immediately. Decor is bright and interesting. Our server, Adam, was awesome and helpful.      Pot of bread, does anything else really need to be said?!  It was a mix of delicious white bread and a cinnamon roll.  Amazing.  Omelets were out quick, tasted great.   Iced coffee was delicious.   

Will definitely be back.

This place is no joke.  They were packed and the food still came out at a decent time.  My steak and eggs were cooked perfectly and the seasoning was delicious. Service was very friendly, both at the table and at the counter. My wife had an issue with her steak and eggs being undercooked, but they apologized and gave her a new fresh plate with everything cooked right. Based on other Yelp reviews I had the pot of bread, which lived up to its expectations.  It made my wife wish she didn't get the wheat toast.  Unfortunately I had to share.....

Pretty good!

 The banana Waffles were delicious. The bananas didn't seem like they were ripe enough but the meal was still very tasty. 

The kids had cinnamon toast crunch/ yogurt / strawberries /bananas.

Fast friendly service.

Will come back, the menu is full of yum yums

Ummmmm wow! Visiting here from out of town. My husband comes to Vegas often for work and recommended this place. Absolutely does not disappoint! I got the chilaquiles. Being from Southern California, I wasn't expecting much compared to what we get at home. They were the absolute best chilaquiles I've ever had! My husband got steak and eggs....delish. I won't go into what my kids got, but I will say absolutely everyone ate every last bite.

This is one of our breakfast go to place. They are always consistent with their food and service. 
I like the fact that they can wear pajamas at work---makes me feel at home!
Bread pot and French Press coffee is always our starter and I usually order their Loco Moco or their steak and eggs and the steaks has a coffee flavor as well. Yummy!
They also have the Southern Highlands location.

This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast! The biscuits and gravy are my go-to as well as the smores waffles. Their juices are also delicious- especially the watermelon strawberry juice.  The staff is also attentive and polite. Anytime I have someone in town visiting, I bring them here and it is always a win.

We visited this place for the first time today and we were in no way disappointed! Firstly, we were greeted immediately. They took our name down and said it would be about a 15 minute wait. It was very nice outside, so we asked if it was to be possible to be seated outside and the server said that it was no problem! I was a little nervous about being the only customers outside, as most places forget about you, but that was not the case. They were very attentive and the food was amazing. Nicole, our server, was awesome. It was the first, but definitely not the last time we will go to this restaurant.
Waffle amazing! Chiliquiles amazing! Laura amazing! Great food, service and atmosphere. Gluten free savory options as well!

They serve your food on a platter and it is completely full. Bring a very large appetite here. Sausage gravy is amazing, NY chicken fried steak is huge and very flavorful. Buffalo chicken was perfect, medium spice bursting with flavor.

Amberly was our waitress and was very friendly and attentive. She took extra time to explain menu items as this is our first time here.  

I recommend this place to everyone.

Love LoVe LOVE this place ! Stacy is our favorite server ! She is always so wonderful and fun ! She always gets the order perfect and makes sure we are as happy as the last time ! Definitely recommend this for the start of your day !!! YUM ! Food is always cooked perfectly and if it isn't or you don't like it they will fix it ! OH ! And definitely try the Pot of Bread ! Sounds weird , I know ! WORTH TRYING FOR THE FIRST TIME ! If Stacy isn't there when you go , that's okay because everyone else is always so lovely as well !

Update: Braiden makes THE BEST lattes and coffees here !!! I love when he is working the juice bar because I know my drink is going to be so good !!! As always Stacy was amazing as well !! LOVE THIS PLAACCEEEE

Nice little breakfast place for locals. Located inside southern highlands in the same plaza as Smith's and can be easily located. 

The staff dressed in pjs which is really cute. Came here once for breakfast and enjoyed it. We got corned beef hash that comes with a pot of bread which was delicious, and the rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles which was gigantic!!! Also ordered a side of muffin and gravy which was good. Overall enjoyed the food and the service.

Been here multiple times and I've had good experiences with them. Since it is a popular breakfast spot expect it to be busy during the weekend. I hardly have to wait for a seat because I usually go with just my girlfriend. If you have a bigger party you might have to wait. If there's one thing I would suggest you try here... it's the chicken and waffles! They use chicken breast and it always comes out amazing for me. I love how it's crispy and goes well with the waffles. Their syrup is really good and they try to keep it warm at all times. As far as pricing goes it's your usual $10+ price range for almost any breakfast spot. The staff is super friendly and the establishment is clean. I see myself coming here again.

It's always a great morning if Rise and Shine is on your agenda! The name reveals that they specialize in steak and egg dishes, and I have never been much of a fan... partially because I didn't realize how many different variations there were of this dish.

SPICE RUBBED RIB EYE WITH CHILAQUILES: This was incredible. Steak was nicely seasoned and cooked to a perfect medium rare, with a huge portion of tortilla chips, beans, and cheese, along with avocado, salsa, and sour cream to doctor it to your liking. Portion is enough for two, or one, if you don't plan on eating til dinner.
CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS: HUGE steak, crunchy exterior, perfectly seasoned country gravy. This is the South on a plate. Side it with a biscuit and gravy for the full effect. It's a super-heavy dish though, consider yourself warned.
STEAK AND EGGS: The classic dish was also done well. Table agreed the steak on this plate was the best, but the hashbrown potatoes left something to be desired. Would sub for another side next time. 
DRINKS: The French press coffee and the fresh-squeezed juices are good choices, the Green Go Go juice in particular (kale, cucumber, melon, parsley).

Service was friendly, love how some of the servers are in PJs. I hear they get busy on weekends, but the food is certainly worth the wait and way better than that other nearby breakfast spot. Note that meals are ~$15/ea, which justifies the huge portions, but may be a bit more than you expect.
Great food. Great coffee. Great service.  Nice to have a breakfast place that isn't a chain or tucked in a strip mall next to a hair salon.

This place was extremely crowded, which is always a good sign. The wait was about 15 minutes before we got our booth. So my husband ordered the crunchy French toast. It's made with the usual French toast ingredients with cinnamon toast and corn flake cereal, powdered with powder sugar with a whip cream topping. It was simply delicious! I ordered the chicken and waffles plate. I was excited to be having this plate since it is one of my favorite dishes but I really didn't like my plate. The chicken was bland and my waffle was extremely soggy. Needless to say I was disappointed with my dish. Now with this in mind, I was wondering if I'd give this place another shot. Let's just say if it wasn't for my husband's dish, my answer would've been no. Since his plate was delicious, I'd definitely would give this place another try but the chicken and waffle will definitely not be even considered.

Great breakfast spot. Ribeye was well - seasoned and everything was delicious. Fresh juice damn good too. Fun atmosphere (they where pajamas). And service was great as well (Stacey was sweet).

Will be back.

We wanted to try this place out badly and were told the wait was 25-30 minutes. They ended up running behind, which is totally understandable on a busy Saturday. I have always worked in food service and I'm very understanding about these things. 

After 45 minutes, we checked on the status. The hostess said there was one group ahead of us and she would come outside and call. They weren't calling anyone, we saw her come outside maybe once. 

Finally, after an hour, I went back in. Our name was crossed off and the hostess tried to tell me that that wasn't us, it was a different party. Funny though, that's where I remember her writing us down and our name wasn't anywhere else on the list. 

She did not apologize or own up to their mistake, and this is what bothers me the most. I wasn't angry about the situation until she did that, if she had apologized and owned up to their error I would have happily accepted the table that they rushed to set up for us.

Instead, we left. I will never eat here on the basis of that alone, as clearly the staff isn't trained with good customer service skills and would sooner lie to a guest than remedy the situation appropriately.
Great service, great food... Will come back whenever we visit Vegas. The corned beef hash was out of this world, a must try! Ask for Krys, best server/entertainer/life consultant in town!
I love this place from the fresh-squeezed orange juice to the pajamas on the waiters and the Loco Moco is simply splendid, you must try it.

First time here, we were very impressed with the Ribeye Chilaquiles! Service was outstanding even though she was new. The french press coffee was nice and strong, plus they accidentally brought us free bread-in-a-cup with the icing. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, just melted with each bite. Chilaquiles were not soggy and not overly crunchy. I already want to come back to Vegas!

Cute brunch place in a good location! Atmosphere was great, food was perfect, service was great, overall nothing negative about our visit. The pot of bread is adorable! It's a cinnamon bread with powdered sugar, served with a side of icing to dip it into. I loved that their coffee cups were decent size, unlike other breakfast places that serve coffee in the tiny mugs. Everyone was very friendly. The girl working the smoothie bar came over to offer us a sample of the berry smoothly because she had some leftover and it was delicious! I also liked that the servers wear pajamas, it was very unique. I'll definitely be back!

PRICEY!!!!! This is not a strip establishment. $12 on each menu item for breakfast? Unless you get the $7 oatmeal (it is not even a bowl, a cup and a quarter maybe?) It would be ok it the portions were large, but they are not.  Food is average. Sorry I am not into a $12 two egg, meat, potato, and toast then add a coffee for $2.95. $15 breakfast is excessive. Then a tip? How quickly you add up to $20 per person. No thanks, won't be back.

This place is run down with poor management.  How can you not have soft drinks?  All the beverages were overpriced.  The waitress who runs the place was condensing when asked about menu items.  She also visited out table three time in the 5 minutes we had been there asking for our drink orders.  When asked about hot drinks, she didn't know what herbal tea was.  Avoid this dump.

Everything food-wise was decent, nothing spectacular.  Our waitress was very nice, took extremely good care of us and tried to provide some recommendations from the menu.  We ordered the prime rib and eggs breakfast with scrambled eggs, hash browns and their cinnamon roll in a cup.  The steak was thin, overcooked but had a nice seasoned flavor.  The eggs were scrambled - easy enough.  Hash browns were pretty greasy.  The cinnamon roll in a cup was a nice touch.  Overall, an OK experience but I doubt I'll be rushing back.

Such an amazing restaurant!! Cute atmosphere and decor .. although the fans made it pretty damn cold in there ... especially in January! 

We had great service and delicious food!!

I had the egg white chicken omelette while my boyfriend had the chicken fried steak .. he's made it clear that he has FINALLY found a spot in Vegas worth having the chicken fried steak, YES!

I would absolutely come back to this place - great food & people!!

Okay. 
That's just it. 
Husband ordered philly cheese steak and egg. It supposedly shaved ribeye but it was ground. Not shaved. Plus. He didn't get offered any pot of bread, biscuit or toast. We asked our waiter and he said NO so fast. We then asked for the menu again from a different waiter. And it's written right there on the menu. The dish should come with pot of bread, biscuit or toast. He immediately came when he saw us asked for the menu again and apologized but he said this is because the iPad doesn't have an option for it. Hello. You're a waiter. You should know the menu like the back of your hand. It's your job, buddy. Not owning the mistake and quick saying no to a customer is a BAD customer service. Btw. He then gave us a very sad ONe piece of biscuit. 
Btw the banana foster waffle that I ordered was okay. Good toppings but the batter was so cake-y. Not like waffle. 
On top of this, as we pay our bills at the cashier, there is a customer walk in. This is 2:47. Aaaaand the cashier told us, "never fails, 10 min before we closed". WoW. Talking about BAD customer service ever. Who ever train the people here should be seriously questioned if they want their customer coming back to the restaurant. 
And yes. 
We still tip our waiter. Because we are nice people.

There are two main reasons im giving this place such a low rating. 1. Being the food/prices &  2. Being the service. 

I was very excited to try this place as I had seen it frequently on my drive to work. 

Lets start off, I came here for the first time this past weekend. As soon as we were seated in our booth our waitress came to take our drink order, then headed off to get them, I ordered the watermelon strawberry juice, my sister got a Pepsi, and my mom orders the Green Juice. 10 minutes pass by and she is no where to be found, she finally comes with the Pepsi and 3 waters. My mom inquired about the juices and the waitress very rudely replies with "Yeah i dont know whats taking them so long" as she gestures towards the juice bar. So i asked her if she could go check for us if they were ready, and she gave me the death stare of a life time and replied with "UM YEAH I GUESS". She brings back the juices which are deceiving in picture on the menu, 5.25 for 8 oz of juice in a tall glass; what a rip off. After we got all our drinks it was time to order the food.  

Im a sucker for Eggs Benedict, I ordered the Steak and Eggs Benedict bagel. When our food got to the table my Benedict sauce was coagulating and separating, and my moms sourdough toast was cold and stale as a brick. So I asked if I could have them bring me new sauce on the side, and new toast, the waiter rudely informed me that I would have to pay 2.95 for a tiny size of extra sauce. I tried to explain to him that it was already cold and separated, and he spoke over me saying "I cant control the temperature in here". Obviously that is not what I was trying to get through to him, so I just ordered the extra sauce and left it at that I was too hungry to go around in circles with him. 

To say the least the quality of food was poor for the prices they were asking. The Benedict sauce was cheesy tasting and tasted as if it was out of a package. The eggs were snotty and slimy, poached eggs are supposed to have fully cooked whites and a runny center. The steak was charred to a crisp and when I brought it to the waitresses attention she said that it was because the base for their season steak rub is coffee grounds so it gives it a smokey flavor. This was not a smoky flavor this was completely burnt ash, and 40% of my steak was fat and gristle.  The french press coffee was bitter and gritty and tasted like nothing more than Folgers.  

Asking for anything was like pulling teeth, both waiter and waitress gave us major attitude and made it known that we were an inconvenience to them. When it came time to pay up at the front the receptionist asked how our meal was and we were honest. She said "I appreciate your honesty and I will relay your feedback to the chef and the manager", in the most fake tone ive ever heard, and as soon as we started to turn our backs I saw her roll her eyes and shake her head towards our waitress like we had just been ridiculous and rude. Which we were not, we were very nice about everything. 

I usually try to give places a second chance before i rate them but I dont think i will be returning. I dont like paying to be treated poorly when I ask for wrongs to be made right. 

Summary: Overly priced low quality food and bad customer service.

Staff was super friendly. The food was really good and completely worth the wait! I loved the fresh squeezed orange juice, and also loved how everyone working, was in pajamas. It gave it a very cozy breakfast environment. I hope to come back again soon:)!

This place is awful! Don't understand any of the good reviews. We came in on a Saturday morning at opening. It was empty so food should have been at least hot. Waffles were extra crispy and hard. Same with the biscuits even though they were covered in gravy. Every meal was completely cold. No refills on drinks and just about the worst service I think I've had in a long time. The manager knew we were upset and didn't say a word. Horrible place! And extremely over priced. $87 for 3 adults and a child. Never again!

Just went here for the first time! Our server Ashley was amazing and so friendly! Treated us like family! Atmosphere is so cute! Everyone wears pjs! The food is delish! Big portions! Can't go wrong with that!

I'm not sure how I've missed this place. I herd about the south location but I didn't want to drive from Aliante to Southern Highlands. When my wife had mentioned it to a co worker they said "oh the one on flamingo, we live that place" what!!!! There is one close to me. 
So as the weekend neared I was pretty stocked to ride over. All I could think of is ultimate ribeye and eggs. 
So as my wife and I was seated I was ready to order. I glanced at the menu and was ready as my iced tea showed up. 
I put a little spin on my ultimate ribeye. I wanted a little spice so I had them add it and ordered my eggs over medium and extra crispy hash browns. The best part is the bread (toast, biscuit, or a cup of bread) I haven't ate any bread in weeks. So the cup of bread was a hit. Five stars for the cup of bread. 

It's a pretty nice size place. Use to be a Joes Crab Shack. They have spinning umbrella lights. Waitress wear pajamas and the bus boys wear a shirt that says "spooning leads to forking, so don't forget to use the condiments" 
I'll be back for sure

I debated between a 3 and 4 star review for this breakfast restaurant. The food itself was decent, but the overall experience.. I'm kinda meh on it. 

Of course, I expect pretty much any breakfast/brunch restaurant to have a wait at around 11a on a Sunday, and Rise & Shine was no exception. The wait was about 30 minutes, which wasn't terrible, but I was ready to eat by the time we were seated.

Our server, while.. serviceable, had a distinct lack of warmth. She took our orders, came back to check on us, filled our water and coffee, but it all felt very robotic, almost like we were a bother. She never cracked a smile until she handed us the bill. O-Kay.... is it chilly in here? 

The food itself was good, though. I really enjoyed my French toast crunch (I don't think that's what it was really called). The bread was just thick enough, the batter yummy, and it had just enough crunch to it. The turkey kilbasa was alright- pretty much a hot dog. The eggs were fine- although be forewarned, if you order scrambled eggs, they aren't actually scrambled. They're fried eggs mixed up in a pan. My dining companion had a real problem with this! 

I sampled a bite of the amazingly HUGE pancakes. They were good, very dense and fluffy. 

So remember the wait to get seated? Well, the wait to pay our bill was almost as long! Checkout was at the register up front, which is fine, but we stood in line at least 15 minutes in order to pay. They definitely need a better system here.

The two meals and 1 cup of coffee ended up coming to $35... a smidge over what I prefer to spend on breakfast, but oh well. 

Rise & Shine.. not bad, but I won't go out of my way to return. Shine on!
Came in to eat some chicken and waffles... Delish!! And our server Frankie was awesome. Such a breath of fresh air. We need more customer service like him

This place was recommend by a friend. So glad we tried it. The chicken and waffles were very good. Had fresh squeezed oj. My son had the steak and eggs. He loved them. We will definitely be going back!

Strange review to write when we didn't even get a chance to eat. After waiting 25 minutes to be seated, I was sat a filthy booth. Great first impression. Then when trying to order they were not willing to make me hash browns without onions for which I am completely allergic too.  So we decided to get the bill for the two beverages we ordered that we hadn't even drank yet. So after wasting ten dollars I will continue to bring my business to egg works where they are very accommodating to people with food allergies.

This was our first visit to Rise & Shine for breakfast. 
Definitely won't be our last.  We sat on the patio as it was a beautiful morning and it was a bit quieter outside. The waiters/waitresses wear pajamas!!! How fitting for the restaurant name "Rise & Shine"!
Love it!!  We were a party of five and all of us ordered something just a bit different.  Myself, I ordered the kids + seniors special, 3 pancakes with two strips of crispy bacon and one scrambled egg. Such a deal!!! Wouldn't find this deal where I live.  The pancakes were amazing and the bacon yummy and cooked perfect.  Even my scrambled egg was cooked perfect.  My DH ordered the same, but upgraded his pancakes to the velvet pancakes for an extra dollar.  Omg they were sooooo tastey!  For coffee they even serve "French Press" coffee if you prefer.  Wow!  In my town, this is only served at the finer restaurants, not a breakfast spot.  When the waitress brought the carafe to the table she also brought a three sand timer so I could time and choose my own strength of coffee.  My daughter ordered the French toast and it looked amazing also.  The wait staff were so friendly.  I will post photos of three of our meals.  Definitely will go back next time we are visiting family, and will be spreading the word to friends who have second homes in Summerlin.

Food was a 4. 
Not allergen friendly AT ALL. Hashbrowns are not GF. I don't understand since Hashbrowns are literally just shredded potatoes and maybe some seasonings or veggies. $1.95 for a fruit plate. It at least was a decent size rather than a cup of fruit you would get elsewhere. I had the steak and eggs w/fruit instead of potatoes, no toast due to allergy. I made note that my daughter and I would be sharing and we both have a dairy allergy, please use no milk or butter. I ended up having a mild reaction, so that made me unhappy. Otherwise, it's kind of hard to screw up steak and eggs- one of the more simple dishes. Husband had ham & egg Benny. He said it was good and the vinaigrette was unexpected but unnecessary (hollandaise and vinaigrette was overkill sauce wise ). He said Hashbrowns were burned on the top layer and not cooked through the middle.
Service was a 2. 
I wanted to like this place. I wanted to LOVE it. I did not. Our server couldnt have acted like she cared less that we were there. We sat for probably 7-9 minutes before coffee was brought out. Never were given water. Had to ask for extra utensils. She brought out coffee once right before our food was dropped and there was no refill. Never an ask if we wanted anything else (more coffee, to go cups). It was full but there were several servers on and it wasn't insanely busy. 

It wasn't a spectacular experience. I don't expect much from breakfast joints- you go to breakfast out of convenience or leisure, not to really be wowed. I can just say that this place is probably not for me.
Might try once more and hope for a better outcome.

Hostesses are very sweet, our waiter was exceptionally nice and accommodating. Decor is adorable and brightened my mood. 

The two of us had steak and eggs, fried steak and eggs, corned beef and hash red velvet pancakes and two sides of bacon. Everything from start to finish was amazing. Glad I found this spot :) 

Will be back for more yummy yummy!

This morning a friend and I were going to go here for breakfast. I am disabled and find your entrance is not easy to access.  It seems that the front  (and only visible)  entrance is up hill from the parking lot. I did not have my walker with me so was unable to walk that far unassisted. It would be nice if you posted a sign in the parking lot showing where the front entrance is.  To just walk around the building looking for a way in is very difficult on those with difficulty ambulating.  Would enjoy visiting this restaurant in the future but thought you should know that your entrance is very unfriendly for some disabled patrons.

Rise & Shine is well worth the wait....while I understand it's not fun or what alot of people enjoy doing is waiting for a bit, it's part of the whole process if you want a great breakfast place. That says a whole lot about the establishment....it must be good food and greatly staffed. So my fav is the Chicken n Waffles, it's by far the best in town!! 2nd in line is the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles, it amazingly hits my palette in every way possible and never lets me down! 3rd choice would have to be my honey's fav, the New York Steak Spinach & Benedict Bagel, he can't go to this place without ordering this plate every time, it makes your tummy smile. The plates I've just mentioned are all crowd pleaders, decisions, decisions!! So my recommendation is to you I would definitely come in and checkout this breakfast joint out, even if it's for the Belgian Waffles, they won't ever come out cold. This place is all made to order. So if you are looking for a fast food place this thankfully is not a fly by the seat of your pants, kind of thing! It's a very warm and cozy spot that you can hang with all your BFF's and loved ones. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. My friends and family just love this place. I would recommend this place to just about anyone for some, "yummy to my tummy" food!!! Enjoy.......

Let me start this review off by saying there food is amazing. I absolutely love just about everything on the menu! That being said today while eating here I witnessed an employee in the kitchen wipe her nose with her bare hand then grab a plate . This is unsanitary and just flat out gross. And for her to just do it where everyone can see is foul. Would that be okay with you? How would you like it if I wipe my nose on my hand then bring you your food? This is unacceptable. Sad to say but I will no longer be a customer at an establishment that allows this.

Having chicken and waffles this morning. We like this place reminds us of a lake cabin. Wish they would serve coffee with a pot,on the table. Hate waiting for refill by waitress. Umbrellas on the ceiling and clay,pots used as wall decor. It's fun. The chicken was large with a hint of hear and the waffle was,light. Overall good.

This place is one of the best places I've been too. The service was great and the waitress was so nice. Her name is Ashley if anyone wants to know. The spiced rubbed steak was so tasty and juicy. I highly recommend this place to anyone.

The environment was warm & welcoming. We were seated right away. The staff was friendly and attentive & their work uniforms are pajamas. The food was amazing, fresh & hot. The bread in a cup (cinnamon bun) was everyone's favorite. The chicken & waffle was delicious, the chicken was tender and flavorful & the waffle was crispy and soft, served with hot syrup!! Nothing screams southern food with biscuit & gravy. Such a cozy feeling dining here. New favorite spot for brunch!! Highly recommend.

Went to eat here for my first time here.. would definitely come back.. great service and not only that but our food was served fast.. the food was delicious.. I ordered the waffle and my friend the chicken fried steak which she let me try with the gravy sauce.. it was bomb! Yes I said it! Definitely recommend to try out this place for breakfast!

I like the interior. I can definitely see the joes crab shack DNA under the new decor. They took the Joes decorations off the walls but they didn't change the floorplan or walls at all.
It was very busy during our visit and everyone seemed to b loving it. Our waiter was fantastic, friendly and quick.
Unfortunately my tea tasted like toilet water. It was so horrible that I had to order a new drink after one sip. I had an omelet with wheat toast. The toast was simultaneously burnt and cold. My omelet was fine.
 
(Seat check) we had to clean old food from our own seats before sitting down.

They have no breakfast sausage at all. They only offer banger sausage which is more like a bratwurst. I thought this was really weird. 

The very appealing looking pot of bread was described to us as a cinabun mixed with fresh baked bread. We're not fans. It tastes like regular bread with a hint of cinnamon.

Although the food was very underwhelming I will probably give them one more chance in the future. The problem is there are 4 or 5 fantastic breakfast places near me who always get it right.

I drive by this place on a daily basis and have always muttered to myself "I must try this place" so it was high time i ventured over for a relaxing breakfast. Depending on where in the lot you park, it may be challenging to find the front door, but there is a side door.

ATMOSPHERE- Its a bright inviting place, the decor was very winsome and perhaps enchanting especially the large flower decorations hanging from the ceiling.

SERVICE- Service was very attentive, and i suppose that's much better than wondering where your server is. Everything was done expeditiously. 

FOOD- The food was presented very neatly and in an appealing manner -a professional plating presentation indeed. The food tasted fresh and seemed to be up to today's standard. The OJ was freshly squeezed juice and not that syrupy stuff out of a commercial grade machine btw.

All in all it was a good breakfast, but nothing spectacular or to write home about, besides the decor and employees pajama theme (which was unique and inviting) it was a pretty basic experience and the prices were a touch higher then i'd have liked....but after some other breakfast experiences at other joints in town i wouldn't write this one off as this is a pretty good option

So I have to say this is a prime example of how each visit can be a hit or miss. Service is hardly ever as consistent as it should be and how service can really put a sour taste in a persons visit. 

Brought my brother and sister in law to this spot while they were visiting and I was really disappointed I did. They were busy so granted the wait was inevitable, not a big deal but when we were called we followed our hostess half way as she POINTED to where our table was. The menus were already placed so she didn't have to hand them to us but she couldn't even walk us to our table yet stop half way then point us in the right direction. Uhh what the heck?!

Next, our server says hello and then repeatedly asks if we want water, a couple of us said yes while the others said no. Then as she's about to leave (after only taking our drink order) she asks again if we want water because apparently "its just a lot easier if I get you all water now rather than later" (verbatim). First, I wasn't aware getting a glass of water was so difficult. From that point on, the service was pretty downhill since we (as the customers) were super uncomfortable asking her for anything. Not that she checked on us to see how we were doing except at the end to drop the check. 

The only reason I'm giving two stars is because the food was great and yet again saved this review.

It's the best breakfast place in Las Vegas it's perfect and good recommend for anyone looking to eat good , perfect steak , eggs , coffee , and bread , good service also ,  give it a try you won't be disappointed.

We got here pretty early on a Sunday and we were sat immediately. Our server was gracious and professional. We ordered two kids meals and two traditional meals with waters and coffee. The kids split a juice, which was amazing btw. The good came rather quickly and was delicious! I mean wow. My only complaint is our meal cost over $50. Maybe it's a little above our lifestyle but I couldn't believe breakfast would cost that much. I didn't complain or anything but I was inwardly shocked. If we could afford it we would definitely go back
One of the best kept secrets In Vegas. The food is delicious and the staff is super friendly!
It's a little busy during rush hour but the food is good and we had a good waitress. They have a nice variety and many different choices!

the "lack of service" killed the very good meal.  this is a tough location as it is not easy to get into but great food will survive a challenge.  food was great.  had the cream cheese lox omlet. but the servers, at least the ladies, seem to have quite the chip on their shoulder.  when i go out for breakfast, it is an expensive treat, not a daily thing.  paying $3 for a cup of coffee and not being asked if i would enjoy another cup until after i had finished breakfast.....but at least the cashier was kind enough to take the coffee off my tab. nut shell....great food. tough location for access. servers with "attitudes". no newspaper rack anywhere around so bring your own. me, i'll wait for the next breakfast place to open. i just don't put up with "lack of service".
What a great atmosphere!  I love the flowers on the ceiling.  Food was tasty and good portions.  Service was excellent.  Even the hostess was very helpful and kind.  Will be back!
The food is absolutely amazing! Very friendly service and atmosphere. Price is better then most places around with the best food around. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try!

They asked me if I wanted to sit at the bar or wait 10-15 minutes. I chose to wait for a myriad of reasons, the most prominent being that I don't like sitting by the kitchen it makes it impossible to talk. Being seated by the kitchen is the worst seat in almost any usual restaurant, so whenever a place sits me near it I tend to not come back. So we wait our time and they sit me, literally, in the table that is the absolute closest to the kitchen without being the bar. Needless to say, I started off my meal highly irritated. Worse than this, the lighting in the area I was in was horrid. I like to take pictures of my food and even my selfie ring light was not fighting the backlight from the windows. I really wish they had more inside lighting, 

However, despite my minor complaints with being seated and the lighting, I will give Rise & Shine another shot. The other features of this experience won me back over in time. Our waitress was nice, our food was good (and in some cases exceptional) and I felt really special getting to drink french press coffee. That's a nice touch! 

I had the french toast with bacon and egg in the middle and my boyfriend had a fancy steak omelette. The steak on his omelette was surprisingly good. I would even call it great. It was soft, tender, buttery, delicious - everything a steak should be. I don't like their pot-of-bread and wouldn't get it again. If you wanna try some pot-of-bread, do yourself a favor and hit up Jamms!

Coming back for the food, hoping for a slightly better atmosphere. But even if the atmosphere is the same and this doesn't end up being my cup-of-tea for a peaceful breakfast - it would make a STELLAR family option.
Amazing food! The pot of bread is a must have. Amberly, our waitress, was very sweet and provided great service.

We decided to grab a brunch before we headed back to Long Beach, CA and of course I turned to my yelp app... We were checking out the fish tank(Didn't see mermaids) at Silverton and one that popped near by with high reviews happened to be closed for 3 weeks(a little crazy!) so I quickly looked up option B and came across Rise & Shine a Steak & Egg Place... Let me just say we were meant to come here instead of the other place! We had to wait a little while since a few tables had to be cleared out but we had time to look over the menu while we waited so we didn't waste any time and ordered right away... And we were very thankful for the kids coloring papers because our kids were really coloring and we actually had peaceful waiting time it was sooo nice! And our server was really nice and attentive too, I wish we had asked her her name! She is the one with black PJ on:-) Well whoever you were, you were great! Thank you:-)

Anyways, we ordered friend chicken and waffle, Chicken fried steak and kids 1+2+3, all soooo delicious and we scoffed down pretty much all of it no problem! We officially added this place to must stop by restaurant in Las Vegas list:-)
Took 50 minutes to be seated and another 45 minutes for the food. Horrible management.

I have been there more than a few times cause I live around the corner and I leave with the same impression every time. That is for the very mediocre food they are sure expensive and service is just plain bad! OK so what is the problem? well two people for breakfast one being oatmeal was $35!!! Speaking of oatmeal, ordered was for oatmeal with milk and fruit, forgot milk and fruit, came back in 5 min and we ask where it is, then came back another two min with milk but no fruit. Unbelievable.

Delicious food and top notch costumer service.,Amberly was our waitress and she was exceptional , we are currently in our way to Vegas and already talking about what we are gonna have this time around .:') .. Give it a try ,you won't regret it .

This place has become one of my favorite breakfast places!  Went here after church with my family and we were not disappointed!  I had the country fried steak but also sampled other dishes that my family got.  The steak, loco moco, and ham and cheese benedict were also fantastic.  I loved how the loco moco had spam.  Will definitely come back!  So many things to choose from!

Rise n Shine ! 
Pow! Breakfast foodie alert. 
Leave on ya PJs if you'd like the servers have their PJs on too. 
Get yer coffees French Presses and or Fresh squeeze juice from all kinds of fresh veggies and fruit. We tried the Go-Go Green , kale cucumber green apple honey Dew etc . (No pulp ! Tasted Great) 
Plenty of options on the menu and I mean plenty! 
I've had  a hard time choosing all 3 times I've gone. 
The Avo-Veggie Benny is what I think I'll try next ! 
I've tried the chilaquiles with a steak and they were great but you better come with an appetite for steak and eggs. 
This last time I went I ordered chicken and French Toast. It's not on the menu but I requested they switch out the waffles with the toast.  They went to the back and asked and it was a problem. score ! 
The Salmon Lox omelette we ordered turned out to be a home run as well. Some words I've heard from my peers when going to Rise n Shine was "I'm so glad we came here" "this was a good choice" etc. the service has been good when I've gone on my 3 visits. Like most breakfast spots this place will get busy so come ahead of time before you are hungry ! Or wait after the rush! It's a descent size place with a patio and has its own unique decor , the inside almost gives me an Alison Wonderland Betsey Johnson type vibe lol . Good job guys. I'll be back.

My family and I went to lunch at Rise & Shine and the food was great! The costumer service was great. Sara, our server, was super friendly, patient, and helpful. She was fast and took care of us really well. Definitely will go back! Thanks to Rise & Shine and Sara!
This is my favorite place to eat breakfast & lunch when I visit vegas! I always request Sarah because she is very attentive & always has a smile on her face! Definitely the best waitress there :)

$5 for a juice-granted its fresh squeezed but $5? Also portion small.
Bathroom was dirty and clearly had not been checked on a while as the wastebasket was overflowing with trash.
They switched the eggs between my companion and I-ordered over medium and my companion over easy-he got mine and I got his. 
Pot a bread is nice touch and the decor was cute.
Usually a breakfast place is packed on Sunday, this one not do much.
Maybe a few tweaks and it will be.

Holy cow, what a great place. The servers where pj's, what could be better then that. I love all the food I have tried. Only thing I can say is go hungry, and have the pancakes, you get 2 platter size pancakes with cinnamon maple syrup.  Yum!

Not a great visit today. We told Laura - our server - that two people were joining us, but they were only having coffee - so a total party of four. From that moment on, she had no interest in service at our table. It took more than 10 minutes for the two of us to place our order, because she simply did not come back to the table. When the food arrived, my omelette was overcooked and rubbery. I had planned to send it back. But Laura never returned. She eventually walked by and dropped off the check but did not ask how everything was. We needed a to-go box and did not get one. When I shared this information with the manager on duty, she did not really seem to care about it. Said Laura was one of their top three servers. I said that made this even more unacceptable! If you want average food for an average price, with less than average service, check it out. But too many breakfast options in Vegas for me to come back.

What a huge disappointment this place was....
The restaurant is super cute and the staff are in their cute jammies. Everything on the menu sounded great, especially the ribeye steak breakfast, which is what I ordered.... 
I ordered my steak medium rare. It was raw. They seriously threw it on a grill then flipped it and threw it on a plate. The steak was still frozen!!!! 
My potatoes were like hay, super dry! Never got my toast. Finally after having my food for about 15-20 minutes my server checks on me....
She asks if everything is ok? I say no, my beef is still mooing. She says oh no, let me get you a new steak. She takes the steak and returns with my same steak!!!! Ummmmm, I thought you weren't supposed to put food back into a cooking kitchen after it's been dropped to a table....??? Gross! So you're telling me, other customers returned, contaminated food, has been on the same cooking surface that everyone else's food gets cooked on??? Disgusting. I wish I had something nice to say about this place. Oh wait, I do, my friend enjoyed her French toast. Luckily she shared so I had a few bites while our server was helping other tables.
Oh and the good thing was they took my meal off the check!!!! Well almost my entire meal. I still had to pay for my coffee which I did not drink, because it tasted either old or too dark of a roast or something.... it just was gross.
Poor management. They could give a hoot if any customers return.

Great breakfast -lunch spot. Umbrellas twirl on the ceilings, pots hang on walls, servers in Pajamas! Lots of outdoor seating & bright inside. Can't wait to try the Banana Frosted Flakes Pancakes! Servings look large!
Can't wait to come back fo
Such a good experience. I had the steak and eggs and it was phenomenal; the steak was literally so juicy. Our server Ashley was so incredibly nice and so informative. Definitely a thumbs up

Good breakfast restaurant, well prepared food. Servers are good. I have been twice and both times it was consistent. We go early because they get busy after about 9 and you have to wait. I did notice that even when we arrive early they still make you wait...with the restaurant half full. They either need more staff or stop letting the kitchen dictate how many tables to fill.

We can't say more good about this place!  Family owned and operated and Nicole made us feel just like family. Fun conversation and food that was oh, so good.  The cup-o-bread is amazing only to be trumped by the cinnamon crusted French toast. Our time there was like being at home with the cool cousins you haven't seen in years. I won't miss this place anytime I'm in town!!

As a fellow business owner I know the value of customer feedback. As such I make it a point to COMPLAIN when I must and COMPLIMENT whenever something warrants it.

I made my first visit to your business on 12/17 around noon.

I'd like to compliment you on what you've put together - Joe's Crab Shack never looked better!

Hostess was prompt.

Server (Ashley) was an A+ - I'm a bit hard of hearing and she was very patient and helpful with me. I never felt unattended or rushed to get "the table turned". She's a keeper!!

Rib-eye, eggs, hash-browns - also an A+ - I really don't know how I could suggest any improvements to them.

Water - I choose to drink water with my meals and yours was a real disappointment compared to other restaurants in the area (Fuddruckers, Roadhouse, Famous Daves, etc). It just tasted "off with a metal flavor" Let's go with a D on this one.

Sourdough Toast - I guess I'd give it a C... but compared to rest of the meal it was a distraction.

Price / Value - Let's go with a B on this one.... as a consumer I'd have been blown away had it only been $10.95 (not that I suggest this is reasonable!) and I would have been disappointed had it been $18.95. Your current pricing will encourage me to return and bring others with me.

I know this is extreme feedback. I hope you find it helpful. I know how hard staying profitable, retaining great staff, and attracting a loyal customer base can be.

Nice and big place, lots of tables, especially if they're using the patio. We sat outside and it was lovely. I had "Rise and Shine Chilaquilles" which was like breakfast nachos and AWESOME. My over-easy eggs sat on a pile of tortilla chips soaked in ranchero sauce with refried beans, cheddar and cotija. I'm already planning a return trip to eat it again. My friend had "The Ultimate Steak and Egg Breakfast" with a big ribeye cooked perfectly, two eggs and hashbrowns. We both had the "Pot of Bread" which was an ok cinnamon roll. The icing served on the side was the best part. We also shared a French press of coffee, which was delicious. 
Not so great: the hollandaise was way too buttery.  It's not a classic hollandaise. (We got a side of it to try).  I asked about the barnaise (served with "Fancy Breakfast Omelette"), but according to the server it doesn't have much tarragon in it, which is the essential ingredient in a classic barnaise.

I loved this place!! I had their ham and eggs Benedict and it was amazing and cooked perfectly. My friend also loved the chicken and egg white omelette. Service was great and our food came out quickly. I'm upset I couldn't try more things due to a time crunch, but I will definitely be back. They have so many other options I'd love to try.

Good service. Good French toast. Good quantities. I liked the hash browns I tasted. My dining companion liked the eggs Benedict. The only slight negative was the coffee wasn't the greatest. It's definitely a place to try when you're looking for breakfast but it's a big menu and the lunch items might also be worth looking at.
Biscuits and gravy were some of the best I've had for a long time. Freshly squeezed orange juice was another key feature of the meal. Definitely worth going back.
The steak and chilaquiles were amazing. The services was great, my server Ashley was super friendly. I recommend this place and will definitely return.
Tiny portions, waiters didn't know the menu. Items not properly described on menu.. Real disappointment

Called to place an order to take out, Manager argued and said they do not place orders to go during the weekend, and the only way to take out is to wait in line, be seated then once food was on table ask for it to be packed to go.... Otherwise she said they didn't want our money. So we went to EggWorks!

I had been told that the one in southern highlands was really good so I stopped in here. The only time I've been and will ever go, so I can only speak on the item I had on the menu. 

Biscuits and sausage gravy- the biscuits were hard I honestly think they were leftovers from days before. The gravy consistency was good but hardly any meat in it. 

The experience- feels like it is closing down while you're there. Staff was more into each other than serving their guests. One server even had headphones in.

Great food. Unfortunately waitress had a bad attitude. I don't know if she was having a bad day or of it was something directed toward us. We were excited for breakfast, food was great, but ready to leave. When we get our check with our meal, without a follow up, then it ruins my experience.
Just had the Best Breakfast of our weekend. Chilaquiles poached eggs for me and Bananas Foster Waffle for Mona. OUTSTANDING!!!

Had the steak and eggs. Eggs were very good but the steak was a little too seasoned for my taste also order medium rare and it came medium/well done. Service was great and food was fast. I'll probably be a return customer and try some other things. They have a great outside dining area when the weather is nice.

Nice place. Wait wasn't too bad but I felt the service could have been better. Had to repeat request for small things and the pot of bread was a lot smaller than I thought they would be. The food is delicious though.  Overall it's a place we can go to again.  I had the chicken egg white omelette and I tried the lox Benedict and buffalo chicken and eggs from the rest of my party..all were delicious. The red velvet pancake is yummy too.

This place is absolutely amazing. The waiters wear pajamas and the food is huge!! My gf got the turkey Bagel and I got the bacon wrapped steak. Omg the portions are huge!! So good!! I reccomend to anyonw hungry.

We were looking for a fun place to have a late breakfast and we found it!!

The decor, the menus, and the servers outfits all make the ambiance of the restaurant very fun and inviting and remind you of just waking up and rolling out of bed to have breakfast at a friend's cabin.

The one think you have to order is the pot of bread. It's not really a pot, it's like a cinnamon roll made in an espresso cup and comes to you warm and gooey. They also serve it with homemade cream cheese sauce to dip it in and that is one step away from heavenly goodness! So yummy, don't miss it!!

We ordered chilaquiles and chicken and waffles and we really only needed to order one or the other. The portions are incredibly large so be prepared and come with your appetite.

The other thing they do that goes above and beyond the norm, they warm their maple syrup up!!! Oh yes, you read that correctly -- warm maple syrup...it changes everything!!

Oh and if you're new to the restaurant, the server will take you on a tour of the menu!!! How adorable is that!?!?!? 

I would most definitely go back!
First time, food was great. Service was good, lived the umbrellas... You must get the bread in a pot.

This is easily one of our favorite places to have breakfast.  Meat lovers will enjoy the ribeye steak and eggs plate, I sure did!!!  Also had a huge Belgian waffle with cinnamon syrup and whipped butter, delicious!!  Very friendly and fun atmosphere.  Highly recommend this place!

Rise and Shine is a very enjoyable establishment for an early riser's breakfast fix. The ambiance and the attentive and friendly staff made for a pleasant rainy morning of steak, eggs, and coffee.

I'd love to take a nap after partaking in the ultimate steak and egg. 18oz rib eye grilled nicely  with sides of hash brown, toast, and eggs my way. Breakfast fundamentals, but executed deliciously. Chelsea was also nice enough to keep the tasty coffee topped off which i apprectiated.

I would definitely recommend Rise and Shine for those who admire a good breakfast experience.

Heard about this place from fellow yeeps, pictures looked good and was hungry so we decided to check it out. Off of Flamingo & Grand Canyon area in the south side shopping plaza. Parking was easy, plentiful. As soon as we came in we were seated right away at a four top table. The servers wear pajamas which I thought was pretty cool, GET INTO THE SPIRIT!

The decor has a farm-country like atmosphere with bright colors and pictures of cows everywhere, can't miss any of them. It's very wide open layout, there's outdoor seating which also looks comfortable. I ordered the ultimate steak and eggs (got them poached) with rye toast, also came with home fries. 

It took quite a while to get our order and I got my steak medium rare, was about 25 minutes. My steak was awesome, very little fat and tender. My eggs were over poached, I like to break it over my potatoes and couldn't quite do that because the yolk was hard. Generally when you go to breakfast places its intact and still runny. 

Aside from the wait and the eggs everything else was OK. Our waitress gave us good service, she checked on us twice after we got our food. The meal was very reasonable under $30 for me and wifey. The menu was huge so would definitely return to try out something else as there were awesome selections.

After my previous experience there I was hesitant to go again, however I was extremely happy this time. My sister ordered the chorizo burrito, it was so delicious I can't stop thinking about it. I will definitely be back. & I gave the chicken and waffles another try and they actually were much better. The service was perfect and we were served very quickly.

Things we've tried:
Cup of bread
Red velvet pancakes
Ultimate
Chicken & waffle
Chilaquiles 
Banana foster waffle
Country fried steak

Cup of bread is really good when served warm!!! The first time we ordered some it was a bit cold and unenjoyable but the times when it was warm it was amazing...!! The red velvet pancakes I could go without it was like eating a whole thing of cake and that's not what I expected, but I'm sure other people would enjoy it!! It is literally 4x the size of my hand and was spilling out of the plate! Good to share with 3-4 people! Ultimate was pretty good! The steak was pretty decent, if you want medium rare I definitely recommend asking for rare instead since it continues cooking as they serve it. The eggs the first time we ordered this tasted like they had been cooked in the steal far and sauces and it was absolutely divine!! The other instances weren't the case and was lackluster. The hashbrowns are wonderful...!!! The sausages are pretty good! But not that amazing. The banana foster waffles ARE SO GOOD.... ordered it twice!! The rest weren't particularly noteworthy to be honest! 

The ambiance is great, the service is sweet and they also have cute socks for sale. It's cozy and we returned twice within our week and a half trip to LV so we definitely enjoyed our stay!

Used to love this place, but I went today and the Rib Eye plate my girlfriend had ordered was burned. I get that it's cooked on a grill, but instead of the usual grill marks, the whole top of her steak was completely charred. Shd ordered a medium rare and as she cut the steak, half the steak was medium rare but the side that was burned was well done. Did the cook forget the steak on the grill???? She was excited to come today for lunch but the steak completely killed the mood.
The NY Steak plate I had ordered also had the same problem. Uneven cook, one side completely burned. 
We loved the steak and eggs here, but it seems like the quality just gets lower every time we come.

This place has such a fun decor with it was dimly lit with umbrella like designs hanging from the ceiling. I love the employees' uniforms it is so cute and appropriate that they are dressed in PJs. The breakfast menu is far from basic they have several different ways to cook eggs Benedict plus unique pancakes that I've have never seen on another menu. My son had the chocolate chip red velvet pancake with a cream cheese like sauce. First of all it was huge!!! One pancake was larger than the plate. For a sweet breakfast it was very good and fluffy. I had the Belgian waffle with strawberries and whipped cream and totally enjoyed it. The waffle was crisp but fluffy at the same time and was loaded with strawberries and whipped cream. The coffee was piping hot and plentiful.  Service was good the wait was super friendly and made sure everyone liked their meal. The prices were a little high but you get a ton of food.
This is probably real close to the best place I have eaten ever. I love the fresh ingredients, the flavors, and the inviting atmosphere. I am so glad I didn't just drive by.

This place is so good I wish there was one in SD. Anyone who has spend time in vegas knows that steak and eggs is a important staple.  This wonder spot specializing in every kind of steak and eggs just hits the spot,  great service, great food, and resonable prices!

We have been coming to this restaurant for a while.  Food is good, but service is terrible.  We have talked to the manager before hoping that the service would improve and we could keep coming back.  Today was another day of poor service even though they were not very busy.  After talking to the manager/owner we realized the problem with their service is never going to improve because she thinks everything is just fine.   She stated she has plenty of happy customers basically letting us know she doesn't need our business.  Las Vegas is full of wonderful restaurants that offer great food and service and appreciate the patronage from their customers, especially those that live in the area and return regularly.  This restaurant is not one of those.  While we were paying our bill the manager/owner just stood there ignoring us.  Knowing we did not and have not had good service in her restaurant just didn't matter.  With management like this, I understand why service never gets better.
