Randomly found this place and it was a great breakfast find!! I ordered turkey kielbasa and eggs. The sides (hash browns n biscuit) were solid. Ordered pancakes as a side and as a connoisseur of pancakes I'd have to say they were some of the best I've had. The service was exceptional and all of the staff was super friendly. I rarely venture off the strip when I'm in Vegas but this place is well worth it.

First timer, the food was not impressive. The service wasn't either. The waitresses all congregated together in the kitchen. Our waitress disappeared while we waited and waited for our check. When we tried to flag another waitress down she gave us an ugly look as not to bother her. The Manager never came over. Won't be going back.

This is the cutest place I've been to in a long time. Employees wear their jammies to work. So cool. My friend and I shared a ribeye steak and chilaquiles. There was a lot of food. We could not finish it. There is a fresh juice area too. They have an area where they sell cute novelties. The ambiance is so nice. Staff is very friendly. I will be back.

Good food, good fun, they have something called potted bread a cute bun in a cup covered with powdered sugar and cinnamon. But wait there's more, the chicken fried steak is amazing and by the way I don't like chicken fried anything but this was so tender and tasty. Recommend someone in your party to try it just to experience it. Then there's the waffles, banana foster, frosted flakes, Nutella, you name it. Can you say diet? Great place for a splurge or healthy smoothie and egg whites. This place has it all and who doesn't want to eat breakfast in their jamas?

Found this place today . Pass it a million times and finally decided to try it. Ridiculously delicious  ! Loved it! Adorable decor, the food is fresh and better than any of the usual breakfast places in town. Get the fresh juices , watermelon and strawberry was insanely refreshing.  Vegetarian options available.  I had the avocado egg bagel, crazy good. I'm coming back to try everything else. Very eclectic menu. It's the old Joe's crab shack building near lvac. Katie was a great server , and the servers wear Pajamas lol

Wow!  The name says "a Steak & Egg Place" and it's legit.  This is how you do steak and eggs, and how you create a place to enjoy eating.

Let's start with the service:  the hostess greeted my wife and I as we walked in and had us seated immediately, offering us a choice of seats:  booth, table, outdoor.  Our waitress (Chelsea) was right there with us but never in the way or overbearing.  Drinks were ordered and delivered quickly and we were given time to look over the menu--the pretty large menu!  All the usual breakfast options were there, along with a real variety of steak options.

I had the Steakhouse Omelet and was pleased when Chelsea asked me how I wanted my steak cooked.  I've had steak and eggs in a number of places over the years, but it's oddly uncommon that you get a say in how the meat is prepared.  I ordered medium and it came out perfect.  (The picture I posted didn't really do it justice).  The omelet was fluffy and full of generous amounts of everything the menu said would be in there.  My wife had the "Two-Fisted Bagel& Egg Sandwich" and it was put together and presented just as well as my order.  Be warned though, you might want to eat this breakfast sandwich with a fork and knife.  You can pick it up with two fists, but there might be spillage.

A few of the little things that make a nice place even better:  the cream for your coffee is fresh and comes out in a creamer rather than the more common bowl of plastic half & half containers just sitting on the table.  Water and other beverages are served in glasses, made of glass.  Each table also has a tray with salt and pepper, and a solid assortment of the more popular condiments and sauces that go well with steaks and eggs.

The restaurant interior is cool too.  Umbrellas for light fixtures, a sort of at-home feel to the tables and chairs, and a waitstaff that serves you in their pajamas.  I originally thought it might be little awkward, but it actually works to set a very comfortable environment.

Keep in mind, it's been our experience that it's hard to get in without a long wait during peak breakfast/brunch hours on the weekends.  That's because it's that good.  But if you're able, head over on a weekday and treat yourself without the wait.

Finally, ample outdoor seating and a military discount (present your ID when you pay) locks in my high score for this fine addition to the local breakfast scene on the westside.  Go and enjoy.  Your mouth will be happy!

My family and I came to Rise and Shine for lunch today.  After a 30 minute wait, we waited an a additional 45 minutes to receive our meal. During this time the waitress never came by to check on us or refill our drinks. When she finally came back, she admitted that she forgot to put our order in. The manager came over to apologize and offer to discount our meal.  However, when we received the bill nothing was taken off. The food there is okay, but the customer service is horrendous.

Went for breakfast ,service was good and food was not, had steak and eggs with spinach with hollandaise sauce, which was like powder version instead of home made sauce we all love and crave...hash browns had dirty oil taste. my fiancee had french toast very thin and not fluffy....we won't be going back...just could not get past the sauce ruined whole dish....

They had trouble in the kitchen so wait staff was running around like crazy.....but when food finally arrived it was fantastic......i had the philly cheesesteak omelette.....excellent!!!  The table behind us sent their food back 3 times and was being a little too picky to the point of annoyance......Manager Sarah to the rescue!!!  She quelled the unpleasant guests complaints and did an outstanding job of customer service....i called her over to compliment her!  I will give them a pass on the kitchen problem and will return and will give a better rating if all goes well which I would expect......

Are here yesterday and I've gotta say it was pretty delicious.... I had the Buffalo Chicken and eggs with the Cup of Bread, hash browns, and a side of bacon cuz if you know anything about me it's that I love my bacon! I also had the watermelon strawberry fresh made juice. The juice was a bit pricy for the size and you definitely wanna get the carafe if your gonna get the juice so you can get your money's worth. I really dig the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the staff was very friendly. Silverware was a bit dirty and my friends steak was over cooked. They did fix it and it was much better. The chicken was moist and juicy and they have some of the best hash browns ever! It's a nice lil brunch spot nothing fancy but prepare to spend between 20-40 bucks if you want anything to drink besides water!
We love coming to this place, staff is always great! Today we had Stacy and she was amazing, thank you Stacy for great service.  Food was great, perfect serving size and the flavor was perfect.

My husband loves this place.   Although we are not breakfast people, we always recommend this place when we have visitors.   They make delicious gravy and biscuits.   My fav is chicken fried steak. Their sausage gravy is really good.   And don't forget to order fresh squeezed orange juice.

Surprisingly phenomenal. First went to Bite down the street. Not a single soul there.. so found that suspicious and left. Sure glad we ended up here. Pancakes...bomb. Steak...bomb. Biscuit...awesome. Will come back soon, maybe even tmorrow. Cute spot good service; )

This place is GRUBBIN!! I highly recommend ordering something with a whole steak.. I got The Ulitmate. They're seasoned perfectly and really hit the spot. The French pressed coffee is bomb.com. And don't forget to order the pot of bread. Noms!
It was a bit pricey but I liked it.  I wish I would have tried the chicken and waffles.  Maybe another time.

I have come here twice now. The first time Brody was our server and he gave some excellent recommendations and service. My sister and I split the steak omelet. It wasn't necessarily a big portion, but it was perfect for both of us to share.

The second time I came here and ordered the same thing; ordered my steak medium-rare and received well done, which is why I am giving 4 stars. 

I will be coming back :)

So our waitress AMBER was awesome... Every time I come to Vegas..  This is the only place I will have breakfast at. I love this place... Get the cup of bread.. A must and OMG the ham is huge. See y'all next time...
OMG....talk about the best pancakes in Veas. The pic does it no justice. I would suggest sharing am order with 2 or 3 people, just get extra sides. Lol

Well, this was disappointing! Kept it simple, bacon and eggs.... no onions please, bacon crisp, butter the toast, please. So.... the coffee was ok, yet, the hash browns were loaded with chives (onions), in fact, they had migrated under the eggs. The toast was dry, hard, nearly inedible, unless you were looking for Melba Toast. Seemed to be a fairly busy place.... but now on my "never again" list!! Too bad, but there are plenty of great breakfast places... so no loss!

One of the bigger easier places to get into for breakfast! Food is fantastic waiters are quick and place is nice and clean. It's nice being able to jump into a place and not wait 30-40 minutes to eat. Ridiculous. Not too far from the house and away from the tourists. I'm happy this place opened up!

2nd time I've been here to be told they are closing early for a holiday party. I arrived at 12:45 and was turned away because they closed at 1. The restaurant is literally open to 3 so I don't see why they couldn't have their party after. Such an inconvenience.
1 hour wait ridiculous and their was plenty of table to sit . No good for me going for the first time I really wanted to try it for the first time, but no!

Really enjoyed my breakfast this past week here. First time and ordered the Ribeye steak and eggs with the breakfast mug bread for me and Hubby had the Chilaquiles with seasoned ribeye. It was a lot of food and we both brought home half a steak. Ordered it medium and came out perfect. Our server was very attentive and kept our coffee cups full. Loved the T-shirt's and socks they have for sale in the little entry way. I think they were $12.00 each and they had some cute sayings on them. We don't eat out for steak and eggs very often but will definitely be bringing my family, even the the non-carnivore, as they have lots of options. Our bill for the two of us was a little under $50 including the tip, but not bad when you consider the quality and portion size of what is given. Won't be a regular place for us on a retired budget but very good for those who like to splurge and indulge a little every now and then.

New breakfast place! Heard about this place from a coworker. It's a bit of a drive from us but we made it after seeing the delicious Yelp photos. When I first saw it, I was thinking how big of a place it was. After we finally figured out how to get in, the decor was something else. The staff wore pajamas, there were rotating flowers hanging from the ceiling, there were paintings of farm animals. It was very interesting. 

Talk about the portions! I ordered Chicken Avocado Bacon sandwich. Price was about $9 and it was so big. The chicken comes grilled or crispy. I decided on crispy and it definitely had a kick to it. It was spicy but the right amount of spice. Comes with skinny fries, my favorite. 

The beau got the ultimate steak and eggs. Comes with 3 eggs (or you can order it with 2), hash browns and a large portion steak. The beau really loved the flavor. It tasted like it was cooked in the grill at a BBQ. The toast was even so good and it came out with whipped butter! Bomb! 

We ordered iced Italian roast coffee. It was pretty good but I think next time I'm going to get caramel roast coffee. 

Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. This place looks promising!

Yum yum yum! Cute breakfast joint, nice staff, good music, and bomb food! Almost anything on the menu I hear is too die for. I usually go with the breakfast platter offering a ham steak and theirs does not disappoint! The ham steak is a little saltier than what I am used to but still delish! Also don't miss out on fresh squeezed juices they are amazing!!!!
Good service but seemed like there is a big issue in the kitchen(looked crazy) our food came out very slow and cold! Not sure we wanted to come back here again!
Our first time here and the food is amazing. My son loves the camp fire s'mores waffles and the fresh fruit smoothies. The ultimate steak and eggs was so flavorful.

After three tries we have decided we will not be back for a while. The first time everything was great from the food to the service. The second time we came in on a weekday morning and it took about 10 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us at the door and get a seat. Once seated it took about 35 minutes for us to get our food. We also noticed that a few tables around us were getting impatient as well with the flow of food/service. The family sitting next to us ended up getting their whole check comped due to having to send their food back twice because of the temperature of their food. We assumed that maybe this second visit was just a bad day/one off. The third time in, my father ordered coffee and his first creamer cup showed up super dirty and he had it sent back. The second creamer was dirty as well and cracked on the inside of the spout. When we touched it part of the porcelain came off. If that had been in his coffee then we would have had a serious issue. Other than the service, the food is pretty good but we will not be back for a while.

I give this place 4 stars because the food is good. The breakfast everyone had, the coffee, and the "pot of bread" were really good. The service... Completely atrocious. I hate to say it, but it was. Yes they were busy and I do cut them some slack for that. It was, however, beyond bad. We waited 10 min before anyone came over, asked for extra napkins multiple times, couldn't find our server throughout breakfast.. I've visited the S.Highlands location and the service was better there but it's smaller. Give it a try. It could've just been the particular server we had.

Great breakfast family restaurant, very busy on weekends but worth the wait. Server was not on his game, forgot toast  and bacon side orders for two meals. Steak and poached eggs on bagel is a huge portion. Steak and eggs done perfectly but whatever they used on the bagel was a little funky tasting.

While my husband had an amazing breakfast of steak and eggs, I ordered the chicken and waffles. The breading had so much cayenne in it I couldn't eat it. I asked if the menu noted that they put cayenne in the food and was told no, but the waitress would talk to the kitchen?  Very disappointed

The food was expenseive and average. The pot bread was great and so was the table French Press. The service was friendly and prompt. The hostess was awesome and worked extra hard to get us the table we wanted. The hostess needs a raise.

We enjoyed the food,  the steaks were a little too charred for my taste, but the rest of everything we ordered  was really enjoyable. 
Its a loud place,  at least when we were there.  Lots of kids and big tables.  
I prefer a quieter dining experience.
Not sure if I like my server being in pajamas or not.  Its clever,  but then also makes me feel odd, like she just crawled out of bed.

Amazing food and great staff!! Frankie was very friendly and fast making sure we had what we needed. By Far my favorite breakfast spot! We will be back to visit Frankie and have more amazing food again!!

Best place to go for Breakfast! First time trying this restaurant and going to be coming back again. Very happy me and my boyfriend had a breakfast date for our first time moving to Vegas from California.

After going to LVAC. I was HANGRY! All around the gym there are an array of healthy post-gym appropriate food places....and sometimes you just need some cheesy, yummy, gooey, comfort food for breakfast! This was one of those days!

As I was seated, by myself, I was greeted quickly by an awesome waitress, I think her name was Maddy. She was so nice. Sometimes when you are sitting by yourself, people are a bit weird. Not the case here! 

I ordered eggs, with biscuits and sausage gravy. I told you I wanted comfort food!! LOL It was really good, I would totally go back here!

The interior was bright and cheerful, they have a great outdoor patio, and some of the wait staff even wears flannel pajamas. So cute!

I've been here several times and this is a great breakfast spot I love. I always get their pigs on a bagel but take off the ham and banger and then I live their fresher squeezed juice. The watermelon and strawberry is my favorite. I wish that they would give me more though because there are no free refills. Their pancakes are also good but be careful when ordering them because they are huge! I'm sure one person can share one pancake. Also their bread in a cup is always warm and delicious. Everytime I have come here I don't think I have waited anymore than 30 minutes. Services is usually pretty fast.

We were waiting for this place to open and we were excited to try it.  It's overpriced for what you get. Normal breakfast places around town cost you about $10 for a great breakfast but this place is about 30% higher and the food is okay at best.  The service was mediocre and kind of slow for how dead they were.  I can definately say that with so many options in this town that we won't be back.
Our server Chris was very friendly and diligent. The food came very timely and tasted delicious as always! This is one of our favorite spots in town. Never disappointed!

I've eaten here a few times for breakfast. The service was very good.  The waitresses were friendly and knew the menu.  The food was excellent.  Loved the French Toast w/ eggs and bacon in the hole.  The hostesses and cashier need to be a little faster but the overall experience was very good.  Yes, I'll be back.

Good food, prompt service, and a friendly attitude are what you will find at Rise & Shine.  Walking in we found a staff dressed in pajamas, and they were as friendly a team as you will find in Las Vegas.  Seating is spacious, with lots of room between tables.  This also leads to a low room volume; just loud enough to have a buzz, but not so loud that you can't hear the music playing or the server speaking with you.  The food was good, and the price was right.  People talk about the rib eye chilaquiles and they are right - it's a good dish.  So is the corned beef hash, and the requisite "green" juice - kale, cucumber, apple, and honeydew. And it is a great place for kids.  There is a little play area outside with artificial turf, and inside a kids menu with decent selections.  We found this one morning thanks to fellow Yelpers, and we agree that it is a good place.

Mediocre at best. Portions were good size, however the food was borderline flavorless. Great atmosphere, but lacking good service. We had 3 different servers, every time we asked for something a different person showed up. We had to ask for things multiple times before actually getting what was supposed to have with our meal. The only positive thing I can say is the French press coffee was amazing. We won't be back.... EVER

Well. My first time here. My favorite breakfast is Corned Beef Hash & Eggs which they had so of course I ordered it. 
A bit disappointing cause it lacked Corned Beef Hash. Why can't anyone give the customer what they pay for. I'll keep trying to find what I want.

Overall awesome place.  Kinda surprising to see any reviews less than 4-5 stars.  Food was fast to come out and was amazing.   Service was quick and polite.   Great atmosphere an large enough floor that we didn't have to wait long even on a busy Sunday.   Really enjoyed our meals (fried steak and eggs and philly bagel).  Will be back soon!

I waited for my 6th trip to leave a review, so I could get a good average of my experiences. The food has always been hot, well portioned, and flavorful. I've had the Philly Cheesesteak Bagel sandwich 3 times and it's excellent.. It's hearty and maybe good for a meal and half honestly. The hash browns have a nice "from the garden taste" to them. I start with the Green Go-Go juice, it's a nice filler while waiting for the good stuff. I also had the white chocolate caramel latte, it's a beautiful presentation and fantastic drink. I myself made the mistake of stirring the toppings in and it was pretty sweet after that. I also had the bananas foster waffle and it was incredible, but maybe not a breakfast for those counting calories LOL 

The staff are always friendly, attentive, and prompt.. I have eaten with Ashley the majority of the times though, she is awesome! She's always quick to suggest something and I have enjoyed every bite that she's mentioned. I'll be back for sure!

Best place for breakfast we have found in s long time. Service was great and food was even better all severes where in pjs and tables are set up so u from my feel like u r eating with the table next to you can't wait to come back .
This place is ok...service was on point... but food sucked.... pure fat...yuck yuck yuck... I can't believe they gave me PACE for salsa... even blueberry hill has real salsa....

Haven't been to this place in awhile due to horrible service. I decided to give the place a second chance. There are approximately 4 parties total in the restaurant. Coffee is cold, and my waitress took lunch right after taking our order. My parties food has been under a heating lamp for over 5 minutes. The staff does not seem to care much about customer service. I understand a waitress needs to eat, just not in front of their customers. . After finishing lunch our waitress brings our food. "The plates are extremely hot." Thanks heating lamp I appreciate it. After expressing concern for the time taken to cook the food our waitress replied with attitude. The manager came by and apologized for the miscommunication. The food tasted well. Over all not to bad of an experience.

We have been coming here for quiet some time now every Sunday.   The employees are beyond friendly and the food is amazing.  If you can ask for Sara for your server.  She always remembers our order and is a delight.  She always make our visit that much more enjoyable.  Chicken and waffles are my fav and probably the best I've ever had.  Annalise the manager should be proud of her team.  She has always been beyond accommodating to us.  Her upbeat personality rounds out a perfect breakfast for us every time.  Keep up the great work. We will be back next Sunday.

This is my second most favorite place in Vegas to have breakfast! I've probably tried half the menu and not one thing has been bad. Absolutely delicious food! Eggs are always cooked to perfection, best chicken fried steak EVER, awesome lattes, amazing French toast, perfectly grilled steaks, I could go on and on. Love the ambiance, too! 

The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is due to the attitude of some of the wait staff. Pretty snippy, even with fellow coworkers that I've seen.

My friend and I tried this restaurant this week for brunch. Our waitress,Chelsea, was excellent. The staff is very cute in pjs. The atmosphere is adorable with all of the umbrellas spinning on the ceiling. It entranced my 5 month old baby. 
I ordered the steak and eggs. My steak was a horrible cut of meat, trying to find something to eat off of it. I said something to the waitress. She apologized profusely and said she would tell the manager. He or she, not sure because they never came over, took 15% off of bill... It was $1.99 off the entire bill... Um thanks but no thanks.
The rest of the food was good.
What bothered me the most is that this FAMILY friendly restaurant does not have a baby changing table anywhere in the restaurant. My baby needed to be changed, desperately. Parents you know what I'm talking about... And we went into the ladies room no table, plus there is no counter space. So we had to wait to get home. When I asked about he changing table, the hostess kind of just shrugged me off. Why would there not be a Koala Kare in the restroom, in fact BOTH restrooms. Again family friendly it is not. This is not a big deal to most; but it is for a mom dealing with a baby.

Not sure if it is an off day or what but I am done eating and still waiting for a drink refill and my toast. I would love to love this place but when you are paying a premium you expect premium food and service. I just don't see it. My daughter got a waffle and added strawberries for $2.25. It was 1 strawberry cut up. What??

The restaurant itself is fine, good ambiance and not too loud. The biggest problem is the slow service. Took forever to get food after ordering. And the order was wrong, but because of the delay we ate it anyway.
Awesome place and food..... Now where are the bloody Mary's?  The owners are local and are great people. Be sure to put this place on your list.

First time impressions: I became a bit worried about the wait at first, but quickly forgot about it. Rise and Shine delivers on the food quality and variety. What other places offer a french press on your table for your morning brew? The ultimate rib eye breakfast came with a steak that hit the grill with just the right amount of char and pink. Prices are reasonable. I forgot what my one complaint was...

My first time here and I gotta say I will be back! The wait for a table was about 30 min, but that's normal for a breakfast spot on a Sunday at 11 am.
The service was very good. The waitress was friendly and came often to check on us.
The food was very good! Very generous potions and delicious. I had the cheese steak and eggs, my wife had the chicken and waffles and my kids had the red velvet pancakes.
My favorite was the chicken and waffles, but everything was good.

i love brunch. i will wait a very long time to get in on a good brunch.  that said, nothing is worse than waiting a long time to get in on an average brunch.  i should have gone through the trouble at home! the place is huge and seats a lot of patrons, so i don't know why the wait was so long. i ordered steak and eggs.  the steak was a thin cut rib-eye and cooked properly so therefore tender but over-seasoned.  it made every bit snap with flavor, but was not necessary for a rib eye.  i ordered poached eggs to go along and you could taste the vinegar added to the water to poach as a kitchen trick.  especially with over-seasoned steak, the contrast of the rich and buttery yolk was needed, only to be overpowered by the tartness of vinegar.  ick.  i didn't complain.  it was fine.  the portions were decent so the menu was a little pricier.  don't mind paying for well-executed food or something more interesting.  this was neither.

After a nice morning hike at red rock, this place was perfect to satiate my hunger. One word, CHILAQUILES! Its perfectly made, not too soggy with the perfect amount of avocado, sour cream, salsa and two types of cholula hot sauces to choose from. The upside down umbrellas remind me of being under the weather but their food (chilaquiles) makes everything better.

Hands down the best breakfast I've had in Vegas (and I've lived here for almost 5 years). Everything on the menu is delicious and the restaurant ambiance is a perfect combination of indoor outdoor barnyard feel setting. Staff wears comfy pajama uniforms which just adds to the great "breakfast" feel. Will absolutely be a return costumer as long as they're in business.

Rise & Shine is a very good American breakfast place. Me and my beautiful wife arrived there on a Sunday morning after having a terrible experience trying to grab some crepes at a small restaurant. The little restaurant got invaded by a large group of cyclists . Let me tell you about that first:

The cyclists were everywhere, I mean everywhere!!!! Sticking out of the restaurant in a large line; mostly speaking Chinese with a bunch of cameras  hanging in their neck. They had their bikes  standing all over the place and could not decide what they wanted to order. After standing at the door  letting them in and out because the line was so long, while that restaurant had only one guy cooking crepes, we decided to move on to our next bookmarked restaurant.

So, that's how we ended up at Rise & Shine! At first we were really mad about the cyclist group, but then we were glad they were there. Otherwise we would not be here at Rise & Shine right now. As we arrived in the restaurant we were welcomed by a wonderful hostess that took us to a nice table right the way. The only downside I feel about the restaurant is that the main room is very large and noisy. Besides that, this place is perfect.

They have really good and healthy food , which is our main concern as we millennials and we love an extremely healthy life style. So, lucky you for reading this review because I'm going to tell you we ordered and why it was so amazing. First of all, their portions are huge, I mean, we both do #crossfit and we eat a lot, yet still we were able to split the Ribeye breakfast dish... it was really cheap if you take in consideration that it came with two eggs, a large piece of meat  and chips with salsa avocado and beans. We also ordered two fresh juices, check my pictures of you don't believe it!!!

Rise & Shine is a must go if you are looking for a place that will fit your entire family in one large room with very large portions, cheap prices and the best quality of all: HEALTHY!!! We were pleasured to be serve by AMBER, who recommended the Ribs dish, and confirmed that the juices were made from fresh fruit . Thank you Amber, thank you Rose & Shine  for the amazing experience. Ah, one more thing, thank you Chinese  cyclists  for taking over the little crepes restaurant ;)

My wife and I paid a visit for the first time on weekday just after the lunch hour. First off--great chicken fried steak. Made on premises which is a rare thing indeed. Most places use the frozen ready to cook version. I'd give it a perfect 10 except that it was a bit to 'spicy' for my personal taste (cayenne pepper?)...but very close. The gravy was also excellent.  Very good potatoes. Waiter was a good guy and attentive enough. What really surprised and disappointed me was how messy the whole place was. I am far from a 'neat-freak' but  I couldn't help but notice how dirty the men's bathroom was -- sinks filthy, toilets dirty and trash overflowing onto the floor. The main floors in the restaurant had lots of bits of food and other 'droppings' visible. I realize it was after the lunch rush but there were more employees milling around than there were customers in the place. It would seem to be a simple management decision to have someone begin an effort to clean up. Which brings me to a strange moment. When my wife and I arrived she went to the restroom while I was being seated. As I mention, the place during this time of day was far from busy and there were plenty of open tables and booths. I requested to the hostess the we be seated at a table rather than a booth. She proceeds to lead me to a table right in front of the kitchen which is a location I am usually not a snob about...however there were two workers mopping the floor in the area between the table and the kitchen entrance. I stood there kind of waiting for the mopping to get done thinking to myself "why, in this sea of empty tables, would she interrupt these guys and want to sit us here?" I was getting ready to nicely ask for another table when a management-type lady came over and whispered into the ear of the hostess....who then picked up our menus off the table and said to me..."oh, lets move you...I didn't realize they were mopping"?!?!?!? Wow.

So..overall a very good review for the food (other than the surprisingly dry and boring wheat toast). My wife ordered a salad and gave it a solid "A".   Pretty sure we'll be back -- seems like a great place to bring out-of-town guests. I am going to assume the cleanliness issues were a fluke (again, lots of various level employees milling around and not one of them cleaning -- other than our two moppers at the kitchen entrance who weren't observed doing any other cleaning up during our one hour there) rather than poor management.  This would have been a four-star review rather than a three -- and as I said -- I am NOT a clean-freak so the condition of the facility was enough to garner my attention.

Wow , long wait but worth it 
Great Steak and eggs , great Corned beef hash and eggs and 
The Biscuits and Gravy are the BEST I've ever had , ever !!!!!! 
Chelsea is our server .. Very attentive

I've been here several times, really enjoy the food, service and atmosphere! Be prepared, come VERY hungry!!Portion sizes fairly big! Especially the pancakes, which are deee...licious!!! My Daughter and I, for a side dish, ordered 1 plain pancake & couldn't even finish it!!

So this location just opened around the corner from my house. Being a breakfast lover I had to check it out. Still in the soft opening phase but things were running fairly well. I got my breakfast, side of fruit and toast in 3 separate deliveries for example. Not too much delay and the food came out hot so not a big deal. One minor snafu as I asked for no onions and had to send it back. Normally that would annoy me but the waitress was sweet and understanding about it and I got a new omelet quick. May not sound like it bit I felt the service was good and will only improve.

So the food. I ordered the fancy steak omelet and it was delicious. Steak was perfectly medium rare and the omelet was well prepared. Side of bernaise sauce was delicious and a great compliment. Lots of fruit as a side and the hash browns have great flavor. One pet peeve I have to mention. I hate when places don't butter your toast! Haha silly to some but I want it buttered right out of the toaster so it melts into the toast. Being that this was my only.comolaint about the food though, I highly recommend this spot and look forward to going back.

My boyfriend and I came off a suggestion his co-worker made. You can tell this place is usually busy because for 2 we were told it was a 25 minute wait, then waited another 20 minutes after being seated to get any service, and the only reason we were was because I had to tell someone otherwise who knows how long we'd be sitting there. If rick is your server, he might not even pay attention to you. The smoothies were pretty good! I got the rib eye steak and eggs which was okay, but pretty salty. My boyfriend got the loco moco which he said was pretty good. Can't say it was good enough to suggest to anyone I know though.

Driving this morning and saw Rise & Shine a steak & egg place, since I had not had breakfast yet I checked out the menu online, it looked inviting so I decided to give it a try. I am glad I did, fortunately it was not packed yet so my first visit quite calm. A lot of that is due to the relaxed atmosphere, but still the customer is priority. I got sat facing the open kitchen which for me ( picky about the way the food is handled & who is preparing it ) was not off putting. The fun thing is that the servers wear pajamas. Pricing is consistent with similar restaurants, but the food I think was quite a bit better. Asked for my steak well done and unlike a lot of well done steaks I have received this one had a great char on the outside but was still tender enough on the outside ( no hockey puck here ). Service was excellent from the hostess all the way through and including bus help. I highly recommend coming here and this will now be my go to breakfast place.

Boyfriend and I always go to a new breakfast joint every Sunday and we ended up coming here yesterday. The French press coffee was the best part of our meal, along with the fresh squeezed orange juice and "cup of bread". The service was prompt and the server was friendly. Boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs with hash browns. I ordered the spice rub steak and chilaquiles. I know the steak is supposed to be spice rubbed but wow, the only flavor I found in that steak was a burnt one. Both meals were lacking in flavor and were mediocre at best. I would only recommend this place for the orange juice and for the cool little "weak, medium, strong" device that comes with the french press coffee. Other than that, I would not come back here.

I've been eye balling this place for sometime so when I finally got a chance to go I have to say, I was not disappointed. I love that decor with the flower fans in the ceiling and the down home feeling seating. I thought is was super cute that they wait staff wore pajamas as the uniform. My sister and I ordered the ultimate I believe. It came with these cute cinnamon bun pot breads with cream cheese icing. They were very tasty. Once we got our breakfast we realized that we could have shared. It was worth every penny and its not really expensive. The steak was perfect. Perfectly done and perfectly seasoned, we didn't really need A1. The staff were nice and attentive. Over all a great experience. I recommend this place to everyone.

Look no further if you're up for a great start to the day.  And waitresses in pajamas?  Rise and Shine has everything you are looking for in breakfast fare. Even the coffee is a rival to Dunkin!! And I think I know my corned beef hash- theirs is the best I've ever homemade had, hands down...no, hands up!

Rise and Shine has a cozy atmosphere and comfortable with booths and tables. An interesting concept is that the wait staff are dressed in pajamas. 
  
We were seated promptly and ordered water and coffee. The water arrived immediately but no coffee. After an extended wait a server was flagged down to get the coffee. Our server Sarah apologized for the delay. We arrived for breakfast shortly after a group of 14, hence the volume seemed to over whelm the kitchen with a long wait time for our breakfast order.

The order of Pancakes was delicious and consisted of 2 hubcap size cakes. Too much for the average person. The Chilaquiles had an over abundance of spicy ranchero chips and a little short on the refried beans.
We received the bill and were told to take our time. I put my credit on it and waited for our server to pick it up. After a lengthy wait I waived at Sarah and she advised us to pay at the register.

Right next to my LVAC gym and had to drop by and check out what it's all about. The ultimate steak and eggs breakfast was fantastic. The 8-9 oz. steak was cooked to perfection and was evenly smothered with gourmet black pepper. They're home style potatoes was the perfect combination with my steak, and truly was one of the best potatoes I've had in the valley.  My server Christina was great. A new local favorite...

So overpriced and still looks like a Joe's crab shack. Go to a casino and get steak and eggs for 6 dollars and you will get the same quality. I thought the waitress was rude and wore see through pajamas.

Location is misleading for first time visitors. It looks like there are no customers and you have to drive around the building where the main parking is located. When we finally found the door, we were promptly greeted and seated at a nice booth.  Portions are huge. I had the corned beef hash and scrambled eggs. The hash had a good flavor but over fried and greasy. The bread in a pot was a nice touch. My partner had eggs over easy, perfectly prepared, and bangers. They were very tasty, I would order them next time. The server was very nice, she answered all our questions and checked back to see if we needed anything. All in all, it was a good experience. The decor is interesting and fun.

Don't bother.   The much touted pot of bread is a waste.  It is really a dinner roll stuffed in a very small cup with cinnamon and a little side of sour tasting frosting.  Our pot was stale and over heated in the microwave until it was so tough one could not chew it. Similarly, biscuits were hard, heavy and leaden - not worth the calories.  Service - fair at best.  We had the ever-disappearing waitress who never came back except to drop off the check.   Too many other breakfast places that are good to return here.

An update Review. I had such a wonderful meal the day before I decided to take friends to breakfast. The service was atrocious, the food was disgusting. Water glasses sat empty,  no refills on anything. The waiter said how was everything  we sort of wins and he walked away  never giving us a chance to explain about the food .  The cashier asked how was everything I said the food was atrocious the service was terrible  and she shrugged it off . I said we will not return We drove off after paying our bill and everyone pulled off to the side of the 215 and were physically ill. I don't know what happened but for people physically ill at the same time? I would venture and say it was the food.

Third time was not the charm... I consider myself to be very fair individual and before I give any place a bad review I am going to make sure it wasn't just an off day or anything else.  All three times that I visited, the service was extremely slow and the servers consistently lacked a pleasant attitude and basic service skills.  The food is mediocre at best and certainly not worth the price.  This pains me as I love the location near Southern Highlands and I was extremely excited when I learned they were opening a new location less than a mile from my home.  On my third and last visit which also happened to be my birthday we did not even make it through coffee before a handful of issues came up.  Even something as simple as creamer for my coffee was a task proven to be challenging.  Upon checkout I had no intention of any sort of complaint - I just simply wanted to pay our tab and be on our way until I was questioned on why we were leaving without eating so, of course, I was willing to offer my feedback only to receive a very rude, defensive response from the Rise & Shine employee.  What a shame.  Luckily I wasn't willing to allow such a negative start to my day ruin any part of my Birthday so we were off to a nearby breakfast gem that took great care of us!  I will not return to Rise & Shine.

Been wanting to try this place.  And the reviews are mixed.  The exterior of the place is nice, but the interior is dark and the decor really doesn't mix with the kind of vibe they're trying to create.  Rise & Shine should be bright and cheery.  This place just looks strange inside with it's strange looking upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling.  The staff was ok, but were not overly friendly or attentive.   The menu variety does look good and I will be back to order a few other items.  My friend and I both had Build Your Own Omelettes which were great.  Probably the best omelette I've ever had.  The hash browns were beyond disgusting though.  I've never seen hashbrowns like this and I don't know why people insist on putting onions in hashbrowns?!   Potato Salad and hashbrowns do not need onions!   If made right, they stand on their own merit.  The Pot of Bread was good, but it is badly plated and difficult to eat the way it is.  I almost broke the cup trying to get it out.  Overall, it is ok.  I will probably try the one in Southern Highlands next time to see if it is any better from an ambiance and staffing point.

Decided to try rise and shine as we have seen it many times as we are frequent eaters at greens and proteins.   We went in and waited for  9 minutes to get seated, several employees  passed us by and nothing.  One even mentioned we'll be right with you.  It was probably longer than 9 minutes, that's when I looked at my watch.  Note there was plenty of available seating.  so we decided to leave and go to the other breakfast place nearby.   Unfortunately we weren't able to try the food but the service was terrible.
Amazing food!  The cup of bread was incredible.  And our server, Sarah, was the best.  She was helpful and informative!
Foods is great only reason I did not give 5 stars is that they do not serve alcohol..
Food is good, but service time is very slow. Make sure you're not in a rush to get in and out of here because it won't happen.

This was my second time coming here. Both times we had to wait over a half hour to get seated. Wouldn't be that big of a deal, but there were plenty of tables available. Seams understaffed and not managed very well. The first time, we got our food fairly quick and it was very good. The second time the food was also good, but we waited over 45 minutes to get our food. I would give the food 4-5 stars, but the unnecessary wait will probably keep us from coming back. Shouldn't take an hour and a half to eat lunch.

Their breakfast portions are pretty big! Their coffee is GREAT and their steak and eggs are my fave! First time I went out waitress was extremely nice, which always makes the visit nice and she even gave us coffee to go!

Came here because it had great reviews. Super disappointed:( coffee was cold and had zero flavor. Ordered the steak and spinach benny, steak medium rare... it came medium and the rest of the food was just warm. Nothing was hot like it had just been made. Server delivered the food and gave us the check at the same time?? Never asked us how the food was or came back after we finished eating. Pretty disappointed.

Probably the premiere place to get some steak and eggs in my opinion. It's not a $5-6 steak and egg that you can get as a late night special, but you pay for better quality and things you can't get elsewhere. 

One of their highlights I would say is their pot of bread. It's almost like a cinnamon roll, and especially when you dip it into their cream cheese icing (or whatever the deliciousness is), it takes just like one. Since they have a full breakfast menu, you can get a variety of items. One of my favorites are the chilaquiles with the ribeye steak. Unfortunately it doesn't come with the pot of bread, but you could always get it on the side, it's worth it! The servers all wear pajamas, so I guess it fits into the theme of Rise and Shine, and I think it's pretty cool. Definitely worth the visit!

First timer here. We were in the mood to venture out instead of hitting our usual local weekend breakfast spots. 
Of course, I Yelp before parking. Not too sure about staff wearing PJ's, but the reviews coaxed me to try it.
As we enter, at first glance I see this location is very spacious. Tables are evenly separated. The decor is bright and whimsical. Then I crowd check, not bad. There are enough guests to say "this place is a crowd pleaser". 
Lucky me, no waiting. We are greeted and seated rather instantly.  Waitress is very friendly and professional. 
I ordered the chilaquiles with a hard fried egg Hubby had biscuits n gravy and we split 2 pancakes. 
Inquired about the coffee, a fine Italian Import. Hubby was given a sample and really liked the 
Rich strong flavor, so he ordered a cup. 

The GM was on the floor, checking in on guests. It was so nice chatting with her. Can't wait for their new location to open.

The best part was the 2 giant pancakes staying hot thru the meal!

Everything was very yummy! 

Warning: Portions are large

Open: 7am to 3 (Just in case there are some late sleepers reading my review.

The wait was definitely worth it! Great food, great service. I'm always satisfied after my visit here. I wish there would've been outdoor seating available it was a nice day. The manager even paid a visit to our table which is always appreciated

NO LONGER DOG FRIENDLY.  We frequented rise n shine and would eat in the outside patio with our dogs.  However we were recently turned away because we had our dogs, so we will have to take it off our rotation.  We love how dog friendly most LV aplaces are, and are very disappointed they have taken this stance.  It's contrary to he trend in Las Vegas.

We have been to the other location twice before. This time we tried the newer location. The chicken and waffles are amazing. I love the fresh baked cinnamon bread in the little cup. The servers all wear pajamas and the atmosphere is fun. Try the fresh squeezed juices to get some amazing vitamins. Will go again next time in Vegas area!!!

My 2nd time here with my sister and brother Tony and Kids. 1st time I had steak and eggs it was awesome. This time I had the Red Velvet Pancakes w/sausages yummayyyyy!! I love Red Velvet anything! This is a nice spot to bring the family for some good breakfast.

This place is amazing, the waitress wears jammies, fresh squeezed orange juice, French press coffee and a smoothie bar.  I got waffle and fried chicken and Stephen got eggs Benedict, everything was delicious.  Lots of room too, they don't have everyone crammed into a tight area like the egg works does.

We wanted to try this place out since it is fairly new and we'd never been before. So this Sunday we decided to take the plunge and give it a chance. 

First off, we went at 10:30 on a Sunday. Obviously, we are expecting a wait. We were told 25 minutes and they sat us pretty close to that time frame. We got a nice booth by a window. That was a pleasant surprise. One thing I noticed while waiting was the fresh juice station. That was a really neat touch and something you don't see often. It also helps swallow the $3.25 for a glass of apple juice. 

So things were starting out pretty well. The menu is expansive. Lots of options. My dad ordered ham and eggs and my boyfriend and I ordered The Ultimate Steak and Eggs. We also ordered a stack of pancakes for all of us to share. Then, we waited. And waited. And waited. Again, understandable since we could see it was busy. Still waiting. At least 30+ minutes went by. Finally our server, Brody, came up to us and said, "Sorry for the wait on your meals but there was some confusion in the kitchen with your ticket." I can't stand this excuse. All that means to me is that our server forgot to ring in our food, our ticket was lost, or the kitchen messed something up. But please don't say that to me like we don't know what's going on. The best way to handle that situation is to say, "I'm sorry about the wait on your meals. I've notified a manager of the situation and we are working hard to get your good here as soon as possible. Let me grab your pancakes so you all have something to munch on." We were brought our bread. About 10 minutes later, our food arrived. One of us missing toast. And of course, not a pancake in sight. And no mention of them coming. So I told him to forget the pancakes. The hash browns were good. The steak was okay. None of it was stand out. I feel like I could have gotten this meal anywhere. 

When we went to pay, we mentioned our disappointment to the cashier who also did nothing to try to remedy the situation. No manager came by to check on us. 40 minutes or more waiting for food is ridiculous. Even when you're busy. Most entrees come to your table within 20 minutes. The only reason I know any of this is because I've worked as a server in restaurants for over 5 years. This just wasn't a great experience because of the service. I'm happy to go elsewhere.

I came with my mommy friends and those without. The space was great for all of us. 3 mommies 2 babies under 6 months, 1 1yr old and 1 2yr old and 2 other adults. We were seated inside and it was a nice scenary. 
I got the bottomless coffee. I was disappointed because when I see bottomless I expect my mug to always be full!! They only served my mug twice! What a disappointment. 
I ordered the french toast with the platter. French toast was fluffy and tasted okay. Nothing special. The eggs and turkey kielbasa were okay as well. Again nothing special. 
When checking out the line was outrageous. Only one cashier, I hope they open at least 2 people at the register! 
Overall service can improve and food was just okay.

Wow!!! Talk about the best place for breakfast dishes... This is it! The steak and eggs are CRAZY good, I've eaten there 3 times this week. The eggs Benedict are awesome! The pancakes are delish!! This place rocks! Not only is the food amazing, the servers are the best ever! Khrys ( I believe that's how she spells her name) is so pleasant and on top of her game. Thanks Rise and Shine for starting my day off with a very happy tummy!

This place is so slow and under staff. For the size of the building they should be able to handle a high volume of costumes. What a horrible impression this place has made! It was empty and there was an hour wait. People were walking away left and right.
My wife and I have made this our weekend brunch place. The food is always incredible as well as the service. We always recommend this place and will continue to come here weekly!

If you can get over the obvious fact this used to be a Joe Crab's shack, the inside ambiance is great. They have spinning upside umbrellas and lights that adorn the ceiling, and all the servers wear onesie pajamas.

The food does not stand out to me, but it is of good quality. I have yet to try their steak and eggs, but the pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, the eggs benedict, the hash browns, and the bacon are on par with most breakfast places. Edible, but nothing I am scrambling to come back for. Portions are typical of a standard breakfast place.

The service, however, was not good. I have been to this place three times, and every time the service has been severely lacking. Don't get within an hour of them closing, as the ambiance drops as employees begin mopping and cleaning next to you while you eat, and the servers stop caring whether you need more coffee or anything. Each time I have been it had taken a good 5 plus minutes or more before even being acknowledged after being sat. Make sure you ask for everything you need when they do talk to you, because that might be the last time someone stops by before your bill. 

Speaking of the bill, this place is pricey, especially for what you get, food and service wise.

They do fresh squeeze their juice, and you will pay for it, but it is very delicious. Consider getting the carafe if more than one person at your table is getting orange juice, it will save you a little bit. The servers will not point this out to you.

Fatty steak, but cooked as I wanted.  Hostess was not friendly.  Seemed to look through me or around me and I just wanted a table for 1. Best part was my waitress, Sammie.   Blonde from Great Britain, friendly and attentive.

I walked in and thought, am I tripping'!? Is it me or is the ceiling moving... pajamas everywhere... spinning...spinning. And we're back, it wasn't just me - there are artistic umbrella-like flowers spinning from the ceiling and cute flower pot mosaics. The decor is colorful, farm and garden. And there are pajamas, the servers are actually all wearing pj's... which is encouraging- next time I'll partake and we can all be friends. I'm really enjoying the vibe.

On to the food - the portions are large and the menu has a mix of favorites and lots of mixing-it-up. The egg-in-the-hole bacon French toast sounded creative. However, I went for the Three Pigs bagel sandwich with hash browns. It was huge! The over medium eggs were cooked perfectly - that's a deal breaker, so I was very happy that they were so drippy and messy! The sandwich was a monster; it was ooey, gooey, meaty, cheesy all over the place. The sandwich was good, liked the banger especially & the everything bagel. I was not happy with the soggy hash browns that tasted weirdly burnt and soggy at the same time. The neighbors' fries looked better.  Overall, it's a bright atmosphere, service was good, and the sandwich was good & from what I've seen so far - it's a decent breakfast spot in the area.
Highly recommend.  Smoked salmon bagel, loco moco, and bananas foster waffle were all awesome.

I live in Indiana... and when I come to Vegas, this is my #1 choice for breakfast. Fast, friendly service. Many different menu options. Have a family member with several food allergies (dairy, gluten, several fruits), and she can eat here without issue. I would highly recommend the "Cup of Bread" with your meal. Half cinnamon roll/half sweet bread with cream cheese dipping sauce, served in a mug! Very awesome atmosphere and even better food!
One of my favorite breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas. The ribeye and eggs is the bomb. Ashley Silva is the nicest waitress. Go see the crew in pajamas!

This was my first visit to this location, and unfortunately will be my last.

I made a take out order for the Smoked Salmon and Bacon Bagel, on an everything bagel for myself, then Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes, and the ULTIMATE Steak and Eggs, medium rare, and scrambled for the bf. 

I got home and opened up his steak and eggs, took a look at the steak, and was very disappointed, I had to do a double take. It was burned on the outside, over seasoned and NOT medium rare. He took a bite out of it and immediately gagged, not only was it over-seasoned, but it was spoiled. It was placed on top of the eggs and hash browns, so the taste of the meat ruined everything else in the box. 

We called and spoke to Vanessa, the manager, and expressed our disappointment in the quality of the food. She was immediately apologetic, said it was unacceptable, took our name and ensure that we would be compensated the amount for our next visit. Very well handled and extremely professional. 

We were so sickened that we ended up bringing the food back, only to realize that the location we called was the one in Southern Highlands. I was greeted by the manager Analisa at this location. I apologized for the mix-up, told her what we spoke to Vanessa about, and kindly asked Analisa to please take a moment and speak to the manager at the other store, as we explained the situation to her and she'd be able to confirm our agreement. Her immediate response was "She's busy." She didn't even attempt to pick up the phone. 

She looked into my box of food, and asked "well, what's wrong with it? That's medium rare" even after I had explained to her that it was burned and over seasoned. 

She looked at me as if I was stupid for asking her to call another location, and started to tell me that she'd comp the order OR have the food made again, but I'd have to still pay. She told me she needed the card if I wanted to be refunded and so I headed back to my car to retrieve my wallet. When I returned she had already told the cooks to start the order again, even though I did not agree to it. Turns out she was actually able to go back and just void the purchase, without the need of a card, but couldn't even provide a copy of the voided transaction at all. She even said, in a really condescending manner, "You can come back here and try it." My bf heard that and got upset that she was disrespectful, so he said no, that's fine, let's go, after she wrote "VOID" on my crumpled original transaction receipt. I walked out, and went to the car, and saw Analisa following my bf out of the door, yelling at him, in front of many of the guests that were dining on the patio. 

Extremely disappointed in the unprofessionalism of Analisa, and the staff at this location. Will not return.
This is the second time I go try eat at this place and both occasions I find myself and family waiting in front to be seated and my last visit we waited so long we left. We never going there again.

Second time coming now and we'll definitely be back again. The cinnamon crunch French toast is great and the hash browns are to die for. I think it's the only reason we plan on coming here more often besides the waitresses and waiters in pajamas. 
Definitely well worth the wait in line also.

Friends and I were looking for a place that was different with a local vibe.  Went on Yelp and found this awesome place.  Waitress serve you in pajamas and the pot in a cup roll is Bombay! The bangers were well cooked and the food was great!

The best breakfast I have had in a while! We had the corn beef hash which was absolutely amazing and the cinnamon crunch French toast that was to die for! Everything is very fresh...make sure to try the fresh juices too...I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas!!

I ordered the rib eye & eggs breakfast. It was decent. Steak was nicely seasoned and wasn't too huge of a portion. Only complaint was my hash browns were cold. Other than that the food was on point. I would come back.
Love this place!!! Chicken and waffles keeps me coming back with the nice and warm syrup. Can't forget the pot of bread you get with certain dishes such as their omelets. Nice portion sizes.

First off, let me say that I'm a breakfast connoisseur   This place is AMAZING. The food is top notch. The staff was amazing and so was management. We had a small issue and it was handled so professionally that afterward it wasn't an issue at all. I'll definitely be back! Can't wait.

5 stars. Hands down! My boyfriend & I went here on a Sunday morning, very crowded & we were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait. We were seated within 10 minutes. Customer service was very friendly & loved that their work attire was pajamas. 

Everything was delicious! Pancakes, coffee, OJ, eggs Benedict, cup of bread. Loved it all & can't wait to go back. One of the best egg Benedict I've ever had. Overall great experience, spacious restaurant that is conveniently located, great atmosphere with pretty cool decor.

Walk in prior to going to the gym and ask the lady at the front if I can make reservation. Told me that they don't make reservation in advance and I have to be there physically which I totally understand. I then asked if I can call to be put on a waiting list right before Im about to finish my work out. The lady said yes. No problem so far. 

I called the place 50mins later and ask to be put down on the waiting list and manager denied me. I told manager that I have came in prior and lady at the front told me that I can call in advance. Manager asked me who I've spoke with and basically denied my request because I couldn't gave her a name. I'm not trying to be difficult, simply want to put my name down on the waiting list like everyone else and I was finishing up at the gym which is 5 mins away from the facility. If a staff don't introduce their names to me at the front, I'm not going to be like:"what's your name?" Either training your staffs better or honor what they've told to the customer!! Failed management. One star for being so accommodating! Way to go to lose your new customers. I'd be sure to tell all my friends and family not to go here.

my boyfriend and I are always trying new breakfast spots around town. I work by this location and I've always seen it driving by so we decided to go this morning. The wait was about 15 minutes as promised. the house was packed so I was thinking this must be a really good spot. We asked what our waitress recommended (which by the way was wearing PJs, how FUN!) for us first timers and she recommended the ultimate ribeye breakfast and a side of pancakes for us both to share. We ended up ordering just that but the red velvet pancakes. OMG. The red velvet pancakes are to DIE for. Chocolate overload. And the ribeye was cooked to perfection . Our over easy eggs were perfectly runny and the potatoes had so much flavor. A new favorite for sure. We will be back soon, maybe even next weekend

40 minute wait..... Looks like a large breakfast place - but only uses less then 1/2 the space inside and no seating on the large deck?????????  Because of the wait we walked across the street.  I have never waited 40 minutes to have breakfast.  Very disappointed...  Hopefully they get it together with a breakfast bar since there was only two of us or get more tables inside and out.  A lot of people walked away because of the wait - they are loosing a lot of business!!!  The one star rating is for this disappointment only since we were not able to try their food - maybe next time.....

Great service, menu is ok it's not very organized. I love their French toast and their chicken fried steak. They give you great portions for the price you pay. I take all my family there to try it when they come.

Had breakfast with sara as our server.  My lady had the by strip with spinach and bear aisle over an everything bagel.  She said it was very tasty and the portion was large.  I had a ribeye with eggs, hash browns and their own house baked cinnamon pot of bread.  For only $15 the ribeye was surprisingly tasty.  I get a little wary when I eat a steak that is under $45 but this was great for the money.  We will be back and ask for sara.

Collin is very sweet and very professional.. I ordered the chicken and waffles, cinnamon pancakes and my friend ordered the fancy steak omelette . i didn't really like the chicken and waffles but the go go juice was good and very refreshing.. i will definitely come back for the pancakes, go go juice & the great service!!! Thanks again Collin, youre awesome! :)
Definitely recommend this place, HUGE menu and amazing service. Our server Nicole was very friendly and let us try their infamous cup of bread (must try!!!) and was very attentive to us.
This is a very cute and cozy breakfast place. The food is always good and service is fast. Pancakes are gigantic and always amazing!
Krys is awesome! She was a very attentive server and the food was great!!!!!!! I got a waffle and it was so fluffy I could die!

We loved our experience at Rise and Shine! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was fun and lively. The only concern was the price - our check was $34 for me and my 10 year old before tip! Try the pot of  bread for sure and ask for a side off cream cheese syrup!!We will be back!!!

We arrived at rise & shine for breakfast and not knowing what to expect were pleasantly surprised how good the food was but the service I can't tell you was the best I have ever had! Our server was Jerry and he was so attentive but not in a pushy kind of way! I will definitely be back to see him! Thank you Jerry for making our breakfast awesome!

My first Yelp review and our (me, Hubby and doggies) first visit to Rise and Shine.  We called ahead to confirm the dog-friendly patio and were told yes.  Upon our arrival we were promptly seated and our server,James, was very pleasant and enthusiastic about the menu.  He provided his recommendations and we asked him about food for the doggies.  They put together a scramble for the doggies and offered water for them, too.  I had the original pancake - heavenly! Half-order was more than enough; Hubby had the chicken and waffle.  Loved it! Coffee was great, too. Excellent service, delicious food and nice roomy patio for all of us.  We will be back!
Always great service and the banana foster waffle is AMAZING! This is officially our family breakfast stop! Love it!

My wife and I tried this place for the first time today.  We ordered the grilled chicken cobb salad and asked they hold the bacon, bleu cheese and the green onions.  When it came out there was almost nothing on it the chicken breast was maybe 4oz, there was supposed to be avocado and egg but there was none and for $13.95 it was not a good deal.

This place is conveniently located on flamingo and 215. I came here before I went to the gym. I ordered a freshly squeezed orange juice that was pretty good. I also had a "go go green" juice that was really good and refreshing. This place is okay. The drinks are the only reason why I would ever come back. The food was very mediocre. The service was really slow for as empty as the place was. Most of the employees wear pajamas as uniforms. Kinda sloppy if you ask me....

The only time I'll rise & shine early on a weekend is if a hearty breakfast is involved! 

This place has become one of my favorite breakfast places here in Vegas. Especially on a Sunday, don't be surprised if there's a 30+ minute wait. But... it's totally worth it!

The servers uniform are PAJAMAS!! So, you know it's a cool & fun place. And the food is Deeeeeelicious!! 

The Country Fried Steak: Good!
The Steak n Eggs: Good!
The Pot of Bread: Good!

The portion sizes are massive as well, so I'd recommend sharing so you can try different things =)

YES. I always loved getting steak & eggs and places like the grand cafe - but now a place that SPECIALIZES in it?! YES!

My ONLY *issue* is that it was SO GOOD that I wanted more!!!
(No really, can I get a bigger steak, YUM!)

I will definitely be coming back!

The food was good but the quality was kind of cheap. I ordered and egg white omelet with salsa.. The salsa tasted like the Pace salsa from the grocery store.. Little disappointing. The hash browns are great but pretty greasy... Feeling a pit in my stomach now! This would be a great place if you have a hangover.. Not healthy enough to come regularly.

This might just have replaced Hash House as my go to for over the top, filling, stick to your ribs, breakfast.

Thanks to my little sis who's a local, she suggested coming here and I'm glad she did. Everything on the menu looked delicious and I ended up ordering the Chicken Fried Steak, which is basically a platter of food.

You get a small cow that's battered in a nicely crisp coating/crust. Was quite easy to cut into and dip into my country gravy that was also used to douse my biscuit. 

Two eggs (any way you like it) over easy, was fun to crack and let the yolk ooze over my chicken fried steak which was on top of a layer of shredded hash browned potatoes. The potatoes were still crisp and enjoyable. I'm not a fan of soggy hash browns.

It was a lot of food, but I can handle it and I was on vacation, so I deserved every single bite and calorie that I consumed.

Seems like always a great place to grab breakfast or lunch foods. Good amount on the menu but not too much to make you dizzy. Ive ate here a few times and the food has always been good. The food is prepred the way you ask from steaks to eggs. And the wait staff has always been polite and curtious. If your in the mood for some hearty delicious brunch style food well this is a place to try.

Went there today with my bestfriend around 1:30p and the place is pretty much empty about 3 to 4 table is filled with customer.  We come in and greeted by the hostess and we requested booth, she says all the booths are dirty right now we will get it cleaned, it took about good 10 to 15 mins wait, even all the booths are clean and one is dirty. I stood up waiting from the waiting area and this server Sarah came up to me, all the booths are still dirty and I will clean them up with the attitude and negative vibe I got for her. Next thing u know she went back to the back to get a rag that took her a while as well. Me and my BFF went to
the table that she said she had cleaned, but it's still pretty wet when we had seated. I ask her a napkin so I can wipe the table off and she had took few steps ignoring my request and turned around and said ok. My BFF can already tell tht I am not happy with the customer service In this place, so
she had went up to the customer and told her the story. While my friend is talking to the hostess, I had gathered our stuff went to the counter as well. We are pretty disappointed with the server "SARAH", because she was very rude and not an inch of customer service skills she had. While talking to the hostess and Madison (manager) the server still yapping at the back of course prolly about us. I
had a good experience here at the first visit my sister brought me there. I had brought my BFF there so she can try the place, but after that experience with that server "SARAH", I feel disgusted and just lost my appetite. Thank you for the manager Madison for handling the situation very well, but I hope u guys talk to SARAH on how she can improve her customer service skills. Goodluck!

ATTENTION wear your sweatpants when you come here. This place doesn't play games and neither should you. Their menu is incredible and nice and big. Just the way I like it. Their red velvet pancakes are delish and so perfect. Three people can share an order. Their chilaquiles rock as well. And their bacon is my fav.

My first trip to Rise and Shine was to their Southern Highland location a while back.  We loved it and were in there often until it started getting so packed you can never get in there.  I was sad about the traffic but what can you do? That place was so good ... great breakfast and great service ... that it deserves all the demand!!

I was excited when this location opened!  But my first visit was disappointing.  The service was slow and not so great.  I've since chalked that up to growing pains in the new location.  

Today's visit has been wonderful and exactly what I remember from my visits to SH location.

I got the Ribeye & Scrambled Eggs w/ their pot of bread.  The PoB is a flower pot or coffee cup with a light fluffy cinnamon bread baked in.  This is so fricken cool and tastes good too.  The steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  I also recommend any of their oversized bagel sandwiches.  

This is a must visit for anyone up on the west side!!

DELICIOUS! Try the Steak chilaquiles :)
Desir was our server. Very attentive and sweet.

If you like a hearty breakfast, Rise & Shine is your place.

I stopped by the Flamingo location to give their red velvet pancakes a try.
The parking and entrance set up are confusing.  The parking is on the side and behind the building.  There's a sign directing you to a ramp but I found it easier to walk through a section of parking lot.

Once inside, I was seated quickly.  The dining room is spacious and has all kinds of great eye candy hanging inside.  I believe this building used to house Joe's Crab Shack and they've done a great job of making you forget that.  

The menu is huge.  Every breakfast food imaginable is on the menu.

My server (male, forgot his name) was wonderful.  He was busy with many other tables but always kept my drink filled and made sure I was completely happy with my meal.

The red velvet pancakes were monster sized!  I'd guestimate that each piece was easily the size of a frisbee.  There were three pieces.  I wasn't crazy about their cream cheese dressing as it tasted like it had a hint of cinnamon in it.  Their warm fresh maple syrup was delicious on its own, but a little sweet for this particular pancake which were dusted in powdered sugar and contained chocolate chips.

I'd definitely recommend this place for breakfast lovers, large groups, and anyone who is in the mood to try something new.

Omg!!! They have THE BEST French toast I've ever had in my life!!! They're syrup is to die for! Delicious coffee and sweetbread. I HIGHLY recommend this place... if you haven't tried it... you don't know what your missing!!

This place is seriously the best breakfast in Vegas! My boyfriend and I come here every Sunday and we love it! The hostess at the front is always so sweet and accommodating! The only reason for the missing star is for the servers. This location is always busy and always very full. There aren't enough servers to accommodate all of their tables and it is definitely noticeable for small things like not getting enough refills, having to get up and go to the server station and ask for things like syrup or butter. It isn't the servers fault but they give too many tables to only one server and they get overwhelmed and can't give every guest 5 star service. Otherwise, the food is incredible, the hostesses are awesome, and the atmosphere is nice but they definitely need more help!

After eating at the Southern Highlands location and being very pleased, I Thought that I'd give this location a try. I did not have the same experience. I ordered the same Omelette. It was very firm and over cooked. It also seemed to lack flavor so I found myself using half the pepper shaker to make it more palatable. Yes the pot of bread was good but I really wanted a nice omelette. The service was okay except for the cashier, not so friendly. The restaurant itself has a charming atmosphere and is decorated lovely. But if you want better prepared food then I would take the drive to their Southern Highlands location- your food will likely be much better. Or try The Original Pancake House. Now,  go relax and have breakfast or brunch!

The staff is so friendly! Plus their uniforms are pjs! So cute! The server got to us super fast and brought us are food and took our order in a timely manner. She knew what we wanted before we even had time to ask. Very impressed. The food was delicious. The rib eye was cooked perfectly. The chiliques was so yummy and the pot of bread was to die for. The price was great to we are definitely coming back soon.

Just moved to the area looking for some bomb breakfast and boy this place didn't disappoint!! Big portions and quick service.  Stacy was on point she recommended the steak chiliquiles which was amazing.  Can't wait to come back again

I am huge fan of Rise & Shine southern highland location. I'm super excited that this location opened up! Not only is this place closer, but their menu is larger! a different menu item is their Loco moco. it was pretty good! they were extremely busy with a long wait, but like the other location, customer service is always on par. they also have more fresh fruit juices at this location, too. will for sure be back soon!

The wear your pajamas atmosphere is great. Bright colors and fresh squeezed juices get everything going right. 
Now to the meal. Steak and eggs was the best choice. A thinly sliced ribeye with a great char to the cooked. Still being left medium rare with a great cook on the meat takes skill. The potatoes are hash with a flat almost fettuccine cut. They are finished with a great crispy edges to give them good texture. Eggs were scrambled with good flavors. The overall occasion is a must return.

Cool vibe, very open layout, all staff is dressed in some sort of pajama or sleepwear. Food was good, we went for lunch and had the southwest turkey melt panini and the grilled cheese. Yes, pretty basic choices I know, but it's what we're in the mood for! Fries were the skinny shoestring style, not my favorite but they did have a kind of herb sprinkled on them that was pretty tasty

Came into this restaurant today for a morning breakfast meeting with some colleagues. Looked like a fun little place at first and i was excited to try it. I learned immediately that there was no wi-fi network available, which I find slightly ridiculous in 2018. I had my meal which was pretty boring and fairly tasteless. Upon finishing my meal, I needed to leave and asked the waitress for my part of the check to be split off so I could pay. She refused, and told me the machine could only split the check two ways (there was 6 of us). Now, I'm no genius here... But I do understand point of sale systems and I do know that they can run multiple transactions and split checks many different ways. This was merely her not wanting to do it, or restaurant policy. Either way it's pretty ridiculous. Suffice to say I won't be returning to this location.
Such a unique place. Great vibes and great food' portions are huge! Visited Las Vegas from California but will definitely be back!!

The staff is friendly and the service is quick. I ordered the steak omelette which I wasn't crazy about. The cup-o-bread and has browns that came with it were delicious. There is also a 10% military discount.
