I was not a fan. We couldn't even figure out where to enter. They need better signage.

As we walk in, we were seated right away. My hubby and I order the rib eye steak chilaquiles and it just wasn't that great. It lacked flavor that I only had a few bites before I didn't want any more. 

One thing I did like is that they had cool socks at the front of the store. I did purchase a pair.

They asked me to Yelp so here it is. Ten minutes for coffee, the wrong food was delivered to us. The food itself was overcooked and cold. We had the pleasure of speaking with our server when we ordered and when he dropped off our bill. The upside is the host stand, they were very friendly when paying our bill, we couldn't get out of there fast enough! 
Good luck
If an outstanding meal is what you are looking for then this is the place! Amazing Chris provided amazing service and the coffee was fantastic!

I come to eat with my family on Sunday  The food was good as usual The server was very nice but the food Took at least One hour The staff is very nice over there  they gave us 15% off because we complain for the food take forever

I LOVE this place and of all the restaurants in the city, I always come back here. The menu is varied and everything I've eaten, they've done brilliantly! The portion sizes are very generous, the eggs are delicious, the hash brown is so good and we love the French Press. Some of the beat coffee in the city!
Come with an appetite though! You won't be disappointed!

I absolutely LOVE this place. I got the crunchy cinnamon French toast with the side of eggs and bacon and it's was heavenly. I'm not exaggerating at all either. My girlfriend got the ribeye steak and eggs w/ potatoes and the steak was DELICIOUS. The service was pretty quick and the waitresses wear cute pajamas. The only reason I didn't put five stars is because our side of toast didn't come buttered and it was kind of stale. I don't know if me wanting the toast to come warm and buttered is weird but I do. Otherwise everything was so so good. OH! also they have fresh squeezed OJ & it was tasty but it cost like $5.. but it was kind of worth it. Highly recommend!
Best steak and eggs I've ever had! Everything is extremely fresh. Even the OJ is squeezed there fresh daily. The staff was great and attentive. We will definitely be back!

I tried this place 2 times in the last 3 days. I love the decor inside and the food is even better. Both times I ordered the ultimate steak and 3 eggs scrambled. The steak is juicy and well seasoned. I could it it everyday. My first visit I had Madison as my waitress. She was real friendly and helpful. The second time my server wasn't very memorable. I'll be sure to sit in Madison's section next time.

This was my first time having breakfast and wow! One of the best breakfast I had. I had the protein egg white omelet and it was scrumptuous! Service was awesome and love the pj look!! Will definitely return and great place to bring company for a great breakfast and environment.

What is not to love about rise & shine, my husband and I came in on a Sunday morning before church at 9am. No wait, no line, no problems.

We were greeted by a beautiful hostess who had us promptly seated and minutes later we were greeted by our sweet and fun waitress in blue pajamas with white lining on the arms and the ends of her bottoms. (I wish I remembered her name we tipped her extra because she was perfect.) anywho, she got us drinks immediately and helped us to decipher some things on the menu. We went with the pot of bread for each of us. HELLO, so good?!? And my husband had the Italian iced coffee. 

we came with our 5 month old, they didn't have a sling or highchair for her carseat but she slept the entire time and they put her carseat in a chair, we kind of wish she woke up just so she could see the beautiful umbrellas on the ceiling. 

For our entrees I had chicken and waffles - well seasoned, slightly spicy, too much breading but so delicious... and my husband had the ultimate steak and eggs, he was so wowed by the flavor of everything on his plate he asked if we could come back with our whole family for Father's Day. 

We asked to book a table a whole month in advance for Father's Day and were told that Sunday mornings we probably shouldn't have a problem but to call ahead to get a time estimate, the manager was awesome and so was our hostess. 

Now here comes the con. - I won't mark the restaurant 4 stars just because the cashier ruined my morning so... 
We rated our visit a 15 until it was time to checkout. We approached the check out and had to check out with the woman in the front... She was happy to take my money but angry and pissed to take my virtual stamp card. As a matter of fact, she wanted me to step to the side and figure out how to make it work while she checked other people out and then when I did she gave me credit for one thing when essentially I was owed credit for the coffee, and both entrees. Makes me sad that on every table they hype up the app and if everyone gets that same push back j don't care how beautiful your establishment is, how great your food is, and how amazing your management and waitress staff is, the cashier needs an attitude adjustment. She set a bad tone for my Sunday, which was also my birthday weekend. Let her know we appreciate what help we got. So be warned, unless you've used "epoxy" the app before, don't ask questions when you check out.
Great breakfast - more than I could eat. The pot of bread was novel and tasty. Will be back again.

First time for breakfast here! Decor was awesome! Servers wear the cuteness pajamas. Food was great, we also had freshly squeezed orange juice and a delicious latte with nutella. We were seated immediately and Nicole was our amazing waitress. She was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. Thank you for the great experience Nicole!

As an avid bruncher and vegas native, I like to think I know a thing or two about local breakfast eateries. Been meaning to try this spot for a few months now as its within a few miles from home and could easily become the go to location. Made plans ahead of time with another couple who hadn't tried this spot either but was interested. 
Arrived around 11am on a Sunday to a 30 min wait. Not surprising and expected for time and day. What was surprising was how slow service seemed to move with how big the restaurant was. I've worked in the restaurant industry in the past so it didn't take long to notice where the bottleneck issues were coming from. Regardless, I wasn't too annoyed as it was still Sunday and brunchday afterall. Our servers name was Chelsea, she was super friendly and welcoming within a few seconds of seating. They have a nice looking beverage bar in the corner but not an elaborate beverage list to match. Fresh squeezed OG is available. Ambience is fun and fresh and the Jammie's are a kitchy touch. The menu has a nice variety of choices which is great but nothing signature. Chelsea informed us that the waffle iron was not working at the moment which was off to me they only had one waffle machine and cut a chunk of the menu options right away. Our table ordered a Loco Moco, Chilaquiles, chicken fried steak, and house pancakes. Drinks were quick and coffee was hot and fresh. Time seemed to have dragged on by the time our plates arrived ( We had three cups of coffee. ) Chelsea was very attentive and reassuring our order was on its way. When our food arrived it was dropped off by one staff member who could only carry 3/4 of the dishes. No biggie but she didn't acknowledge the lack of complete order and left. Pancakes arrived not too long after. These cakes were massive. I was pumped. The syrup is served warm which is great. 
FOOD QUALITY AND TASTE- the massive pancakes are a dense heavy cake and very sweet. Not fluffy like I envisioned. Too dry to eat on their own but overkill sweet with syrup. Seemed like a waffle dough/batter to me. My co-eater did eat a share as I could barely make a dent. The chilaquiles looked the part but was off in traditional red sauce flavor but not a bad try. The loco Moco comes with a teriyaki gravy poured over the dish and would have preferred it on the side. The sweet/salty flavor was overkill and ruined the dish. The spam was also on the burned side so another intense flavor added to the teriyaki gravy profile. Hard pass. The chicken fried steak was a success as were all the eggs at the table.  We didn't linger after completing our meal and walked out of there about 2 hours and $75 later. Chelsea saved the experience for us but an overall opinion of the meal won't make us regulars but worth another try.
Food was ok. Had the 3 egg omelette and the eggs were overcooked.. however the cup o bread was delicious.My daughter sure enjoyed her Rise n shine burrito.

The food is great, albeit gigantic and better for sharing than for one. Many places can make good brunch food, but I love this place for the service. We have been twice on weekdays, so I cannot speak for rush times, but the hosts and servers have been quick and kind both times. In a town where service is mostly disregarded, this stands out. It is a bit pricey, but for the quality and quantity, I'll take it. It has become a go-to.

Fantastic food amd great staff.  The kids plates were perfect size.  My wife and I both had the ham and eggs benedict.  It had great flavor and was cooked perfectly.  We will definitely be coming here again.
Maybe we came on an off day, but for a place that has "steak" in its name, they sucked! I give the eggs, service and decor 5 stars but the Steaks were definitely bland.
Belgian waffle smells like heaven!! Little wait but oh so worth it!!! Everything tastes so good & such big portions!! Love this spot!

Hands down the best breakfast I've had in the vegas area! It's a little pricey but once you receive your food you'll forget all about it, the food is absolutely delicious and the portions are enough to feed a small village! I had the "island inspired" loco moco and it is one of the best takes on an island breakfast I've ever had and I'm very picky. My server was new but had an answer for all my questions and even some suggestions when I began to scratch my head at all the choices. The restaurant is a little odd with upside-down twirling umbrellas twirling from the ceiling and a giant cow laying an egg as the main centerpiece but the music and friendly staff definitely make this my new favorite breakfast joint. Theres often a wait to be seated and more than likely it's a little lengthy but if you've come to eat an all around amazing meal with a side of great service then you can expect the wait to be worth it. Bravo Rise and Shine Bravo.
Wonderful food!!! Wonderful service!!! Very cool setting!! The steaks are to die for!!! The ice coffee will make you slap your momma!!!
Great place to eat!! First off my server was Ashley who was amazing, helped me with my order best service ever and of course great food will be back!!
Ribeye steak and eggs with Pot of Bread. Best breakfast in Las Vegas!!!!!!

waited 45 mins after being told only 25 minute wait.  Sat down server came right away took our drink order and then took our food order.  Waited for the food for over 45 mins. A lady came to table and asked how everything was,  don't know if she was the manager,  but we told her would be nice if our food came out cause we ordered 45 mins ago....  She just shrugged her shoulders and said they were really busy and walked away.  Everyone in the resturant looked they were waiting for the food forever.  Never came back to follow up.  Food was OK.  The server was great,  I know it wasn't her fault she looked a little annoyed at everything going on,  cause I am sure a lot of people were mad.  Decor and place looked very nice, was hoping for a better experience. Don't think I will be back,  much better breakfast places around with fast service.  Place looked and felt disorganized no proccess in place.

During my Sunday morning bike rides, I had seen that Rise & Shine was opening a new location close to where I live.  I had been to the original one and I wanted to try this.  I was going to stop the week before but remembering it was Mother's Day and I knew the place would be slammed, I waited a week to go.

I went inside and had my name put on the list and requested a patio table.  When I was taken outside, I was told to pick any place I wanted.  I chose a two top in the sun. 

I was left a menu and as I looked at it, my server stopped by and asked about coffee.  I ordered the French press coffee which says 2 cups.  It yielded three plus.

I ordered the S'mores waffle.  It was a waffle with some marshmallow fluff, chocolate syrup, whipped cream, and some Chex cereal for the graham cracker.  With the waffle I was served warm maple syrup with some cinnamon sticks infusing the syrup and two small cups of soft butter.

The waffle was good but I was expecting more marshmallow and less whipped cream, and Chex cereal is not really a good replacement for graham cracker.  Some squares of real graham cracker would have been better.

Service was good but I must note that I don't understand the seating problem this place seems to have.  Evidently, one person write names down, where the person requests to sit, and then hands off the person with a menu to one person who seats people coming in.  The patio was 1/3 full, the interior was about the same, and yet I waited for about 5 minutes before being shown outside.  It just seems like an inefficient system and when they're busy, I can understand the reason for the backup.

One note, if you ride here on your bike--yeah, I know, few of you will--you can lock it up using the boards on the ramp going to the entrance as the anchor for your cable and lock.

I'm glad I tried the new place.  I won't be a regular.

1st of all...really not what I expected....f&b coming out of me...booster was dirty, wiped it down. ..was given a syrup bottle off the bussers tray, wasn't wiped down, medium rare...more like well done...powder sugar on steak knife...toast came out last ...hmmmm...I think cracker barrel is better...not coming back...sorry...disappointed by how service and all turned out...don't try if I'm politely saying its ok...
Love love love the food!!! Great food portion and great service!!! Amberlee was so helpful and made our breakfast very enjoyable

Let me start by saying,  I'm not a huge breakfast fan,  but the boyfriend is, so we thought we'd try this place. 

UPON ARRIVAL: Every time we've been here there has been a wait (not long) but that's a good thing-it means people like it!  They have always been very quick to seat people as soon as a table opens. 

SERVICE:  This is a big one for me,  as i work in the hospitality industry (bartender). Every time we have visited, we have received AMAZING service from EVERYONE; from the hostess,  to the server, to the food runner. 

FOOD/MENU:  Not an overly large menu but i was very pleased at the vegetable options (as I'm a vegetarian). Food is outstanding,  as everything we've ever ordered has been delicious and sizable. If you're a coffee drinker,  order the French press.. it's enough for 2 and is very tasty.  They even give you a timer so you can have it as weak or as strong as you like.

AMBIANCE/DECOR:  It is spacious enough that you don't feel like you're sitting on someone else's lap, like in other smaller breakfast places. Colorful, upside down umbrellas grace the ceiling and is very cute. The floorplan is very open, and you don't feel like you are boxed in. Restrooms are always clean. 

The boyfriend and i have been here at least a half a dozen times, with many more to come. I'd recommend this place to ANYONE and EVERYONE.
One of my favorite breakfast place, i love their s'mores waffle. They have fresh orange juice and great coffee ( lavazza ). Their uniform are cool ( pyjama ). Definitly a big yes !!

So my son goes to school with the owners daughter. So we kinda had to go. Wow what a great surprise. This is our 2nd time here in a week. The food is awesome. The staff is young and full of energy. Our waitress Desire (yes that is how she spells it) was great. She is from a little town in New Mexico. What a sweet girl. I highly recommend this place. Don't be in a hurry if you come before noon they pick them in. Today we came around 1pm. No wait at all. 5 STARS for sure.

Cutest place ever! Walked in and the servers and hostess  was in flannel pjs. Hahaha I was jealous :) great colorful theme and very comfortable and cool and cheerful. Not too crowded or loud. Prices were great. The staff was helpful and friendly and the food was so yummy! New favorite breakfast place in Vegas!
Amberly provided excellent service, especially as I walked in 15 min before closing, I normally don't do that, but was hungry and really wanted to try this place. Food was excellent!
Amber was very attentive and friendly. Wanted to update my review. Thank you! We like to eat here because the cup of bread is so good.

I saw another comment that sums up my feelings: "The food looks amazing,  tastes ok." I really think this place is a 3.5. I went up to 4 because the atmosphere, service, and portions were great. The food was pricey and it tasted okay, but not great. I had the three little piggies bagel sandwich. The concept is great: eggs, cheese, bacon, ham, and a banger sausage on a bagel. In reality, the sandwich was hard to manage. It was impossible to pick up - big, bulky, and the bottom bagel was slippery and soggy. Each element tasted good, but I didn't get to take that big bite that would meld all the elements together. The fries that came on the side were super yummy though. My honey had the chicken fried steak with country gravy, eggs, and hash browns. He said it was okay, but he wasn't really fond of the breading on the steak. All in all it was a fun experience nut the food was only okay. Not sure I will go back.

Great breakfast! I had the buttermilk pancakes and eggs and he had the biscuits and gravy with hashbrowns. It was all excellent! We had delivery thru postmates. It was made quickly we were pleased all around. Very good biscuits and gravy I would recommend both meals!

Love, love, LOVE this place! We wanted to get away from the strip and do some exploring. Tried this place out because of a friend's suggestion. After looking at all the photos, we were convinced we had to try it out. SO GLAD WE DID!! The food was delicious!! I had the sausage biscuits with eggs and potatoes. The gravy was so good, perfect consistency, the biscuits were awesome, eggs - perfect! It must have come with bacon (or I stole it from someone elses's plate) but it was good! The Mister had some big breakfast with ham (I think), don't really remember, but it looked good and he was VERY happy with our meal. Our son had the philly chessesteak omelet (again, I think), and he loved it. The prices were great, too! All three of us had a wonderful meal and it was under $50! Service was amazing! From the guy who seated us, to our server, to the cashier, they were all great! The only downside was the wait - took almost an hour to get seated outside, but it could have been because there were numerous sports tournaments in the area and the place was packed. We will definitely make this place a breakfast stop-off during all of our Vegas trips!

Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place

What came first, the chicken or the egg?  

It really doesn't matter because I'm going to eat both.  Rise & Shine is known for great breakfast steaks and of course, their eggs. I've had their steaks once and have to agree with most of the Yelpers that it's pretty good, priced just right, and always perfect for breakfast.  By the way, they use only USDA prime meats here.  Lately, I have been on an egg kick.  I love eggs and can even notice the quality of them.  Here at Rise & Shine, the eggs seemed to taste a whole lot better than everyone else's.  I have no idea where Rise & Shine gets their eggs, but it's good, thick, and very fluffy when scrambled.  I'll keep my meal small with just 3 scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese, 4 slices of bacon, and a chicken breast.  I call this meal the EBC for Egg, Bacon, and Chicken.  The bacon is okay, the chicken breast is flavorful, but the eggs...phenomenal.  

Prices for their set meals is about average compared to the other breakfast joints in town.  An omelet made with 3 eggs with all the carbs cost around $10.  Their steak and eggs breakfast is roughly $15. My meal is usually a little more since I am getting different proteins a la carte. The restaurant is pretty big and very popular during the weekend mornings.  As for their service, it's as good as it gets. I appreciate the fact that they're always willing to substitute items or add extra proteins for me.  

2017 Yelp Review #80
Very good service with Amberly. Portions were huge. Amberly told us how big the servings were so we got half orders.
Adorable place...feels like sunshine inside! Good food...Cup of Bread was delicious and a cute idea. Slow service, maybe it's the pajamas! We had to ask for everything and waited forever.

I went to Rise & Shine today for the 1st time. We received the check and went up too pay. Before I stepped out the door I realized I had left my ray-ban sun glasses on the table so I went back and spoke to Tyler our waiter(can easily be identified by LV neck tat), the table had already been bussed (by Tyler) and my glasses were nowhere to be seen. There was no one sitting behind us and an old couple in front of us.  The manager came out and was very nice but she then said she 100% guarantees no one on her staff would of took them, not sure how someone could make a statement like that.  I'm not accusing anyone of anything but I no longer have my glasses. Not sure if breakfast food you can pretty much get anywhere is worth the risk of someone going through your purse or taking your property. I will not be back.

This place is amazing! Food is great, proportions are huge, service is excellent! I can't say enough good things! The fresh squeezed OJ will make you reconsider everything you have ever thought you knew about juice.

This place is very unique. From the servers dressed in pajamas, to the flower lights/spinners coming down from the top of the barn house feel ceiling. To the fresh squeezed juices, and warm syrup.... The menu is not to big but big enough to make you have to choose between 2 things you really want. The wait took a little longer, but the quality of the food was worth it. I got an omelette which was amazing with the fresh cut potato hash browns and delicious biscuit. My partner got the egg n bacon in the hole French toast. Latte w/ Nutella was delicious. Overall a great experience and I left very satisfied. My server was Kristi who was amazing and gave all the right suggestions.
Best steak and eggs in Las Vegas. Whatever they season their beef with is perfect. Can get a bit busy on the weekends, so expect a 15 min wait. Worth the drive!

Random search on yelp got us here since we are in the neighborhood!   Hubby said it's his new favorite place for chicken and waffles and I thought the corn beef hash was really good too!  Definitely will come back when the folks are in town!

The second location is by LVAC on flamingo and 215 formerly Joe's Crab Shack. They are open from 7am-3pm the menu is large with a small lunch section. 

For a family of 3 we spent $50 before tip ordering two of the ultimate steak and eggs and silver dollar pancakes for our child and orange juices. Second trip- Vanilla latte was great! 

They offer a potted bread which is a cinnamon bun in a cup with butter and icing on the side which I was thrilled about! Ask for the icing though. It was delicious!!

I wasn't a fan of the hash browns, a little underdone with no taste I suggest offering a substitute other than tomato and avocado. Our steaks were fantastic and flavoring was great. 

They offer freshly squeezed orange juice which is good but not worth the $5 and NO refills with a tall skinny glass. My kid had more orange juice than I did with her plastic cup so I highly suggest that be changed. 

There's no changing table in the restroom so I had to change my infant on the seat next to me. I'd certainly suggest installing that right away.

Service and food is two thumbs up here.  I can't remember the waitress name (shame on me) but she was attentive to all of our needs. My boyfriend and I both ordered the ribeye steak and eggs and it was so good.  Our dishes came with hashbrown and also a choice of bread.  One of the bread options is bread in a cup, which is pretty much a cinnamon roll in a cup.  It was unique, soft, and hot.  If you like cinnamon rolls you should probably choose that as your choice of bread.  The ambiance had a bit of a whimisical feel.  There were spinning umbrellas, and the colors in the restaurant were vibrant.  They also sell silly socks and reataurant apparel and items at the front counter.  The servers also wear pajamas.  A little silly but suits the restaurant.

I wanted to try a new place and with yelps reviews I wanted to try.... I'm not one to nit pick but i don't think the ribeye is a rib eye, but a chuck cut thin. The rest of our food was great cause I could see 3 eggs and hash brown. The tables show their age and if not careful you can cut y I urge arms on the peeling clear

Comida esplndida servicio muy bueno y amigable. 
Porciones grandes y ricas. Amber dio muy buen servicio y se asegur que no nos hiciera falta caf.
I love the food at this place but the only bad thing I would have to say about this place is I found two hairs in my omelette and a hair in my potatoes!!!!

They clearly don't need to advertise because I'm sure the word-of-mouth is insanely good but I must say best breakfast I've had in a very very long time. My wife will never forget as she puts it "the cinnamon roll in a cup thing" our breakfast were great I had steak and eggs and the service was friendly and quick. I love the pajamas as uniforms. Definitely a keeper.

Large. Ginormous. Mountainous. Gigantic. Humongous. Enormous. Colossal. Massive. What's another synonym for big? Rise & Shine... This place has some of the largest portions of food I've seen yet. As far as breakfast goes, I only know of one other place that comes close. You need to come to this restaurant prepared for a feast. It surely won't disappoint. 

My boyfriend and I came here hungry on a Sunday. We had never been. There was many people waiting in the lobby area. It took us maybe 20-30 minutes to get seated during mid-morning rush hours. They seemed like they were able to accommodate large parties. So, that's good to know. 

Our server was dressed in a llama pajama outfit. It was AWESOME. She was friendly and attentive, even though they were very busy. She made recommendations about her favorite food. My only slight annoyance was that she didn't tell us that we were ordering WAY, WAY too much food. However, that's still okay. It was worth trying all of it.

We ordered the Country Friend New York Steak & Eggs, Buffalo-Style Crispy Chicken Breasts & Eggs, and Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. For two of us. 

All of it was fantastic. Again, if I have not made it clear enough, the portions were massively colossal to epic proportions. Yes, too much food. It was all very tasty though. We didn't want to stop eating, even though there was no dent made in the food. Hashtag, leftovers...

Overall, super awesome breakfast joint. The only possible set back is that it did take awhile to get our food once ordered. I would say 20-30 minutes, but if you're not in a rush, it is definitely worth the wait. Super happy customer here! And, again, HUGE portions. Don't be afraid to share.

Loved this place! Food was great, large enough to take home and have again! Waitress was terrific and kept my coffee filled many times.  My only caveat is pricing.  Expect a $30 to $40 bill for 2 if you get one of the many special breakfasts. Still, Ribeye and eggs is a great day starter.  We will be back.

Came in on a Friday morning, but I will not be back.  First the pros...cute atmosphere.  Staff was very friendly.  They gave us a free cup of bread for the wait -it was really yummy.

Now the cons.  The eggs were overcooked on my benedict.  I am not a breakfast snob, but I do expect a breakfast restaurant to be able to properly cook eggs.  My husband ordered a specialty frozen/iced coffee drink, which was the worst frozen coffee ever.  Tasted like watered down hot chocolate.  No flavor.  Our server was very nice but was slow, and the check was wrong.  But the worst of it was paying.  You have to pay at the register, and we waited 20 minutes in line just to pay our check (there were only 2 parties paying ahead of us).  Not sure why it took so long, but it definitely sealed the deal on our decision never to return.  Worst dining experience in a long time.  I only gave it 2 stars because the staff was very friendly.

I find the location convenient - close to the 215. The restaurant is always clean and brightly decorated. The staff is knowledgable and very friendly; especially if you are lucky enough to get Maddy as your server. The food is amazing! I have never been disappointed and always enjoy fresh and cooked just the way I like it breakfast. The ultimate steak and eggs is a great value, the steak is tender and seasoned perfectly, and the sides are not the generic sides you get at most chains. A must try this weekend.

Fantastic spot -- from the fresh juices, italian coffee, all the way down to the warm syrup. Looking for a delicious breakfast? This is the place to go, no doubt about it. Thank you to our server, Chelsea for the outstanding service! We will be coming back.

This place is so weird. On one hand you have their steak, especially the ribeye, which is absolutely perfect every single time. It's amazing, and worth coming here by itself. Actually, most of their food is good, and the coffee is great. 
But the HASH BROWNS... they're HORRIBLE!! I don't get it! It's like they're marinated in dish soap or something. Every single time we've been here (seriously, the streak is crazy good), we've hoped the hash browns have changed. Nope. I don't know what they use to flavor it, but food goes to waste every time. 
They're so.... weird. And leave a weird aftertaste.
But again, the other stuff we've had (loco moco, omelettes, cup o bread, that amazing ribeye etc.) has all been good. Just please do something about those hash browns.
Did I mention the hash browns taste weird?
Easily the best steak and eggs in the city ! Our server Maddy was awesome! We will be requesting her every time we go!

Picture this: 

It's Memorial Day weekend, and instead of a long slumber, your SO drags you out of bed promising a delicious brunch. As I reluctantly got dressed this morning, I will say I had lofty expectations for this restaurant hoping they would fill my belly without leaving my wallet empty. 

We arrived around noon on a Saturday and were seated within just a few (maybe 3-5) minutes. What awaited us at the table was a sizeable menu with the everyday breakfast items and a few curious twists. I decided on the bananas foster waffle: a delectable waffle topped with cinnamon, brown sugar bananas, orange zest, whipped cream and a dollop of vanilla ice cream. Now, I know what you must be thinking. Is it breakfast? Is it lunch? Is it a shareable dessert? (Quite possibly all of the above???)

Ten minutes later, I'm staring down this beast only armed with a fork and knife. One bite in, and I'm ready to come back next weekend! This delectable treat is sure to make you reconsider stopping at a Denny's or IHOP ever again! The combo with scrambled eggs and crispy bacon (how I requested it cooked) were absolute perfection. This was worth waking up for, and I'm so thankful this place exists a mere seven minute drive from my house!!!

Congratulations Rise & Shine for making another customer for life!

Excellent place for breakfast or lunch. Nice variety to choose from with very good coffee and juices. On our first visit here my wife had the Salmon Eggs Benedict with Watermelon & Strawberry Juice. I had the Ultimate Steak & Eggs Breakfast with coffee. Filling and satisfying portions. Will be back soon. Looking forward to trying other menu items as well as their French Press Coffee.

We were really looking forward to trying this place out! Unfortunately the wait was about 30 minutes longer than we were told,( 20 min)(we almost left at that point)! Then we get the worst table in the place while other, more desirable tables were available! Our waitress seemed disengaged from our simple needs like, coffee, getting the orders right, bringing the toast out with the food etc. She didn't seem to give a sh*t! 
The food was OK at best!
The pajama uniforms were horrible!
The seating kinda sucked!
It seemed unorganized and chaotic!

I've been here on a Saturday morning and there can be a good half-hour wait for a table. This Monday morning was much quieter, less than half the restaurant was occupied, so lots of tables were available.

The top of their menu has the Big Bone-In Country Ham Steak & Eggs. It comes with a large slab of ham, two eggs, hash browns, and for a bread a choice of a "cup-o-bread", toast or biscuit. The ham was on the large side, cooked nicely with grill marks on the meat. The "Cup-o-Bread" was a soft cinnamon roll type bread baked in a small cup and was served with a small cup of something similar to the icing found on a cinnamon roll. A filling breakfast.

Service was good. One of the gimmicks here is that many of the servers wore pajamas, nothing bizarre, just regular pjs.

Never had a bad meal there. Luv the crispy French toast. Always good friendly service. They should have a special day when the patrons arrive  in pajamas, just like the wait staff. And, I think Victoria Secret should sponsor it.

Tried this place for the first time today. Wasn't too impressed. The food was delicious and so was the coffee, but our server was eh okay. 

We ordered the Texas French Toast with hash browns which were very good and my Cornbeef hash was very tasty. I would go back for the food, but the service kind of lacked.

Eggs were fine. Biscuits and gravy not so great. I'm pretty sure the bottom of the biscuits were concrete. Could not cut the biscuit bottoms with a fork. My wife enjoyed her steak and eggs but I won't go back.

In a restaurant that was super busy when I went in, our hostess was super helpful in accommodating us, our server laura was adorable, dark hair, very personable and efficient  gave us amazing service , she made sure all our needs were met and she paid special attention, even tho it seemed she had a lot of tables. The food was piping hot and yummy
Definitely coming in next week to try some of the items i missed

Delicious! My first time trying this place out, and totally missing out the whole time I hadn't been coming here, what a great find  minus 1 star for cooking my NY steak well WELL done instead of medium. Overall, still tasty

Anytime we go on vacay our rule is to not eat anywhere we have at home. This place was super yummy. I had the Chiliquiles which was out of this world good. My daughter had the pancakes which were OMG SO DELICIOUS!!! When ever you are in Vegas you really need to try this place.

There's usually a wait every time I go here, but the food makes it work it. The fresh orange juice is amazing and so it the Smoke Salmon and Bacon Bagel. LOVE LOVE the pot bread. & I like how the servers all wear pajamas. I wonder if most of them sleep on what they're wearing to work the next. 

I've been here a few times and am definitely impressed by their food, not so much their service. Hasn't been consistent. Servers have either been to over bearing or never came by after dropping off our food. Over all though, their food makes up for it.

First time at Rise and Shine! Great service, our server was there when we needed her. Everyone was friendly and helpful in their Pjs  My steak, eggs and chilaquiles were good, my eggs were just a little uncooked. My bfs hash browns weren't that great. However, their breakfast menu is great, a lot to choose from and different than the usual. I would go back.
This place is awesome. They decorated super cute and all the servers are wearing pajamas. Menu was good but service was just a little slow today. I'd definitely go back though.

I love Rise and Shine! If you're looking for a great steak and eggs this is the place to go!! When you go, ask for Ashley she is the best! She is super friendly, very attentive and nice, always refilling our drinks and making sure we have everything we need! I give the food five stars because it is very good but I give Ashley 10 stars because the service is the best!! You go to a restaurant for the food and come back for the service and that is why I always come back because Rise and Shine has both!
Loved it, great service great chicken fried steak, the staff wear pajamas. I used to go the the other location years ago

If you are thinking about trying Rise & Shine I highly recommend it. 

This particular location earned 5 stars and we were told by our waitress that there are two other locations in town one being on our side of town even. 

The hostess sat us within seconds of stepping inside and I was delighted by the decor. The waiters and waitresses get to wear pajamas which is ADORABLE and they seem so happy like they are enjoying their job. How could you not? Your in jammies! 

We ordered Steak and Eggs and coffee in a coffee press but first let me tell you about this bread in a crock the serve first. Holy man....it is all things good in this world. It is baked in this crock or dish served to you warm with cinnamon butter frosting stuff. It is delicious. As if that isn't enough goodness along came our breakfast. The steaks were cooked just as we ordered them and seasoned perfectly with this coffee rub, eggs were spot on and the hash browns crispy. Portions were perfect not overly huge and I left satisfied and not uncomfortably stuffed. 

Our server was so pleasant and had time to engage in conversation which was so nice and made us felt welcome. She didn't hover over us and wasn't intrusive she simple was genuinely a happy person I wish I had gotten her name so I could give her a shout out or so you could request her. 

They also have a cute section where they sell shirts and other gift shop type items too. 

In warmer months they have a nice size patio for outdoor dining that I can't wait to enjoy too. 

I highly recommend giving them a try and I know I will be back for sure.

I love the chicken and waffles here for breakfast. Upgrading to the banana foster waffles is a must. I like their flamingo location because of this. They do not have the banana foster waffles at the southern highland location which is a bummer because it's a closer drive. But it's worth the extra few miles.

Love this place, definitively missed by a lot of people. The portions are massive and the steak n eggs are the best in town. The pancakes are favorite though. They are huge so get a half order but they are soft in the middle and have crispy edges and they're not too thick. These people know how to make it. Only issue is that I got orange juice and it was almost 6 bucks for a small glass, which is kind of overpriced in my opinion, but overall a great establishment.

Excellent breakfast spot! I was inspired to try it after seeing it in my news feed with a well deserved "review of the day". Yelp did NOT steer me wrong!
I did not understand having steak for breakfast until recently trying chicken fried steak for the first time. I now get the magical combination of eggs and steak, especially if the steak is dressed in crispy batter and smothered in delicious gravy :)
That is what I had here. The country fried steak with eggs and hash, pancake, cup of bread, and fresh carrot-green apple juice. Sounds like a lot? It definitively was! I was full for the entire day AND had half left for breakfast the next day. I don't think any chicken friend steak  will be as good as the first one I had but at Rise & Shine it came pretty darn close. I enjoyed the sausage gravy and appreciate being served two cups of it, one is never enough. The potato hash was nice and crispy on the outside and eggs were made as I wanted them, over easy. 
My honey wanted the Ultimate steak and egg breakfast but with New York cut instead of ribeye. Accommodating his request, presented no problem and he loved his meal. He also had an everything bagel on the side (greedy!) that was fresh and yummy.
We shared an old fashion pancake, large enough to have as a breakfast on it's own, moist and fluffy - really delicious. I also really enjoyed the cup of bread, it's kind of like a cinnamon roll in a cup with warm cream cheese frosting on the side. Really yum. The fresh squeezed juice paired perfectly with glorious breakfast we had. 
Aside from great food, our server was sweet and accommodating. I appreciate the ability to customize and add what ever you want. The restaurant has a charming decor, with flowers everywhere. Wonderful, care free experience at Rise & Shine.

Big thanks to Nicole and the team for a lovely breakfast this morning.  er recommendations were on point, the coffee is DELICIOUS as was all the food.  Also, major props for putting up with a large group first thing in the morning.  I'll definitely be back!

To be honest I am a repeat customer here for awhile and the past couple of times I have come to this location it's been a s*** show. This time especially. To start things off the wait I was told was 15-20 min and I waited for 35-40. Second they bring out one persons dish while all of us sit there and watch her eat. Third the wait for our food was at least an hour. Fourth they bring my food and half of the food was cold while the rest was just barely warm. Also I had someone order the steak salad... she got 4 small pieces of steak and was extremely disappointed... don't know if I'm gonna keep going here if they continue to raise their prices and give less and less food.
As good as it gets new favorite place everyone is very nice and the food is great! Had the steak & eggs wow .

cute, the servers are dressed in PJ's. Nice touch. Food was good, it was good overall, service was good.  But, there were a few things that it didn't make 5 stars: They served this cinnamon covered roll in a little metal cup. The dough was completely raw inside the cup and inedible. This is supposed to be one of their signature items. The coffee was tasteless It's supposed to be Lavazza, if it was, someone didn't know how to brew it and they charged you extra for the coffee, Maybe it's a LV thing? Most places I've been to include coffee with breakfast. Also the prices were through the roof. I've paid less for breakfast in Manhattan...

I don't often pass out the 5 stars, but I honestly couldn't find anything wrong with the past two meals I've had here. 

First time we came here, around 10 am, it was PACKED. Literally not a seat in the house. The staff still managed to seat us promptly and deliver our food in less time than I've waited at some Chipotle's. They were even apologetic about both the wait to be seated and the wait for food, which really wasn't long compared so other popular breakfast joints in town.

I'm a big fan of their fresh pressed juice, especially the strawberry watermelon one. TRY IT! I tend to do breakfast a bit on the healthy side, so I'm always the one ordering the egg white omelette with all sorts of substitutions. Even so, their hash browns are THE BEST. They slice the potatoes nice and thin so that they come out crispy...hopefully the way everyone likes them. That's how I like them! No soggy or greasy hash browns here!

Each time I've come in the staff has been dressed up, once for Halloween and once they were all wearing pajamas. It def gives a different vibe to your weekend breakfast routine. I love it!

Delish! I'm glad to have a spacious, un-pretentious, good customer service breakfast/brunch spot close by! 

My husband had the rib eye with eggs and I got the country fried steak and eggs. Both were hearty portions and tasted great! We ended our meal with the Pot o bread. We had Chelsea as our server and service was great!

I called ahead to verify wait time and if we could bring our Frenchie. For a 70 degree Saturday morning, there was no wait for patio seating. If you do bring a pup, I recommend bringing a caribiner to hook their leash to one of the wooden poles- especially if your dog is an explorer like mine. There's also an Astro turfed area where I am assuming you can "walk" your dog although I wouldn't since it is so close to dining. I also fed my dog the orange garnishes that came on the plates.

We will definitely be back!!!

Probably one of the better Ribeye and eggs. Cup o bread was a good appetizer too. Chicken and waffles was very tasty with a little spice. French toast with the eggs and bacon was good also. Will be back soon because of the service, Frankie was a character and best of all, knew the menu like all great servers should.

First-timer! The restaurant is super cozy, cabin-like, spacious (so the wait is no longer than 20min at the most) perfect for big parties. The decor is sleepwear! The servers all wear pjs! So it's definitely a casual, cozy non-pretentious atmosphere. Perfect place to have a comfortable, relaxing breakfast, especially on the weekend. We decided to split 2 entrees since their portions are huge! The menu is extensive! You will want it all. They have everything from freshly squeezed/pressed juices, smoothies, to your choice of coffee, espressos, lattes, (they serve LAVAZZA coffee) yes please! 
I ordered the "Go-Go" Green juice. (Kale & cucumber) it was perfection! Super refreshing! 
On to food, we split the 
Egg White - Avocado - Steak omelet: Amazing. Steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly, sliced on top, along with avocado slices.

Belgian Waffle w/strawberries: Came with whipped butter on the side and a cinnamon, butter, maple syrup. 

Everything was great. Service was friendly and efficient! I will definitely be returning!

Om nom nom nom nom. more please! nom nom nom nom nom nom.

Edit: 4/10/15 (9:14PM)

Upgraded my ranking. It's currently 9:14PM and I'm still thinking about that bacon.


-----------------------------------------------

1. Environment: The environment is wonderful and pretty. Very roomy and spacious with a great outdoor area with pretty flowers in the ceiling. Great for brunches and breakfast dates. 

2. Service: Since I tried this place during it's "soft opening" I don't think it would be fair for me to give an evaluation on it yet. But the staff was knowledgeable of the menu and gave me a great recommendation.

3. Food: O M G! I know Rise & Shine is a Steak & Egg Place but for someone that's on food rehab you can't always indulge in pancake and eggs.

The item I ordered was the Salad (with bacon, avocado, and chicken) and it was *aaaammmmmmzing* I mean, a salad is a salad, but their ingredients are fresh and the bacon is to-die-for; perfectly crispy, not too greasy, oh so nummy, f*** food rehab. Everything else in the salad was good, dressing was a bit tangy for my taste but THAT BACON!

This place is AWSM! Love everything I've ever ordered - today we tried the chicken breast & waffles - delicious! The chicken was super crispy & the waffle light & fluffy. Coupled with a glass of fresh squeezed watermelon & strawberry juice & it was a magnificent morning. Also pick up ordering is now available here finally so giddy up!
I'd definitely suggest trying out any of their specialty pancakes (we had red velvet with cream cheese syrup - DIVINE!) enjoy...

This place is the CUTEST! i love the umbrella decor on the ceiling. Drove pass this place on my way to bite one sunday and had to look it up on yelp! after reading reviews of my fellow yelpers i decided to check it out. the decor is cute the servers are all in pajamas. They have a lovely looking patio area which would be great when it starts warming up out. The inside is huge plenty of seating. The menu has some basic breakfast and sandwiches options. as well as some custom stuff. I recommend the buffalo fried chicken. The bread in a pot is delicious so soft and fluffy not overwhelmingly sweet. The service is alright they don't seem to like when you say you are sharing items though and you have to constantly remind them for little things like sugar, utensils, and creamer.

Sadly, bad experience twice in a row at Rise & Shine.   We ordered a standard breakfast that took a LONG time.  Certainly things can and do take time to prepare.  What is highly irritating is to watch several tables seated AFTER us, get their food BEFORE and LEAVE the restaurant and we STILL don't have our food.   WHAT?  We asked our server where our food was.  She came back and said that the kitchen was working on getting the poached eggs. When it was finally delivered, she was told by her manager (then told us)  poached eggs take 10 minutes.  A poached egg takes 3-4 minutes tops, not 10. 

Regardless of the preparation time,  the kitchen needs to plan accordingly to get food out in a timely manner and in order received,  not based on how long things take which is the explanation we were given.  If something does take longer, make sure your customer knows that.  But, eggs take longer?  I would assume a large portion of their items contain eggs. What about simply acknowledging the error, apologizing and making it right?    Excuses add fuel to the fire.  

The bill had coffee removed and we were given a $5.00 coupon toward our next visit.  While that was kind, management needs to fix a problem when it occurs, not wait until "next time." The manager also should have been proactive in coming to our table to discuss.  Our server was kind and the food good ~ none of this was her issue.   Want a happy customer? Make it a great experience!  This was not the experience we were looking for. 

  Cute place!   Needs better customer service before spending your time and money.
Please go there and try their hash browns. They are super good. I also ate the chilequiles (sp?) and I enjoyed them. My wife loved her breakfast. Great experience overall.
Samantha was amazing! Fav place for Sunday Breakfast coffee is bomb & cinnamon toast French toast is the go to. Thanks again for the amazing experience As always

Rise & Shine is a whimsical breakfast place! I love the parasols hanging from the ceiling ,the wait staff in their PJ's and the generous portion sizes! The restaurant was a former Joe's Crab Shack so it is pretty big inside which means if there is a wait it goes by pretty quickly. 

I ordered the Bacon & Egg in the Hole French Toast ($11.95). You can typically get half orders of the pancakes and French Toast . The one I ordered only comes in a full size because it is a specialized dish. There is a hole in the middle of the French Toast with an over hard egg in the middle. They also put bacon strips in it. This was the first time I had something like this but I really liked it. I also had a side of hashbrowns and bangers ( English Sausage). The bangers were also another first they tasted less salty then your normal sausage which is a plus for me because I hate salty foods and they hate me too! 

This is a breakfast place that is also great for groups since there is a lot of seating with big booths and tables . They also don't rush you out when you are finished with your meal so you can feel free and chit chat just a little bit longer over your cup of coffee.

The first thing I loved about this place was the customer service. Meagan , the hostess, was a warm spirit and quite helpful. Our server, Jackie, was pleasant and had a array of knowledge of the complete menu. The food here has everything from those who want to eat healthy to indulge in a decadent brunch. I most certainly will return!!!

With a wink and a nod to kitsch in both menu and design, my recent trip to breakfast spot Rise and Shine managed to entertain and disappoint on many levels. I dined with two other guests, ordering the New York Steak, Spinach, and Benedict Bagel. 

In a nutshell:

Possibly the worst hollandaise I've had in ... well, ever. 

My guest had ordered the smoked salmon benedict and had the same reaction. It lacked all the classic hollandaise flavor notes, almost as if the sauce broke and they opted to serve it anyways. 

Cloying balsamic reduction drizzled all over my steak wasn't listed in the menu description and muted an otherwise perfectly cooked, well seasoned New York Steak. 

Spinach wasn't cooked for some reason, not even blanched a bit. 

My other guest was also straddling the fence on his dish. He had perfectly cooked eggs with his giant bone-in country ham steak breakfast. Our eyes lit up when the ham arrived with those beautiful cross hatch char marks from the grill. But the cost of those char marks was a very dry piece of meat that he ultimately left behind. 

On the plus side, damn amazing pancakes. Fluffy in height yet dense with flavor, spiced with cinnamon and topped with a cinnamon syrup. It was a good thing I saved it for last so I could end on a high note. Honestly, if I came back I'd be all over the griddle menu.

Kudos to our waiter who was friendly and quick to offer up refills, checking in often.

Had the Corned Beef hash and Poached Eggs with a fresh OJ. The OJ was good so was the service. The food was TERRIBLE! The so called poached eggs were hard boiled and looked like they were sitting in the water for days. The Hash was the worst I ever tried! It was made of what looked like diced pieces of Oscar Meyer cold cuts and diced potatoes that were EXTREMELY OVERCOOKED! It was like I had someone's leftover food. I had heartburn the rest of the day after that.. I recommend that they give up their gimmicky Pajama Uniforms and teach their staff how to prepare food!   NEVER AGAIN
Awesome place great service and plenty to choose from! I got the the pig bagel which has Ham bacon eggs cheese and banger served with fries very delightful and the server was on top of it!

Well we came here Friday morning Kristie was our server she was excellent . Today is Sunday we are back Desire was our server also great. This place is our new go to place! Food is always great , atmosphere is great, so is the service if you haven't tried it you should. Lol I have no relatives that work here but good food is a must

This was just ok I thought. My first bite of my chicken fried steak was all fat, I had to spit it out :(. Other reviews on read also complained about too much fat on there steaks. Hard to see when it's breaded. Overall it wasn't too bad. My Nutella coffee was really good.

This places has awesome breakfast! The only reason I gave them 4 stars is for the wait. They have so many tables inside and outside yet they will let them sit empty and have you wait 20 minutes. I don't get it. 
The steak is good for breakfast and the pot of bread is to die for!
A family favorite for sure! The food was delicious and the service was terrific! We are looking forward to our next visit.

Can't see what the fuss is all about.  The pot of bread was a cinnamon roll baked In a ramekin; the hash browns were all greasy; the fried eggs had burn marks on the whites and the bangers were not real British bangers but just large
Sausages.  The whole was served most unappetizingly with the eggs flung on top of these greasy hash browns.  Service unbelievably slow.

Very good quality.  Food was very flavorful.  Serving size is excellent!  They did have a little trouble with scramble soft eggs.  But everything was so good, the eggs didn't matter.  Oh yeah the fresh juice options are great!  Will definitely return.

Had an amazing yet simple breakfast today. First off the wait staff was great.  My server was Amberly she was amazing always so helpful and positive. 
Just had the 3 egg breakfast and took Amberly's advice and went with the turkey kielbasa and dam was she right about that. 
The meal was great I was there by myself and never felt rushed to get out. 
This is one of the few places I will eat breakfast at. 
Can't wait to return

I've paid $50-100 for a ribeye on the strip, and that's just for the steak itself. At $15, this is the best steak n eggs I've experienced in Vegas. You also get eggs and PERFECTLY crusted hash browns (only thing better is to ask them to fry it on both sides). These little details are lost in a hurry in other local breakfast joints. Decaf coffee was weak (instant?). OJ was very fresh tasting, worth every penny. Service was friendly and top notch.

I have to say I went here a while ago and I loved the service, food and quality! But now it was a Monday morning and we waited for a table when the place was empty plus our server was MIA most of the time and the wait from ordering to receiving food was atrocious! I want to give them another shot but this was just all kinds of bad. Our server wasn't attentive and kept running back and forth to try to get our items. I'm disappointed in the service.

I very much appreciate the idea of this place! But while it is very cutesy, I find that it just has a lot going on. I give it three stars for fresh juice, good portions, and friendly service. The food isn't anything out of the ordinary. I do like the pot of bread! I didn't miss my toast and would definitely get it again. The servers also wear pajamas. That was a cool touch. Try it out for yourself!! The restaurant, I mean, not the pajamas.
Haven't been there in awhile, had a great time with Desiree. Super sweet girl, great to chat with! Always makes us feel special.

Service very good and fast
Hash browns best in Las Vegas
Waitress very friendly and efficient 
Large menu

Let me start off by saying I'm not much of a morning person but when I am up in time for breakfast I take the opportunity to try a new place. Rise and Shine is a really cute place. The employee's wear pj's as their uniform which I think is super comfy why not. The food is delicious and the service was wonderful. I'll be back again.

Not bad, but not as good as the hype. Ordered the steak and chilaquiles. The steak was great for a breakfast house, but the chilaquiles tasted like enchilada sauce drenched chips. The overwhelming taste ruined the steak. Also almost $4 for a skinny glass of OJ with no refill is kinda steep
This is the best best breakfast place i have been to in my entire life! Plus the waitresses are wearing  pjs loooove it!!!!

The entrance to this place is a bit confusing. You'd expect it to be somewhere facing the parking lot, which there is a ramp for handicapped access, but the main entrance is around to the back facing the freeway. As I walked in, I noticed right away that the dining area is very open and spacious, with high ceilings and a variety of seating arrangements. On a Saturday morning at 9am, we were seated immediately. Not bad.

The hostess seemed to be in training. We followed her to our table and the entire time, she kept looking at someone else to make sure she picked the right table. I would've appreciated a more personal greeting and some eye contact. The server was better, refilling coffee every few minutes and checking to see if everything was okay. 

The menu was very confusing. I expected to see STEAK & EGGS, yet the first thing I noticed was an entire column dedicated to freshly squeezed juices. What? Apparently they have a full service juice bar in the corner. Graphically, the menu itself uses a hundred of different fonts and it just makes things look busy; nothing really leads your eye to their very small selection of actual steak & eggs.

I opted for the loco moco. I always like to try loco moco from places because there is usually a unique spin on it. I know what the traditional loco moco tastes like, so trying something new is always fun. What this place does is they use a ribeye patty and a "gravy-yaki" gravy. IMHO, I am not a fan of the gravy. I like regular brown gravy and teriyaki sauce separately, but in this attempt at combining the two just totally took away from the overall simplicity of what a loco moco "should" be. In terms of taste, it's almost there, but not quite. I think it needs another pop of flavor to tie everything together. The ribeye patty, on the other hand, was cooked to medium-rare perfection. Props to the chef in that regard!

The payment process was such a mess. It's awkward enough that they verbally ask you how much you'd like to tip on the card, but the way the girl handled the receipts and not being sure which receipt to hang on to and such just put the cherry on top of an overall, awkward experience.

Such a great breakfast/brunch spot. Our waitress Ashley was excellent. So knowledgeable, courteous, and attentive. She also kept us from ordering more then one of the biggest pancake I've ever seen. Haha. Ashley made our experience a special one.

I took my mom and family out for breakfast and couple weeks back. You'll spend some money at this place, but the service is great, food is good, and the portions are satisfying. The five star reviews are spot on.

On a Saturday morning, there was only one waiter for the entire patio area. It took a good 10 to 15 minutes just to get coffees for a table of 3. The service was extremely slow and the food was just so-so, not worth the wait. 

Maybe it was a rough day or something because a manager came out to thank us and the tables around us for our patience. I think we would have been more understanding if that comment had been made in the course of our meal instead of at the end when we were settling our bill and frustrated. It wasn't a very good first impression and I don't think I'll be back.
Food was great! Even after a little parsley/cilantro mixup.  Service was fantastic and the environment is comfortable.  We will definitely be back!

The overall atmosphere is pretty quirky and cute but that's about the only good thing I could say here. Our server I want to say Amber or Alexa although I'm not positive if that was the name really didn't seem to care about us. The service from her was really textbook and straight to the script which would have been fine if she wasn't actually having interactions with the other tables in our sections, maybe it was because we are a 22 year old couple with a 7 month old baby and so we seem unapproachable? Or maybe it was because we weren't an elderly couple talking about juicing. Either way it was pretty off putting on a service aspect. Anyway I ordered the loco moco medium rare and ended up with a crispy on the outside almost raw on the inside burger which was fine until my garbage disposal method of eating started to slow and I actually tasted the consistency and temperature difference of the outside and inside of the meat and felt kind of sick (it didn't actually make me sick) also kind of found it irritating that the hostess had tables waiting when there were tons of open tables. All in all won't be back 2 stars one badly cooked burger but other decent food but impersonal service isn't good but don't be interested in one table and a a robot to the next.

Best chicken fried steak I've had in a long time!  Try out the Chamucos Jalapeo sauce (local from Henderson, NV)...it has a sneaky slow burn. Luckily we got here before the crowd...this place gets packed.

Extremely large portions served by a wait staff in their pajamas! Feels like Grandma's warm and cozy kitchen at the cabin. Ask for the the best server in the morning Frankie. If you can't find it on the menu, he'll help you find it. I love this place on Friday mornings.
My family and I visited for Mother's Day and we all absolutely loved it! Wonderful warm service and great atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Wow. A place devoted to steak and eggs? You had me at hello. The menu selection has something for everyone, the obvious steak and eggs but also omlettes and flapjacks. The service was great and the atmosphere was inviting. I had the Ribeye and 3 eggs and my girlfriend had the steak omlette, both were fabulous. Will be back, egg and I might be dead to me now, but omlette house remains in my heart.

On our way back to Cali and stopped here for brunch. Food was very good except asked for hash browns crispy and they were oily and soggy but chicken fried steak was crunchy and tender. Latte I ordered was disappointing to me but brothers banana shake was delish. Probably will never go back but if lived in Vegas would. Cute decor inside.

A couple of friends brought my daughter here for breakfast after a sleepover recently & when she got home, she was ranting & raving about how we needed to go back. She thought I would love it. I decided to give it a shot today since I was in the area...I can see why she recommended it.

It's a cute place that is spacious, the decor is happy, the people are all pleasant (who wouldn't be happy wearing pj's at work?!) & then the food...it's really good.

This morning I ordered:

-latte w/Nutella & whipped cream
-build your own omelette (I chose cheddar, spinach & avocado w/ the pot of bread as my side choice)
-strawberry watermelon juice

The latte was ok. Tasted more like a hot cocoa & wasn't hot enough for me. I felt like I had to drink it quick so I wouldn't lose the heat. Next time I'll opt for the French press coffee.

The omelette was pretty darn good. The egg portion was fluffy & the ingredients I added were fresh & tasty. My favorite part of the plate? The hash browns. Holy cow were those good. They are thick cut strips of real potatoes that were the perfect combo of crispy & seasoned with some softer pieces underneath. I want to high five the chef for the perfect grilling of this deliciousness on my plate.
The pot of bread that I chose was amazing too. It came out hot with a side of butter and cream cheese sauce. When I removed the bread from the pot, I found that there were swirls of cinnamon throughout it. I dipped it in the cream cheese & to my delight, I realized it was like a cinnamon roll. So so good.

The waiter recommended their fresh squeezed juices that are squeezed fresh on site. I decided I wanted something else after the quick latte so I ordered the strawberry watermelon juice. It was ok. Definitely fresh. The flavor was more watermelon than strawberry & it was sweet but had a bit of a bitter aftertaste like I had just bitten into the white/green part of the melon. I think I'll try a different flavor next time.

The service was good. I had a waiter named Roy who was patient & friendly. He was as quick as he could be. 

Overall I'm happy with the experience & will definitely come back!

My first time going to Rise and Shine with my bf. We were told that the kitchen was going to take a little longer today; we didn't care. We sat down and ordered our food. My bf ordered orange juice water,  plan pancakes,  eggs, hash browns and sausage. I order banana, pecan frosted flake pancakes and a water. It took 45 minutes to get our food.  Waitress was nice but 45 minutes isn't a "little" wait. Service was good and food was good. I was disappointed when I received my pancakes but didn't say anything to the waitress because I didn't want to wait another 45 minutes for a redo. My pancakes had banana foster style bananas on too , brown sugar & pecans everywhere, whipped cream with frosted flakes on top of that. I can't have dairy so that ruined my frosted flakes. I don't like bananas foster style cooked bananas. I assumed they would be sliced and inside the pancakes, but they weren't. The menu didn't mention anything. After a few bites I started feeling very sick; I realized they must add a lot if milk to their batter (which has never happened to me before)Also the bill came to $45. That's ridiculous for 2 people and what we ordered. Just disappointed overall.  Sorry but I won't be coming back

I just left this place and I'm pretty angry... Angry that I haven't been here sooner!  This is easily one of the best places for breakfast in Las Vegas.  

I'm a total coffee snob, so the fact they have French Press coffee is reason enough for me to go back.  I love that they bring over this little timer for you to use and decide how strong you want your coffee.  

I will also go on to say that I'm basically a retired red meat eater, so it's very rare(no pun intended) that I decide to eat a steak.  I woke up today fiending for some red meat, but I'm mulling over whether or not I want to break my meat eating for a breakfast place.  Breakfast places, even good ones, are never really known for quality steak.  

I'm glad I chose this place!  There are so many amazing options on the menu to choose from, my decision was hard, but I figured I might as well try the restaurant's namesake and I'm glad I did.  

I got the "The Ultimate" which was a spice-rubbed thin cut rib eye steak, potatoes, eggs and a choice of bread.  I opted for the biscuit.  

The Steak:  Juicy, full of flavor, tender and effin delicious!  Seriously, better than some middle of the road steak houses I've been to in vegas.  

The Eggs:  Eggs were eggs. They were good.

The Potatoes:  Loved them!  Kind of like wide cut hashbrowns, but better.  

The Biscuit:  Dense, soft, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside.  They were delicious! 

The Service: Great!  Attentive, friendly and fast. 

It will be a while before I eat red meat again, but it won't be a while before I go back.  So many other things I want to try!

This is now my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! Not only is the food great, but the service is amazing. My Waitress' name was Ashley. Her service was phenomenal and she made a great suggestion when I didn't know what to order. Don't know if you guys do employee of the month, but she deserves it! definitely coming back again

I love rise and  shine! I eat here 4 to 5 times a week!! My favorite food is the island inspired Loco moco. I had some yummy sweet cream pancakes  today. There is always a small wait to get  in the door, that's awesome due to them just opening up! Always worth the wait and I'll be back in a few days!! I'm going to come in my pj's next time!!

Me and a girlfriend were looking for a place with really good steak and eggs. Came across this on Yelp and decided to give it a try. From start to finish we had really great service. Our waitress Danielle was great! She was very helpful and had great menu knowledge. We ended up getting the Classic Ribeye and eggs along with the country fried steak. Although the service was 5/5 food got 4/5. The Ribeye was a bit over cooked but had a great taste with the espresso seasoning. The CFS on the other hand had no taste what so ever. The batter was eh and gravy barely had any sausage and was very bland. It was fine after a little doctoring up. A bit over priced for what you get and not a lot of flavor. Definitely gonna give this place a second chance to try more things on the menu..

I love big breakfasts and brunches. Omelets, soft, fluffy pancakes, hot coffee, mmm. We were visiting friends and came here on a Sunday morning. Our server was great and the food was fantastic. I got an omelet and had hash browns, with the pot of bread beforehand. The taste of everything was just outstanding. My friend made the mistake of letting me try her blueberry pancakes and I aye about half of them, haha. I wish we had one of these places in Phoenix.

Our waitress, as well as the food was great! Not too busy yet, so we didn't wait. Maybe early Sundays is the time to be there? 
Highly recommend.

New location opened on Flamingo & 215. Was so crowded but worth the wait. Ordered our breakfast, not that complicated, wanted regular eggs instead of egg whites for my omelette didn't think it was a big deal & waiter said it was ok. I knew it was going to be bad when we first got our coffees and literally 10 mins later we got our pot of bread after reminding the waiter first. He said sorry & a couple of minutes later we finally got the pot of bread. Minutes later waiter returned to say sorry for the delay for the food but there were "issues in the kitchen." As we are getting our food the waiter comes by & says sorry but the chef won't make my omelette with regular eggs because it's on the menu with egg whites then quickly asked if I wanted to order something else from the menu and by this time we've been waiting like 25 mins for our food. But the other waitress handing us our food says of course you can get what you order which was an omelette with regular eggs. Then the waiter says oh I didn't know that. He then says I must of not put in the order correctly. He only admitted his mistake because the other waitress said it in front of him. So first he lied by blaming the chef that the order would not be done by the chef then when he got caught he said oh yeah I must not have put the order in right. So I asked to speak with the manager, Casey, & she was amazing. She apologized & said the waiter was new and there was no excuse for waiting until the wrong order was cooked & brought it to the table. It seemed he had done this to other tables as well because the table behind us was also having issues with their order from our same waiter. Casey took care of our entire meal. I told her I wasn't looking for anything free, just making her aware of the situation but she still took care of everything. So my upsetting late late breakfast was better thanks to Casey. And by the way I did get my omelette with regular eggs.

Woke up late from a previous long day and decided to have breakfast instead of lunch at noon. Rise & Shine was absolutely perfect for our huge appetites. It was my first time there and will absolutely come back. Everything was delicious.

We got the steak chiliqueles  and biscuits &gravy  .... steak was overcooked, asked for a medium rare and got a medium. Was very happy with the chips until I got to the beans, wich had a weird spice added to them. Eggs were cooked very well. Buiscuits (there were 2)were good til I ate the first one was nice and hot like it should be but the second one was cold and the gravy around it was cold. Server was nice and if we had questions she explained very well. Everything else on the biscuit plate was really good. Really happy they didn't overcook my eggs, they were perfect.

SO, I do like this place! I just think that the food could be a little bit better. I will start by saying the atmosphere of the place is amazing and homey. I like that all the employees are wearing pajamas. They little umbrellas hanging of the ceiling are cute too. The place just has a really nice country breakfast place feel. I really enjoyed our waitress and she called us hun and baby. It was just a very welcoming and authentic staff.

The food was good don't get me wrong. I order the steak omelette and I am really picky about the way steak is cooked and prepared, and they prepared it very well. However, I just feel like something was missing in the food and I don't quite know how to explain it. The menu is so big as well that I always am trying to pick what to order! However, I will say that the pot-o-bread is freaking amazing. I love the little sweet things. I like to experience sweet and savory during breakfast, and maybe that's what was lacking but I had some chicken and waffle and was a little dissapponted in how the chicken was cooked. Still a good chicken and waffle just need to be less breading and more flavorful chicken.

Great, relaxing place to enjoy a meal with friends or family. When my mother comes to town we always come here the morning she leaves. It like our breakfast place! The environment is fun and exciting. There are dancing umbrellas hanging from the ceiling and the waiters/waitresses wear onesie pajamas!! The food is great. You can order a "cup o bread" which is a cinnamon roll in a tea cup! Fun fun fun!!! I ordered the crunchy cinnamon French toast platter. It was amazing!!!! I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu. I would defined recommend trying this place at least once. Especially if you have someone visiting town

I had the crunchy cinnamon French toast and it was really good! Probably one of the best French toasts I've had. They give you big portions. Only ate half. Our waitress Ashley was very nice and friendly! Over all great experience!

I finally had the opportunity to try the new breakfast spot in spring valley. I had a hard time picking a breakfast dish off of their menu because there are so many exciting options that I was anxious to taste. I decided on the chicken omelet with egg whites... (Chorizo breakfast bonito I am coming for you next)! The omelet was cooked perfectly. Actually everything was perfect, including the avocado Garnish. They had a few different bread options. I chose the biscuit, which was awesome. Next time, I want to try the bread pot.  Even the coffee was on-point. I do wish they had flavored creamers. 

The server was really sweet. Before we left, we checked out the retail shop. They have some cute pjs. 

I can't wait to come back.

Rise & Shine is a great breakfast spot & one that I go to often. It's never too busy, but their location has enough space to hold a lot of people. I never have to wait to be seated, food comes out right away & service is friendly.

On top of that, their portion sizes are huge & food is delicious! My boyfriend changes up his order, but most of the time gets the "Ultimate Steak & Eggs." I get the "Chicken & Waffles." Their "Pot of Bread" is my favorite side!

I love this place!

We've been here in Las Vegas for a few days and have eaten at several different highly rated, and very good, restaurants (Bacchanal, Carnevino, Americana) but this was definitely my favorite meal. I had the spice rubbed ribeye and chilaquiles and it was EPIC!!! We also had bread in a cup, pancakes, eggs Benedict, french toast and they were all so good. We will keep this on or "must eat" list for the next time we are in town

This place is such a cute breakfast spot. Love the ambiance and waiters/waitresses are dressed up in pajamas! It makes it feel so cozy. Everyone's really friendly! I wish there was a location in the northwest side of Vegas!

Portions are humongous, that's probably why it's a bit pricey. I love their freshly squeezed orange juice. "Cup o bread" is a MUST! I could eat 10 of those. I've tried many dishes here and they're all pretty tasty.

Always wanted to go to their Southern Highlands location, but never made it out to the area. How lucky that they opened one up next to my nearest LVAC!

The fianc and I went there this past Sunday for lunch...loved it. She had one of the steak burritos and I had the spiced steak. Meat was top-notch...rivaled the quality of more expensive steak restaurants. Oh and like many reviewers say about the other location - GET THE POT OF BREAD. You won't regret it, especially if you like cinnamon. Outdoor seating is nice too.

Service was a bit slow and it took a while to process our check due to computer system slowness. However, they just opened so I'll cut them some slack in this department. The food was that great that it compensates for the service slowness.

Our new go-to breakfast/brunch spot. Check it out, you won't regret it.

First time eating here. Everybody that I came in contact with was very friendly. I ordered a steak and avocado egg white omelette which was very tasty. The hash browns were almost as amazing as the highlight of the experience - my server Ashley. She was extremely friendly, attentive, speedy, and made great recommendations on everything from the food to happy socks.  I will definitely return!
