Great atmosphere! They wear cute tasteful PJ's and are really friendly. The food was great! My steak was cooked to perfection and the fresh squeezed juices was a tasteful healthy delight.

this place is amazing . . . Outside setting is classy & the phenomenal breakfast & excellent customer service from Amber made it well worth it ! 
Blueberry Pancakes : theBOMB !  w/complementary warm cinnamon maple syrup . We'll be back . . . #2bContinued

The food is alright but never order from here through Postmates because they ALWAYS forget something or simply choose to cancel your order after 50 minutes. I tried one last time today to order from them and once again they forgot two items that I paid for. This is the third time this has occurred and I certainly will NEVER try them again. The managers solution was to have me drive by to pick up a voucher... the reason I paid the postermates charge was so I wouldn't have to drive anywhere. Their food is alright, just not worth the hassle. Mimosas Gourmet on Durango has way better food and customer service. I suggest you go or order from there.

They have the best food in town. Their steak and eggs melts in your mouth, you don't even need any A1 or stake sauce. The buffalo chicken steak is also one of my favorites. The. Waitresses are always friendly. At time you make have to wait but the wait is so worth it.

One of my favorite breakfast places ever!  The food is out of this world.  Checking in is kinda nightmarish and the older lady with tats who reaks of cigarettes smoke is the worst server ever!  But the atmosphere is so delightful, the outfits worn are adorable and the food seriously is incredible. If you can get past the check in and not get the lady with Hamza tattoos that smells of cigarette smoke you're in good hands and your experience will be phenomenal

When visiting my son and his wife in town, I always request one stop here. Today we happen to bring along all the family. Like always it satisfied my breakfast craving. Each member left full and content. Our server today was Nicole, she was so personable, and made our stay extra nice.  A must get is the bread in a cup. Just get it and don't doubt, it's a nice lil surprise in a cup. The ultimate Ribeye, is my favorite. Today it was perfect! So far, I'll keep coming back when in town.

First time here and I have to say it's awesome! The staff is super friendly. Frankie was my server. Friendly, funny and attentive. I'm from San Diego but next time I visit good ole Sin City I will Rise & Shine at my new fave spot.

The food was amazing. Try the corn beef hash..banana foster waffle.. chicken and waffle... Smoked Salmon Benedict.. Everything was beyond expectations. Our server Ashley was perfect. This place is a gem.
This is a must when in Vegas!!!!!!! Food is delicious staff is very friendly. They also give you a bread in a cup is a must try for sure.

Want people to serve you food in their pajamas? This is the place!
I think it's cute!

Saw this place on las vegas weekly so I figured why not give it a try!
I am guessing their theme is like being in a "farm". There's three different doors you can enter in this place ha! As soon as you enter you'll see these umbrellas with flower print in them, some moves some doesn't. Can you imagine staring at them if everything moves? LOL. Oh and there's a big cow "poster" on the wall!

Loco mock - You can't expect this to be 100% good because we all know that's Hawaiian food. I ordered medium well on my patty, it's okay. I also didn't like how much gravy they put, its almost like a soup!!! Not enough rice for how big the patty is and like I said how much gravy is in it!
Chocolate milk - A place that uses milk with their powdered cocoa! I hate when places uses water with this!

The register is a step away from the hostess so you have no idea which line unless you ask. But all in all I liked it and I'll give it a second try maybe third :P
Food was fresh and came out right....service was excellent everyone in the party enjoyed!

I am very picky when it comes to eating chilaquiles but this place does it PERFECTLY! The chips were still crunchy, they were zesty but not overly spicy and just all around delicious! The staff is very friendly and we were able to have an easy conversation with the manager. They are all smiles and able to roll with the punches of the day, I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family! :D

The wait to get a table was a long one. But the food here is amazing, so the wait was worth it. Still it's not my favorite breakfast spot, but I do say it's worth the visit. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is nice. Overall, I will gladly be returning.
I love the decor and the wait staff gets to wear PJs! The service and food were excellent! We will be back!

Good food and worth the wait!
Been wanting to try Rise and finally made it happen!!!!
LOVE that the staff serves in jammies and the biscuts and Gravy are AMAZING! We will be back . 
My husband ordered a lox omelet and was stuffed with Salomon, he is a happy camper. Food and service on point

Underwhelmed after waiting outside for 30 minutes in the wind.
Portions big, but the prices are also. Pancakes came with zero butter. Lots of better breakfast options than this old Joes crab shack.
Mmmmmm bomb. Had the bacon egg in a hole French toast. So good. Also had the green go go juice I liked that as well.

Yummy yummy yummy!!!! Amazing Fresh squeezed juice! I had watermelon & strawberry! Had the Steak &spinach Benedict and I came in hungry and left very satisfied. My friend had the banana frosted pancakes.... Amazing as well! Didn't need syrup (but comes warm with cinnamon sticks in it) they were moist and delicious! French press coffee was outstanding! So glad they opened here in Sprig valley so I can come more often!!!!! I will definitely be back!

The moment you walk in, you're in a new alternate reality, where, everyone is still in pajamas. 
The servers are wearing pajamas and upside down umbrellas hang from the ceiling. 
I started my journey with a coffee that tasted watered down. 
But where this place really shines is that pot of bread. My favorite. All time. 
The steaks and eggs are always on point. 
And the staff is really nice. 
I wish my server this time around didn't make my date feel rushed, but it was fine.

Madison & Sarah were the nicest and kind servers! They greeted me with a smile, provided a great recommendation and I'm a morning person so I REALLY appreciate friendly people in the morning  
I the bacon wrapped steak & eggs with a side of potatoes. It was DELISH! I will have to return and bring the family for breakfast! 
As I checked out, Casey, the hostess was super friendly, asked my name and shook my hand and asked how everything was and she greeted with a smile which I appreciated as well!
Great way to start the day!

Best pot of bread EVER! I love the Go Go Green juice they have .. im so addicted to it .. and ordered build your own omelette with spinach, onions, bell pepper and bacon .. im not big with harsh brown its not them its just i dont like potatoes so instead i ask for a toast  then my brother and my bf both have the 2 egg breakfast! Its been awhile ive been here but its the best breakfast place ever

The only reason I am giving this a star at all is due to our waitress who was really sweet. Our food came out cold and under cooked. There was absolutely no flavor to my potatoes even though it appears as though they were cooked with onions. My watermelon strawberry juice had a faint meat taste which I attribute to the fruit being cut with utensils used with meat or even a cutting board not fully washed. The sausage was hard and I don't mean burnt I mean tough and slightly dried out it also smelled bad. After one bite of that I decided to just eat my toast, the only thing palatable. My husband and I will not be back.

We stopped in a little bit ago to celebrate my nephews early birthday. We were greeted sweetly and seated quickly in a big comfy booth. The atmosphere is so dang cute, definitely "rise and shin-y" there's twirling umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, little metal roosters in the corner and lots of other eye catching sun shine-y decor. Our waitress came quickly and took our drink orders and our food at the same time because we were ready. She was so awesome! Our waters came out right after we ordered them and shortly after our carafe of freshly squeezed orange juice that was so divine! Nephew ordered the rise and shine burrito without any cheese, after the food runners brought out the food our waitress stopped by to see if everything was delivered and if there was any cheese at all on my nephews plate (he was so impressed because nobody ever asks) he said that it was absolutely delicious and the refried beans on the side were the best he's ever had, he practically licked his plate clean! my hubby and I shared a buffalo chicken (sauce on the side) with eggs and hash browns plate with a side of biscuits and gravy. There are Not enough compliments to describe this heavenly plate of food, perfectly seasoned, crunchy  and huge breast of chicken, thick cut yummy hash browns and perfectly fluffy scrambled eggs! The sausage gravy and biscuits were a perfect touch and we both left full and happy! Our cup o'bread didn't end up coming out with our food so our waitress brought us extra. They were so dainty and cute, fluffy and that cream cheese syrup dipper was amazeballs! Our waitress was never too far away if we needed her and it was probably the best customer service we've ever had at a restaurant! We will definitely be adding rise and shine to our regularly visited spots!

Amazing. This place can be summed up in the word AMAZING! Not only is the atmosphere cute and the employees wear pjs, but the fact that they went above and beyond. We hosted a bridal brunch here around 1 pm on a Saturday. They were helpful, so kind, and very well organized. Some places just give you a bad attitude for having a large group. But they served all 35 of ladies with big smiles on their faces. We RSVP'd ahead of time, and when we got there to set up- the tables were ready to go. I know we were blocking the paths sometimes and I apologized to one of them and she said "no, don't be sorry. This is your guys party!" How sweet is that?!?! I am just so happy with the customer service with this place!! Hands down the best customer service I've received in awhile!

Well we thought we would try again.  This time we went on a Thursday morning and were seated right away.  We had to wait forever (with our two small grandchildren) for Tyler to take our order.  He was very laid back and is in no hurry to do anything.  The food came out cold.  Won't be back.

I actually had to come twice before I wrote this review. 
I try to keep my reviews as focused on the food as possible, but this one will be little bit different. 


I'll start by saying the place itself looks really cool! 
The vibe is super chill, big space, and all those fans on the ceiling add a unique spirit to the place. 

The food (breakfast burrito, hash brown, chikilitas and more) was good! The right combination between breakfast and brunch place with a touch of Mexican flame to it. 

The one thing I didn't like, and most likely will make me not come back will be the service. Not that it was bad, it was ok, but honestly I expect more than just ok from a place like this. Bottom line it seemed like the servers (all of them) give you the feeling like they're doing you a favor. The servers dress in Pajamas which is a cool concept, but honestly I didn't appreciate their moody tone of voice like they just got out of bed. 

Trust me, I know food! And good service too :)

Okay like most really good breakfast places this place is not cheap. But holy giant pancakes Batman. I mean honestly, I have reviewed another breakfast place in town and thought I saw the worlds largest pancake. NOPE! This places pancakes would break records. Not to mention their unique pancake flavors. I had the Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. You read that right, they make a pancake with Bananas and Frosted Flakes in them, they also put some pecans in their for a little extra treat. I truly believe that when God created the pancake his eventual goal was the Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. These were freaking awesome! Did I mention they were huge. A normal person needs to just ask for the to go box when the food comes out, I did. Oh and I enjoyed me some Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes the next two mornings on what I put in that to go box. My wife was also super complementary of their country gravy and biscuits (she is not a fan of pancakes - I know lame...), but we are from the southeast originally so she is somewhat of an expert where gravy is concerned and this she said was the best she has had in Vegas. The place is family friendly and I now take the title I granted another establishment and give it to this place. BEST BREAKFAST IN VEGAS!

Guys...Guys...GUYS!!!
Great job what a come back!!!!
Lol! I had to start it that way...but excellent job once again.  The food was great the service spot on(thanks to Adam in blue Pjz)  the speed of the food to the table was fast(I think it was the timing when we got there...when we got there it was full but when we left it was packed good luck)  
We will be back and the best pot of bread in Las Vegas

OMG I had no idea there was a summerlin location 5 minutes from my house!! One of the managers Jennifer had informed me that instead of me driving 30 min to southern highlands.... There was also another location BY MEEEE. My life is saved, everything is so good and the location and building is so cute! Our food came out in a timely manner and everything was cooked to perfection. I am not going any other breakfast place ever again.

Also, my server Chelsea is the bessttttt she was so happy and positive and made my whole experience!

I drove all the way here from North Las Vegas for brunch & it's so worth it! They have the BEST hashbrowns I've had in while! The first time I went, I had the Red velvet chocolate chip pancakes, half order since 1 pancake is bigger than the plate. I didn't even need any frosting, butter or syrup..! it was AMAZING! the next time I went, I ordered the Ultimate steak and eggs with hashbrowns & my daughter ordered the chicken fried steak. Both were extremely huge & delicious! I can't wait to try more & DEF will be back sooner than later for sure!! Pricing is pretty average and you definitely get your money's worth! 

If you plan to go, plan for a wait! we waited about 30 minutes to get seated for just the 2 of us... which was expected since we went on a Sunday morning.

We started out w/a fresh carrot/green apple juice. $3.95 small for the price compared to "bite" and "skinnyfats" the combo didn't work together either. My wife had the pineapple/banana smoothie which was better tasting.

The fried chicken breast was overbreaded and dry which would've been ok if it came w/gravy. I suggested to them that they not put powdered sugar on top of the chicken and leave it for the waffle,  and speaking of waffle it was soggy because of the chicken on top. I told all this to the girl at the front desk taking our check and she credited the waffle.

My wife's Philly steak and eggs was excellent and I would highly recommend.

The waiter rushed us and gas bad timing.

Overall experience is good from the place itself and the food.

Overall, we preferred the Southern Highlands location of Rise and Shine in terms of access, service and quality.  The Flamingo location is difficult to access for anyone with a handicap.

The food is average and does not reflect the prices when compared to comparable menus at other restaurants.  Service was less than average when we were there on a weekday, mid-morning.

I love a place with kitsch that's fun. But more than that, I love a place that has kitsch but also really delicious food that isn't all just a gimmick.

The waitstaff in pajamas is a wonderful touch and the adorable floral umbrellas overhead really brightened my day.

We came here for a very late brunch last Saturday, around 1:30-2pm? The menu was full of delicious sweet and savory things that just looked decadent and to die for. I have a hard time eating heavy food early in my day (yes, I'd slept in on a weekend in Vegas, sue me :P) so I opted for something a little fresher than the pancakes and country fried steak fare - a NY strip steak Caesar salad (dressing on the side like always). I ordered my steak rare and WAS IT EVER RARE. I love my steaks borderline mooing and this was beautiful. It was really thinly cut and just melted in my mouth. The romaine of the salad was crunchy and really fresh, and the bite to the Caesar dressing was a great complement to the steak.

I had a few sips of a friend's banana-berry-other-things smoothie and wished I'd ordered one myself. It was a little seedy but the flavor was on point.

I was, like always bummed to hear "Is pepsi okay?" when asking for a diet coke, and I wish I'd gotten a sierra mist or something instead of the minute maid pink lemonade that's just kinda sweet and tasteless. Oh well.

My friends were all taken aback by how delicious their meals were. I stole some fries from one and they were skinny, crunchy yet fluffy, and seasoned beautifully with a little garlic and herbs I think?

I'd love to come back here, maybe on a day when I've somehow gotten an early start (or maybe come in on a morning flight so I'm ready to stuff my face upon arrival) so that I can try some of the more luxurious things. But I'd love to come back!!

This probably my favorite breakfast place in all of vegas. Their portion size is huge but they don't  compromise quality of the food. I tried their ribeye steak breakfast combo. (Came with two eggs and hash potatoes). I also had the classic cut French toast with watermelon juice. Big space and cozy vibe. Great friendly staff and service as well! I will def come back. Best breakfast in town.

Tables that were seated well after me got their food. I ordered the oatmeal and it had clumps of oatmeal on it. Then I found the hair in the oatmeal. My husband's good was not hot. Prices higher than other Vegas restaurants. Cute decor but I can't eat that 

As to your response you really did not resolve the matter. You didn't charge  me for food that  I couldn't eat. I barely had two mouthfuls. I left hungry and sick to my stomach. What was the resolution?  Don't think I'd give you another chance. Plenty of breakfast places out there

Stopped here today because of the reviews I had seen on Yelp and this place was everything and more...the service was absolutely amazing and the food was fresh and delicious and the only reason I gave 4 stars was because it was a bit expensive $50 for 2 people but, it was a lot of food and I took half of mine home to eat for later.  This place is fun too...the waitresses all wear pajamas and they sell socks with different sayings  I definitely recommend trying this place out...they are only open til 3pm though so, there's not dinner there but that's ok

We are here on vacation and wanted to try an off strip breakfast place before hitting the road. This was a little out of the way but definitely worth it. The food was fantastic, the staff was friendly and it was just the right price. I had a Philly cheese steak bagel sandwich, the meat was delicious, I would recommend going with a plain bagel rather than the everything bagel though because the flavors in the bagel were a little overwhelming. Hubby had a steak and chorizo burrito. The flavors in it were excellent, the sauce on it was great and the beans served in n the side were very tasty as well. The decor is cute and the wait staff dress in pajamas which is a fun and cute touch.  Overall very happy with our experience.

Wow. Disappointing.  40 minute for a table... Sat for another 20 minutes waiting for a waiter/waitress.. Nothing... Finally asked if a server had been assigned to our table... Nope... Looking around and see just one buss boy busting his tail... No one helping him. Three waiters and two waitresses for the whole place. . People lined up outside waiting,  to while four tables sat unoccupied... Looks like a problem with management and leadership

Great Breakfast Place. 

Fun Vibe. Good Breakfast Entrees. Friendly Service. Funny T Shirts. 

This is a traditional breakfast place (& they have lunch dishes as well).

Unique Item: Get the Pot of Bread with your Coffee. Their unique twist on a cinnamon roll :)

Went to one on flamingo and 215 food was excellent and the servers that I have had were great! Only problem I had was I had a three month old baby I took to bathroom to do a diaper change and there was no where to change my baby. I asked the hostess where I can go she said they dont have changing tables, and told me people go to their cars. So in 105 degrees in vegas I went to change my baby. Unacceptable to me and if mcdonalds can have changing tables so should this place... its a family restaurant. You need to accommodate people with babies. But food was great!

I love that it's not your typical small seating breakfast spot with delicious food. This is a nice size restaurant! I say that because I always find the smaller restaurants have the best breakfast food. I wanted to have breakfast somewhere new today on this beautiful sunny Presidents Day. I decided to come here based off Yelp (of course, duh) and hence the weather I wanted to eat outside on their patio. 

Fortunately, unlike most of you there was no wait today. The server was prompt once we were seated. The menu was overwhelming because everything looked so great. The only serve half & half and milk for creamer to your coffee. Personal preference: When you drink coffee every morning before leaving to work at home flavored creamer is just as addicting as the coffee itself. I felt obligated to order steak and eggs because that's what they're known for so there I was ordering "The Ultimate". I really wanted to try the bagel sandwiches but I stuck to my basic grounds for my first visit. I give my entree a 3/5 because one star for the amazing hash browns, 1 star for my eggs being over medium like I asked them to be and 1 star for my steak having the right amount of pink your average medium steak should be. The minus 2 stars for my overly seasoned steak. Did the cook accidentally smother my steak with black pepper or is this how they prep their steaks. On a higher note, my breakfast date had the three little pigs bagel entrees and her rating was a 5/5! Is noted they use high quality bacon instead of those measly small slices they serve else where. I knew I should've got the damn bagel entree to begin with, lol. 

The highlight of our visit was the pot of bread who the kind server recommended. It's a dinner roll wrapped in a cinnamon roll with a side of homemade icing. You can substitute it for your toast with your entrees. Another highlight was the MILITARY DISCOUNT WITH YOUR ID OF COURSE! I'm not military but my friend was and I feel like this discount speaks volumes. I have a lot of military friends and I find it so respectable when places offer it!

Came here on a Sunday and had a great experience. Amberly was a fantastic server, very polite and efficient. When she warns you about the portions, heed her warning: we ordered red velvet pancakes that were larger than dinner platters, delicious but definitely should be shared.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch and no line or wait.  Ordered the Nutella latte which was so tasty but had big chunks of melted Nutella at the bottom of the glass which was a little much.

Ordered the 3 piggy breakfast sandwich and it was a big portion!  Would recommend getting the fruit on the side, plated well and delicious.   

Cute atmosphere and great food!

What a great place for breakfast! I had the eggs benadict (with extra hollandaise sauce), a pot of bread, & an iced tea. I arrived at 2pm on a Sunday (they close at 3pm) & was seated right away. Service was excellent. I think my server's name was Roy. I love the spinning upside down umbrella decor & that all the servers wear pjs. The only thing I would recommend is to ask for the eggs benadict without the balsamic drizzle. The sweetness just doesn't compliment the hollandaise sauce. Also, the size of the pot of bread in the photos is a little misleading. It's served in a tiny espresso size cup, not a regular size coffee mug. However, it is the perfect size for a one person side dish so it didn't really bother me. I'd definitely get it again....& again.

Wake up! It's time for breakfast!  Well that was how Cesar Q. and I felt this morning.  We've seen the pictures and all the reviews so it was time for some steak and eggs!

The location is great and very convenient.  Just off the 215 and Flamingo.  It's in the old Joe's Crab Shack building.  The ambiance is bright and the building is huge so lots of comfortable space.  We sat inside at a 4 top table but noticed the awesome outdoor dining once we had already ordered.  

I never ever order chicken fried steak!  However, after seeing the incredible pictures posted by my fellow yeeps I took the plunge!  I orders that which I never order and I liked it! I'm sure my hips will appreciate it too.  My meal came with a choice of eggs and bread.  It was also served with the home fries that were truly amazing! I just may swing by for an order of these yummy little carbs all by themselves! They are that good!  Anyway I selected scrambled eggs and to my disappointment they were from a carton, not fresh scrambled eggs!  When your at a restaurant that specializes in breakfast one would expect fresh cracked eggs.  I opted for the biscuit as my bread choice.  It was just ok. The gravy that came with my chicken fried steak tasted homemade.  I really enjoyed it.  

On a side note, it was really nice having all the sauces on the table so I didn't have to ask.  Not only was that convenient they also had cholula!  So many times places only have tobasco! YUCK!  There was also ketchup and a-1 steak sauce.

The service was efficient yet our waitress didn't seem "happy".  She was ok but did not give us the feeling that she enjoyed her job. I do feel it took a long time for our meal to come out (25 minutes) however my husband did order a steak with his eggs that were over cooked.  He did mention that the steak was great!  I felt comfortable as the staff was wearing their PJ's.  Pretty cool concept!  

I opted for the 4 star rating as all in all the meal was quite good.  If I could have done 3.5 I would have.  Would have preferred fresh cracked eggs.  I will be back for some of their coffee and those damned potatoes! I'm still thinking about them!

We walked in and were told the wait would be about 10-20 mins, no problem, we looked around and read some of the funny quotes on the t-shirts , some very comical, we enjoyed the cute flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, seemed cozy and we were eager to see how the food was going to be.

We actually were seated only 10 mins of waiting, nice surprise and were sat near the fresh juice drink bar, and had to order the Watermelon juice and a fresh squeezed orange juice , yes the watermelon was fresh and not imitation, it was so refreshingly delicious, and pretty much the most flavorful item I ordered.

We came during Halloween weekend and all the staff were dressed in costumes which added to the fun environment... "Harry Potter" served us and he was great and knew the menu very well.

The unfortunate reason for the 3 stars was the food, although looking good, we found for some reason the eggs were a little rubbery and we had to keep adding salt...
As per recommendation of "Harry" as to get either the Banger sausage, the kielbasa or bacon, he raved about the bacon especially if ordered extra crispy... 
So I ordered the classic which included 2 eggs, bacon (extra crispy) and hash browns with choice of bread and of course the cinnamon pot of bread (you must try the pot of bread if you dine here a positive plug and reward for the meal). 
When the meal arrived, the bacon was barely past pink and did not stand up to attention by any means, sad...
I was only able to eat a few bites of the eggs , and no it wasn't a picky morning, just an unfortunate meal for me.
My friends got a classic with 3 egg whites and one yolk, avocado and hash browns, she also had the same problem with her eggs being rubbery and tasting like they came from a carton not a fresh egg.
And chicken fried steak and gravy 
The hash browns were almost done well enough, a bit of bite it took to eat and the steak my friend said was dry but edible.

I think something must have been wrong with the coffee machine because it tasted burnt but was cold...

So to sum up, we might give it another shot and try completely different meals but will make sure to order the watermelon juice and pot of bread for sure.
We left feeling underwhelmed and still hungry.

One of my fav spots to eat I never do reviews but for this morning I will , Ashley was our server and wow what an amazing dining experience made it so much fun and easy. I had the white omelette steak and damn!!! So good lol

The staff is cool but the wait for your food is ridiculous. It took almost an hour to get the food when we finally started to get our food they forgot my moms plate but brought her the side of avocado she ordered.she waited another 10 minutes till she got the food that she even needed the avocado for. This place is way overrated.

We went at about 1pm on Saturday and we asked if we could be seated outside, beautiful day and were told no, it's time to clean up the out side.  Then the 2 young ladies were going to seat us on the far west side of the restaurant between to families with toddlers and the sun was beating in full force.  We asked if we could sit away from the sun next to some other people and were told no, that section is closed you can only sit in the booth.  Really? I asked and she said that was all they had available... Are you kidding me... the whole place was empty with the exception of 3 booth and one table.  We going to that area at least once a week, but instead we went over to Famous Dave's.  The owner needs to check these girls out or replace them.  What harm is there in sitting a few feet away... We will never go back.  : (

Perfect place for breakfast with the family! They have fresh juices which is a major plus! I ordered their oatmeal which was pretty good and my boyfriend loves their country fried steak and eggs. The waiters and waitress wear pajamas and it makes the restaurant a fun environment. Love this place!

Food was really good, service was good. We were seated promptly and they will let you have your dogs on the patio. We went on a Tuesday morning though so not many people were there. The watermelon and strawberry juice was great and they might have the best pancakes I've ever eaten... Didn't even need syrup. Would recommend but keep in mind the portions are huge.
Amazing place, awesome food, trippy decor... all you could ask for in a breakfast place. And more! Love Rise & Shine.
The food here is amazing and they have wonderful service and I love how they are always in their pjs .
Best steak and eggs hands down.. steak had a wionderful flavor. Food was fast and service was great!

Probably the best breakfast place I've been to Vegas (and yes I've been to Baby stacks).  The Philly cheese steak two fisted breakfast sandwich is filling and does require two fists to eat. Most underrated menu item is the watermelon-strawberry juice which is the true definition of refreshing.  I would recommend going between 7-9 as it tends to get crowded later. Highly recommended and you'll enjoy it

Ok, first thing, I have to say that our waitress was the best, secondly, the food was great, and thirdly, loved the atmosphere. My sons and I had my birthday brunch here on Oct 3, and they was so charming, thanks for the great service, we will be back.

Second try. Still avg at best. Atmosphere- trying too hard to be cute and building to cavernous to be warm. Service attentive but not great, got order wrong, cleared table while everyone eating and ignored us when we told them men's room flooded. Food average...ham to salty and dry, bread pot a good idea but only a so so  result. Management seems out of it. If you can't get into egg and i, you could try this but lower your expectations considerably.
Servers in pajamas really relaxes me. Haha other than that, I don't remember what I ate. Family friendly neighborhood breakfast/brunch fix.

This place is amazing! Came in at 10 for 20 min wait but was well worth it. Got the fancy omelet, mushrooms steak cheddar cheese and spinach added with hashbrowns on the side. So filling! I also tried the pot of bread, which is actually a mini cinnamon roll baked in a tiny teacup with icing on the side. Very tasty! I may just have to make this my regular breakfast joint. These guys are better than bluebery hill! Will totally be back~

This was hands down the best breakfast we had in a while. Food was amazing you can tell it was all made in house and super fresh. Our waitress Desire was amazing. She knew the menu very well and made sure what we ordered was exactly what we wanted. She was very attentive and smiling the whole time. All around great place.

I'm very disappointed to give 1 star and really want to give 1 star, but because I frequent here and normally is a 4 star joint! Took my family here visiting from out of state, took forever to get coffee & water. There were no straws given to us. Had to look at our waitress just to get napkins and straws. Ordered the same thing, the ultimate steak and egg, medium well and eggs scrambled soft. Got my food and had a overly super duper cooked steak!. I was hungry too! So it goes back and the waitress brings just the eggs and hash browns & says, I didn't want you to be hungry! . I ordered my food at the same time.. They bring me out a bloody a$$ steak! Yo!! I'm done, so may I get a box, I'll go home and cook it myself. No manager, no anything came over. 19 minutes later, still sitting here with no box, had to ask for coffee again. So the tip game is a wrap! I always tip at least $15! Sad to say, I won't be back, nor bring anyone I know here.
**At least my brother's food was good- He said***
Went for breakfast. The coffee wasn't that flavorful, I got the philly bagel and it was super bland and greasy. They're kind of expensive but you do get a good amount of food.

First time here, love breakfast, so it's been open now for a few weeks/months? Thought we'd try it, arrived 8am, they open at 7am. Several tables outside and a few more inside with early risers. 

We get a table and begin looking over the menu and I notice the servers are in PJ's, kinda weird? Any way we place our drink orders, they have the usual but have added some ice coffee's, juices and smoothies! 

I am a big fan of omelets and of course I go for the fancy steakhouse omelet, tenderloin  steak, cooked your way, cheese, mushrooms, onions and spinach with a bernaise sauce, hash browns and choice of toast or pot of bread.

I usually get toast but today I tried the pot if bread, warm, cinnamon smelling good, but only the top done, inside the cup, 'it's RAW' as Gorden always says!

My steak omelet was really good, steak cooked perfect and the lemony bernaise was so good.  My husband enjoed his spicy rub ribeye chiliquilies, and we shared a short stack red velvet pancake! It was all very good. 

Service was good, food was good and reasonable priced, but they should work on the doughy pot of bread.

Delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food is great and has a cool and unique twist on it. The pot of bread is nice and delicious. Cool atmosphere and overall a top notch experience for a brunch.

So ... food is still on point and I REALLY want to love this place but the service is erratic .

Last time we actually left after 10 min. Seated but no acknowledgment or even drink order . Servers folding napkins and hanging out. So ... we were out.

Maybe a bit impulsive but there are far too many options for them to not be on point - and it is $$$ so expect better.

Not sure if I will be back.
I just had the best bananas foster waffle of my life!! Crispy vanilla waffle with Caramelized sugar, bananas and cinnamon. So good.

This place sucks. I usually dont complain about food but i came here and had about 3 bites of food. 

I ordered chilaquiles which is a dish i have prepared before. It contains chile sauce and is usually seved with sour cream on the side or on top with fried eggs and beans. 

On the menu it says that it is served with refried beans, sauce, cheddar cheese, sour cream, salsa, and two eggs.

What i got was basically nachos chips with NO sauce and beans under all the chips and when i asked for a little bit of sauce they took my plate and re did the whole thing which was nice of them. But when i got my plate back the plate was drenched in an exaggerated amount of sauce. It literally spilled off my plate as i put my fork in it..

And they forgot the beans. 

So i asked for a side of beans and i was so over the fact that i couldnt eat my food without spilling sauce everywhere. 

So i had about 3 bites before i pushed my plate away and just asked them to take it back. At that point i wasnt going to have them bring back a third plate. 

The manager was nice enough to take it off out bill but gave zero fucks that it even happened. But at least out server was nice.

I would never come here again. My boyfriends food turned out the way it was supposed to. But we both agreed that the food was just "okay"

First visit I sat outside waitress was great.  Hostess was great but I believe she would look better in PJs.   She doesn't look like she works there with blue jeans and a shirt.  I had old fashion pancakes which were wonderful.

Wednesday morning in Las Vegas... normally tourists are usually heading to bed and sleeping off a hangover, or possibly donning sunglasses and lounging poolside.  But not this tourist; with family living in town, we left the air-conditioned confines of our hotel on the Strip and ventured into Spring Valley to meet my in-laws here.  Even though we were strong in numbers (7 total), we had the run of the place at 10:00 AM (which is more like 2:00 PM anywhere else in the world).

A bunch of folks ordered coffee in a French Press (which they were VERY excited about), though I abstained for java and got a glass of watermelon & strawberry juice.  After perusing the menu, I decided on the Ultimate Steak & Egg Breakfast, with 3 scrambled eggs and a "pot of bread" (looks like they bake the bread dough in a small coffee cup).

The food was very hearty (definitely needed in this town); my steak was perfectly medium-rare and the pot of bread was served with a sweet buttery dipping sauce.  My wife ordered the corned beef hash and was very satisfied with her selection.  Everyone in my party was pleased with their meal, and we (eventually) ventured back into the heat after breakfast.

The service was excellent... our server was very patient with us, answering all our (inane) questions about the menu.  All the staff were also dressed in pajamas, which made me feel very overdressed in my t-shirt & shorts.  Next time, I'll just roll out of bed and stumble into this place!

Had going away breakfast with a friend on the fly and everything was made to order so fresh and yumma.   Service a little slow but it's a Sunday morning and to be expected. Was so yumma.  I think our server name was Sarah Torres she was so kind and on it (I asked host her name) he too was awesome and funny.  Thanks for the perfect Sunday morning.  PS: I luv the wear pj's to wait on you!
I'm a first timer!  The food was good, there was a lot of items on the menu. However, It was a little on the pricey side for breakfast.  But the bread in a cup was delicious!!

The food is good, and the place is decorated nicely; it's a really cute idea. However, the execution is not up to par. My family and I went once before during the soft opening and it took almost 3 hours to get seated have food and pay then bill. Not a great first experience. But we decided to try it again. The wait wasn't as bad, but the service was definitely lacking. It felt very unmanaged. There were three hostesses(doing nothing) and one person cleaning up tables(very slowly). There is a serious lack of structure as the waiters were all over the place, very frantic and not very friendly. Our waitress couldn't even take our whole order at once. She had to do drinks and then food. She seemed very incompetent. And the pajama uniforms are just ridiculous. Maybe if they all matched that might look okay, but otherwise it's very unappealing. I seriously doubt we will ever go back.
We had the Chicken and waffles and it was absolutely amazing and the service was outstanding.  We will definitely go back.

Walking in blind, someone one new to the restaurant I was a bit taken back by the interior decorations and waiters outfits.

THEY WERE PAJAMAS!!lol 
Sounds weird but by the end of our time eating I noticed their uniforms placed a comforting aspect to our meal.

Our server ASHLEY was AMAZING!!  Ask for her whenever possible. She went above and beyond even being short staffed.  She took the time to explain the menu and the popular favorites.

If you do stop by here make sure you get a steak. It's not a steakhouse but the quality is comparable to that of one. Sounds crazy I know but take a leap of faith like I did and I assure you, you won't be disappointed.

Arrived with a group of 7 on Saturday at about 1pm after a long night of drinking on the Strip. There was no wait! The atmosphere here is very welcoming and we were greeted and seated in a timely manner. My group's coffee and water cups never went empty here! The reviews for this place are hit or miss, but I'm glad our experience was a hit!

I forgot out server's name but she was the sweetest. She called us hun all the time and even joked along with us. She made our experience really fun and comfortable.

My order:

Pot of bread - 9/10 Small cinnamon roll served in a mug with a side of icing. I just wish it wasn't such a small portion but it was really soft, gooey and delicious. ORDER THIS

Loco Moco - 8/10 Beef patties cooked how you like on top of rice. Topped with eggs, SPAM, gravy and teriyaki sauce. The rice was kinda dry and the burger patties were a bit tough but the gravy and runny eggs really saved the day on this one. 

Also, the portions here are huge so get your gut ready

All my friends really liked their food. Rise and Shine is definitely on our go to list when we visit LV again

VISUAL AESTHETIC: 5/5
The exterior of the building is a mix between champagne mango and mustard yellow with a macaroni and cheese colored roof top. There is an outdoor patio with seating available and a small grass area circled with a fence behind it. Overall, it gives a sort of "barn-like" feeling. This ties in with Rise & Shine being a "steak and eggs place", so you think of cows and chickens. 

Inside the restaurant is spacious, tables not too close that you would feel harassed while having a conversation or intruding someone else's. Rise & Shine has floral umbrellas hanging upside from the ceiling, which are absolutely adorable. Overall, the decor is witty and gives a diner feeling. 

The waiters and waitresses are all dressed in pajamas which is a quirky plus that I found was not only cute, but suitable to market the brand of the business. 

FOOD: 4.5/5
I had brought a friend along and she ordered the fried buffalo chicken breast with hash browns and scrambled eggs, with the pot of bread. The sauce did not soak through the batter rendering the crispness to be soggy, which is a plus because many of the restaurants I go to unfortunately do this. The eggs were fresh, and the potatoes were hot, crisp on the outside, with a soft tenderness within. 

I am not a first time customer and ordered my usual: the New York strip steak spinach Benedict on an everything bagel. The taste was replicated as my prior visits, however I found that the cut of steak was much smaller this time around with the amount of spinach being quite sparse as well. But overall, the bagel was toasted perfectly leaving the inner bread tender but the exterior nice and crunchy. I asked for a medium rare steak and my expectations were met. 

SERVICE: 5/5
Typically Rise & Shine has great service, and I had that experience today as well. Our waitress constantly checked up on us to assure that my friend and I were satisfied and had everything we needed. From refills to containers for packing, she made sure to even bring along the check right away. 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 4.7/5
Breakfast is essentially easy when it comes to appeasing a large audience, at least when it comes down to average food, service, or visuals. To exceed expectations, niches are required, right? Rise & Shine gives great service, fresh food, and an adorable environment to tie it all together.

Nice!!! Where do I start. The food first. I say great, steak cooked as ordered and done properly. Service is excellent! Our waitress Madison did an excellent job. Pretty busy for a Sunday. Rise n Shine moved up to the top breakfast spots for me. 
They have French Press coffee, just like at home. That's refreshing to get at a restaurant, tasty. Great breakfast spot in Vegas, not your typical greasy spoon casino cafe. Price is reasonable, not like Denny's but who the heck goes there anyway.

The food is incredible! Steak and eggs that make your mouth water. Bruce was or server and he was very informative about the menu and different juice options available.  They make fresh juice on property, it was perfectly blended and came in a cute presentation carafe with carrot garnishes. The venue has unique outdoor decorations used in ways you only see on Pinterest.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves here and plan on visiting again soon.

I love this place. The food is yummy, and the options are seemingly endless (breakfast-wise)! The staff wears their pjs, and the inside of the restaurant is decorated beautifully. The pot of bread is my favorite. It is a little pot of cinnamon bread with frosting to dip it in. Their cinnamon french toast is amazing. 

The reason my review is lacking one star is because every time we are finished eating, our server disappears! Three time I've been here, we've needed boxes. They usually drop off the check for you to pay up front. The restaurant is hardly busy when we go (around 11am), so where do our servers disappear to?? 

Other than that, delicious food! Will be back.

After I went to the gym once a month, this is my favorite "hang-out" place to grab unlimited coffee. I would say it is a little bit pricey place for breakfast but the quality of food and ambiance is great! I love how the servers wear pajamas that makes me want to work with them. Definitely will suggest to locals or tourist who will get to travel to that area.

The wait for a Sunday morning wasn't too bad (approx 20 min).  Food arriving at the table was a little slower than expected, by we did have a large group. 
The food was fantastic. Portions were large. One order of eggs were undercooked, but that was fixed quickly.

Phenomenal breakfast food. Soo many options (veggie ones!) And amazing fresh squeezed  juices! Seatedly and serviced quickly. Such a fun, quirky atmosphere with friendly team members. I was impressed and we will be back!
P.s. they have corn hole!! :)

The wait staff are dressed in pajamas which is so fun. The decorations are unique and colorful with upside down umbrellas on ceiling. I'm not a big fan of sweets but you must try the pot of bread which is a cinnamon roll in a cup. It's freshly made, warm and so delicious! The best cinnamon roll I've had. They have a large variety of breakfast choices in their menu and the portions are large. They also have freshly squeezed juices and smoothies. Overall I was very satisfied and will definitely go back.
This is actually my second time here and the food is delicious,the service is great, the kids have a good portion menu and the staff is friendly. I love their Pajama outfits.
Have always heard great things about this place. All of it was true. Great food and fast service. My waitress, Ashley, was easily one of the best waitresses I have ever had. I will be back often.

Omg has the best steak and eggs ever the steak was tender and well seasoned! The fresh squeezed juices are awesome the coffee is the best.. One of the best breakfast spots I tried in a long time. My server Krystie  was so awesome!!!! Loved her and gave us the best recommendations.
Pretty dang good!  Awesome waffles really good omelette. Far superior to IHOP at about the same price...  Only reason I didn't give them five stars is because we've only been there once!
Our first meal at this amazing restaurant was fabulous with delicious food, awesome staff, fun decor and more! We will go back! What a surprisingly great experience!

The food was great! Best breakfast we have had since we moved to Vegas! The service was excellent! Our waitress Ashley Silva was fabulous! Her recommendations were on point! Definitely will be back and will recommend to our friends!
Very cute excellent food great service very fresh wonderful experience for my first time hope you open a location in Henderson soon by the way Amber Lee was fabulous very efficient respectful sweet

We had an amazing breakfast today! Ashley, our server, was so friendly and helpful. She helped pick out some really tasty coffees and was great at checking back if we needed anything. The food is pricey, but definitely worth it. You must try the steak (obviously) and eggs.

I love this place. Portions are not as big as Hash House , but this is so much better quality here. The flavors of every dish I've had are delicious. Today tried the Steak burger with Bacon , Mushrooms , and Swiss with Herb fries. The burger was ground Rib Eye. Amazing. One of the best burgers I've had. Have also tried the Steak and Egg Chilaquiles and the Steak and Egg Benedict with Spinch. Get the Coffee with your own personal French Press. I try to stop on here when I'm on this side of town. You will not be disappointed. The flaw is the restrooms need air freshner. A nasty smell of Sulphur and Rotten Eggs all throughout the restroom. Get some of those Air pump timed sprays or call Roto Rooter. Seriously !!!
Amazing service and breakfast!! Desire my server was great! One of if not the best breakfasts I've had in a long time! Thank you!

Our first visit here. What a great place! The staff was upbeat and friendly. The food was yummy.. I had steak and eggs and was very surprised that they cooked the steak properly. I'm all about meat and potatoes and was expecting the usual over cooked steak- (as has been my usual experience for breakfast restaurants) It was yummy and properly done! yay!
The juice tasted like someone literally went back to squeeze oranges for me. Really good. 
The AC was a bit much though and I could hear other patrons saying they were cold too. Not a biggie but maybe bring a sweatshirt unless you eat outside :)
Keep up the good work!

Not sure what happened to this place, but WOW!! How in the hell do you go from 5 stars, down to 0 stars?!? (Yelp forces me to leave one star) This is sad. If I was the owner of this place, I would do some serious thinking about my investment.. sadly, I think the damage is so set in that the new reputation of this place is beyond repairing. 

FOR ALL YOU BUSINESS OWNERS OUT THERE.. SHTTY STAFF = A SHTTY BUSINESS!!! 

Where did you manage to hire the most degenerative people of the Las Vegas hospitality and culinary industry?!?!?
We had the loco moco and it was amazing! The service was fantastic and Ashley took great care of us. We'll be back!

This was my breakfast stop for my short visit to Vegas. The hospitality was very pleasant and the food was amazing. I had the Bananas Foster waffle...the best waffle I've ever had in my life! My boyfriend hates bananas but kept getting little bites. It was huge so I could barely put a dent in it. I'm now back home in Ohio and I've been thinking about this waffle almost every morning. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the prices but other than that I can't wait to go back.

Meh. 

I was really excited to try this place because it caught my eye as I drove by and I'm always open to trying a cute new breakfast spot in Vegas. 

The wait was really long. That's our own fault though for deciding to wait. It was a beautiful day and patio was closed. A lot of empty tables inside. 

Food was good and presentation of the food was nice. Sadly, for all the time waiting, I was kind of just ready to move on with my day at that point. 

On the check, the server wrote in what 18% percent gratuity would be and added it in and circled the total with the 18%. Kind of tacky. 

Long story short, food was good but not that good.

TRY THE CHICKEN FRIED STEAK!!! Amazing. We also came here for my mom's birthday and we just mentioned it to our waitress and she brought out this big ass birthday pancake for her!! The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the pot of bread, it was hard.

I really wanted a hamsteak and Rise & Shine had it on their online menu. Me and my wife came here and this is the best breakfast we have had in a long time. Our server Amberly was the best. I ordered my hamsteak with a side of hollandaise sauce and sunny side up eggs. It was amazing. Definitely coming back.

We decided to try this place today and it was very yummy! I had the Belgian waffles with eggs and bacon and my husband had the chicken and waffles. I was eating off his plate more. Will be coming back for sure!
Awesome food! We tried the chicken and waffles, biscuits and gravy, and just normal egg plate. The hash browns were out of this world and the staff was so friendly!

A great place for breakfast in Las Vegas. The food is excellent and well priced. The staff is great and they wear pajamas as their uniform. Get there early because the wait time for seating can be greater than 20 minutes. I've been to this place twice and both times the food and service was awesome. The Loco Moco and Country Fried Steak are great choices. Also, try their French Press Coffee.

it is a little bit on the pricey side.. We had 3 orange juices and a coffee, and we were at the 20$ mark already... fresh squeezed sure.. .. just unexpected.

We brought our dogs.. we had to ask for water.. there is no doggie menu, and the waitress offered us to order a side of bacon for the dogs.. 4 strips.. $5? no thanks. 

I had the 3 pigs bagel sandwich. The bagel was grilled (good) but it was still relatively cold when you bit into it, and then the grilled side really wasn't toasted that much, so it was soggy with a little grease and cold.. I was disappointed. :( I also wasn't asked how I would have liked my eggs? Is that odd? 

Everything else was ok.. just wished I went somewhere else ....

Chelsea is the best Food server then any other breakfast place! She is patient and warm my husband is a food server at Bellagio. We know service! The ultimate breakfast is delicious you get a Ribeye Steak and hash browns and eggs plus you have to ask for the pot of bread it is delicious.
AmberLee Was AMAZING!! She was so polite & friendly food was great hash browns were really good!!

I have been here about 4 or 5 times now, and up until this time it has been a great experience. When my food came out there was a BRIGHT RED piece of hair sitting on top of my friend chicken :( they were more than willing to remake my food, and provided a biscuit to snack on. The shock was when the bill came out they didn't compensate the cost of the original dish. I've been in the restaurant industry and the first rule is that hair in a customer's food means you comp their meal.

This has been one of my favorite breakfast places to go in Vegas. Eggs Benedict is always my go to dish and Rise & Shine has never let me down with their various forms of it. They add balsamic vinegar to the top of the hollandaise which makes it rich and delicious! This most recent time my hash browns were  a little too crispy but still tasted great.  The staff is always speedy and friendly as well. 
This place is almost always busy but if you're willing to sit on the shaded patio, you can usually skip the wait. 

There are plenty of good places to grab breakfast in the city, but make sure to check out Rise & Shine, as you'll probably also add them to your short lost of favorite breakfast places.  And don't forget to share a cup o' bread with the table while you're there!

The food here was amazing!  My husband got the rib eye and eggs and those were great. I had the parfait and toast and it was really good. Are waitress Sarah was awesome and very helpful when choosing what to order!

ASHLEY... was an amazing waitress she has great energy greeting us with her beautiful smile and making us feel so welcomed. Breakfast was so delicious and such a big portion well worth the money!! Def a must try!!!!

Holy Cow! This is such a cute little place! The decor is bright, cheerful and inviting. The staff actually dress in pajamas and the service is excellent. Our waiter Tyler generously walked us through the menu. Speaking of the menu which is well thought out and eclectic, it provides a twist on old time favorites. The portion sizes are more than generous and the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak and Eggs was absolutely mouth watering! Thank goodness my friend and I decided to split a plate . And they serve french press coffee! Need I say more? This is definitely gonna be my new breakfast go to place!

I'm in love with this place! Our server, Amberleigh was awesome from the start. She explained the menu from top to bottom, including all her favorites and which dishes were most popular. I ordered the crispy French toast.....  Best French toast I've had in my 33 years on this planet! My hubski ordered the moco loco, also delish. Kiddo had the silver dollar pancakes.. to which he said, "they are almost as good as yours"  Overall, great experience! Stuffed to the max! I'd like to make one small note.... the lady in the back with the gorgeous red hair flowing.. should tie it back. Also, she should refrain from grabbing her phone and iPads with the same gloves she's handling all the food with. Sorry.. I had to throw that part in there  That's the only reason for my 4 stars. We will be back for sure! Thanks for the awesome breakfast!!
Second time here and this place is one of the best breakfast/brunch restaurants in Las Vegas. I had their ribeye  and eggs this morning and it was delicious! We'll be back!

This has been on my bookmark list for a long time and finally went over with my friend to give it a try. It's located on West Flamingo in the old Joe's Crab Shack. Arrived at 11am and waited 15 minutes for a table. By the end of our meal, it was actually pretty empty. 

Menu has lots of good options, it took awhile to decide what I wanted to eat as there seemed to be lots of delicious breakfast items to choose from. I finally opted for the Ultimate Steak and eggs, while my friend went with the Smoked Salmon benedict. We each ordered a juice (orange for him, strawberry watermelon for me) $4.95 each....ouch. Served in a 12 oz glass.

I ordered steak medium rare and eggs over medium. Eggs were perfect but steak was overcooked. Nice pot o bread and crispy potatoes on the side. Steak was nicely seasoned and still tender even if overcooked to medium well. My friend said the smoked salmon was really good with plenty of salmon and the hollandaise sauce seemed homemade instead of out of a can. I'll try that next time.

Service was just ok, nothing great about it. It took a good 20 minutes from order to receiving food, and then an extra 10 minutes after completing meal to get the check. 

I'll come back as many of the meals on other people's plates looked good. Chicken fried steak, and the pancakes looked delicious.

Food 4 stars, service 3 stars, prices 3 stars.
Had a great experience with Amberly as our waitress. Food was fantastic and she was very accommodating and patient. Would come back again!

Lil bit of a wait but the food and service made up for it... The portions are huge and the food is great!! My best friend and I have been there twice so far.. We try to go to a new place every Saturday for breakfast but we always seem to end up here.. 6/6/15
This place was really good. I had strawberry and watermelon juice, which was amazing. I had a regular breakfast, but it was just as good. I'll definitely be back.
Yummy food...  Exceptional service... We were greeted by our server Ashley immediately. Food was hott when it got to table, felt like a home cooked meal...

This place is really good! I really loved the vibe and the people working there, I always liked how they wore Pajamas it was a cute little touch. Also the decor was really nice and it was really clean and spacious in there. THE FOOD was really good!!! It was filled with flavor. I definitely look forward to coming back! And I introducing some of my friends and family to this place! (: big thumbs up!

I've eaten at Rise & Shine four times. Might go back just because good breakfast isn't easy to find in Vegas. Sure hotels have the $75 for two thing that could be decent but I can't find a consistent thing.

So, the reason I've been there 4 times was that #1 was pretty good. Egg white omelet that was nice and moist, not fluffed up like styrofoam and cheese melted nicely throughout. Yes the toast didn't arrive with breakfast and when it finally came it wasn't warm. Cold and bland. But OJ was great and so was the coffee even though the server asked if I wanted cream, which is odd, and didn't bring it anyway and I had to ask and wait while the coffee lost its edge. The place was crowded and we noticed the quirky umbrellas on the ceiling were for sale at $45 a pop. Being from NYC, the umbrella-on-the-go capital of the world, these seem cheap like that. You read it right. $45 clams. IN THE DESERT!!!!. The servers where pajamas and most have gray ones and you don't notice that's what they're wearing. It looks sloppy. Not really amused by it. They sell them too. Something like 25-35 clams for those. There's nothing great about them. It seemed greedy.

All in all trip #1 was decent. Trip #2 started going downhill fast. Same issue with the cream for coffee and the cold toast late with the omelet. It seemed like this is planned or something. OJ-great but this time asked twice. Egg white omelet was nothing like the first time. It was fluffed up and dry. So so but with cold toast it wasn't that good. We did try the pancakes, they were very good flavor, but arrived 5 minutes after the rest of the food. I'm pretty sure, based on when I asked, that it was a kitchen error, not server. Cause it came out right then.

I have no idea why we came a fourth time because, oh yeah, because our new favorite place across the parking lot didn't open until 7 so we drove over here, parked walked the 150 feet around the building to find they opened at 7 too. But #3 was a doosie. Yes. Had to double ask for cream for coffee. Got the late cold toast with the overcooked omelet, but the icing on the cake was the pancakes. I told the waitress we were going to take the pancakes to go. I just wanted a fork full-very good. She brought a box. I paid, we got up to go, walked out without the pancakes, got half-way around the building and ran back for them. Table was still as we left it, not cleared, but the cakes were gone. I asked and she said, well we threw them out, they couldn't leave food around, even though my unfinished omelet was still on a plate waiting for a busser. No joke. No one ran us down to say "hey you forgot your cakes!!" Nope. Gone. 

Never in my life have I seen this and I'm from NYC not small town America. 

So 86 Rise & Shine and their $45 dollar dopey umbrellas. The Crab Shack before it was bad too and a coat of Sesame Street yellow paint ain't changing anything.

Was expecting a phenomenal breakfast experience based on the name.  Unfortunately everything was just mediocre.  As you enter the decor is inviting with giant upside-down umbrellas painted like flowers spinning from the ceiling.  We were greeted by the holidays who sat us next to the kitchen, even though the restaurant was practically empty. There are some terms on the menu that were unfamiliar, like "pot of bread". We had to all and we're told that it is a lightly sweet cinnamon roll with no frosting baked in a tea cup.  I tried that ad my bread option with the 2 egg breakfast. The eggs were done as I asked and treated fine.  My husband ordered the steak and chilaquiles.  We're surprised that the chilaquiles were made with doritos chips. The steal looked like someone reused another steak and shaved it in half. When we asked for a box the server was not even curious about why my husband ate so little. The bill was $35 before tip.  I don't think this will be a place we come back to for breakfast.
Delicious food, fantastic wait staff and good vibes. I'm going to eat here more often.

We stopped by here for breakfast on our drive to the Grand Canyon. We got here pretty early so there was no wait at all. 

The decor was nice and colorful. There was a small area that had merchandise to buy. it looked mostly like socks.  The place was big, spacious, and looked clean and organized. It looks like it would be able to host a big group.

Our waiter was wearing nursing scrubs (or I thought they were). I figured that he either got off a late shift from the previous job or was about to go to his second job. I didn't think anything of it until I saw a waitress not in working uniform either. Then it hit me.. Rise & Shine... breakfast... pajamas.. Pajamas = working uniform - haha clever.

There were so many things on the menu that I kind of got hit with analysis paralysis. I ended up settling for my safe pick, chicken and waffles, which did not disappoint me. I liked that the chicken was flattened, it makes it easier to eat it sandwich style. I like to eat my chicken and waffles with syrup and hot sauce so I was happy to see it already on the table. My friend got the steak and eggs which looked really good as well.

Unique style, big and spacious, good food, friendly staff. No complaints.
Super good coffee - French press style - lots of good menu items- so many great options to choose from! Order one of each!

First time and experience was great! Ashley was our server and she was very nice! Recommended a few options and helped us decide on our meal. Salmon Benedict was delicious! My friend ordered a pot of toast with her meal and the kitchen was out, but Ashley made sure to bring one out before we left. Service was great and we will back!!  Thank yo

Good ambiance and the server wear pajamas as a uniform our server Madison invited us back in our PJ's. Madison was very friendly and knows the menu well. The food was ok. The idea of all fresh ingredients is great but the execution was mediocre! I have been here several times now and the last visit I ordered Chiliquillas it was as if it sat in the window waiting for the rest of the food to arrive. As a family we enjoy but it is only getting 3 's from me!

I had the banana foster waffle platter with 2 over easy eggs and turkey kielbasa and a side of hashbrowns. It was de-freaking-licious! I'm soo glad I wore stretchy pants coz my belly is 9 months preggo of waffles, egg, sausage and potatoes. The French press coffee was impressive. 5 minute press was stronger than my partner's farts but in a good way! Let see, what else? Our server Madison was very attentive and pleasant. She's got really nice teeth too. And quite pretty, even in her pajamas! Over all, good freaking job rise n shine. You're 5 stars in our book. We will be back as soon as we're out of our comas. K? K! Cool beans.

Let's just say that I drove 30 minutes to get here and it was worth every bite. Everything about tho solace was wonderful. Great servers & great food. I really recommend the orange juice! My steak was cooked perfectly and wow the pancakes were just the best way to end my meal. Left so full, but so satisfied

Steak & Eggs - perfection!!!
The seasoning and grill marks on the steak were great.
Awesome flavor. Can't wait for my next trip back.
Loved the pot of bread.
2nd time that I have had Breakfast here and 2nd time that I leave here satisfied. The food is really good. There pancakes wow huge and yummy.
Chicken fried steak and eggs is the best I have had. Friendly staff and fun environment.

I finally found a new breakfast joint! Yay! 

Came here with the bf and his parents around 11:30 on a Sunday. The wait was already 45mins and blazing hot outside. They have a small seating area inside while you wait but it was already crowded. The decor and atmosphere was bright and fun. Staff was very attentive and friendly from beginning to end. 

Now for the food! What an extensive menu! Cold pressed juices? Loco moco? Steak? Eggs? Rice? It has everything an indecisive diner could want! We ordered a chilaquiles, a Belgian waffle with all the fruit, steak and eggs and the red velvet pancakes. Oh my gosh the portions and tastes! Not as obnoxiously big as Hash House but still enough for two meals per plate. Not bad since the average price is $12 per dish. I can honestly say this is the first place I've really liked their scrambled eggs. Not underdone and seems way more than two eggs(but I'll take that!) I wish the pancakes were fluffier. And the pots of breads if you order a la carte seem small for $3+ but it all still tasted great. I also ordered the green apple carrot juice. My bf's dad was having trouble getting refills on his coffee. The server meant well and did everything he could while juggling several other tables. All good. I was happy. I'll definitely be back. Like soon.

Wow talk about going down hill fast!  Just two months I have a rave review of this place.  Went back there today and ordered the same thing the ribeye steak and eggs.  The steak was probably the cheapest cut of steak I've ever had.  In my picture you can see it's all fat barely edible!  The potatoes which were so amazing last time today were so overcooked and greasy.  My friends breakfast was equally disappointing.  The waitress was so annoying she was rushing us along I was halfway through my plate and put my fourth down for a minute and she tried to take my plate away?  Oh well it's a shame the food got so bad so quick.  Probably won't be back here anytime soon.
My wife's medium rare ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and my Hawaiian entree was excellent.
Amberly, our server was amazing & Made my mother Birthday wonderful. I will definitely be returning. #LeMarcel

Second time trying this breakfast spot and I love the atmosphere. It's different from the buffets, and small little places to go to. Nice outdoor area. Waited about 10 minutes because it was a pretty busy time at 11:20 but as soon as we sat the place started to clear out. Our server was very friendly and offered to review the menu since it's a little overwhelming. The three plates we had were all very large ports and I couldn't even finish my eggs and bacon. Overall very delightful breakfast meal. Prices are average 10-16$ I think would be fair per plate.
First time here. Very impressed. Have the Ultimate breakfast. Amberley was awesome. Will return often.

Looking over the menu they had a wonderful selection. Everything from an assortment of fruit smoothies to different versions of eggs benedict. However, based on the size of the portions versus the price charged, I feel that they were a little on the pricey side. Would I come back?  Definitely.  But for my budget it would not be a weekly restaurant .

My family and I walked in around 1pm a few days after they opened and we were seated promptly. 

The restaurant is very large, unlike many other breakfast spots in town, so I was already pleasantly surprised. The decor is fun with spinning flowers dangling above the dining area and fun pictures to admire on the walls.

For my entree I decided on the fried chicken breast and waffles while my mom and fella both opted for different versions of the chilaquiles. As a last minute decision we ordered a pot o bread when we saw a bunch of them come out of the kitchen for another table, tempting us. 

Service was slow to start, but I cut them some slack since they just opened and are finding their groove. It got better and more attentive as the meal progressed. 

Our food came out and the portions were enormous, making me wish we had shared. My chicken breast eclipsed my waffle on my plate and I wish they had not places the chicken on top of the waffle since the heat seemed to make the waffle limp and a little mushy. The flavor of the waffle was good but the chicken wasn't as good as I expected. It was cooked well but the flavor of the batter seemed off. It had a spicy kick but still seemed very bland and had a starchy aftertaste that I didn't care for.

My mom and fella raved about their chilaquiles and after sampling them I can't say I agree. The temperature seemed a bit on the colder side and the cheese wasn't entirely melted. The steak that came with my fella's meal was a little over cooked and the seasoning was a bit overdone. He loved his dish, so I guess that's all that matters. The pot of bread was awful, I don't recommend this at all. It was dry and flavorless. I took a bite and left it alone. 

Overall, the service was good and the food was hit and miss. My family loved the meal so we will likely be back, but I will be sure to sample a different dish next time and hope for the best.

The breakfast was very good! The portion size was perfect and the ingredients were fresh not canned. The service was good and timely. The kids meal 1+2+3 was the perfect for our almost 2 year old. We will be back!

Was greeted immediately and with kindly by the hostess. The atmosphere is nice in there. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Menu at a a really good variety. I opted for the steak and eggs.... On point! Steak cooked how I like it. Was juicy and far from dry. They have this green healthy juice that has kale in it, that was really good too. With the fresh juice they offer, I wish they offered a flavored iced tea. But overall, great dining experience. Good service and food for the amount spent.
This place has really great food all around, but my favorite is the avo-veggie-eggs Benedict. The portions are huge too! Friendly staff and great service!

Our server Samantha was very nice and personable. They have a variety of hot teas, fresh juice bar, and the essential coffee and sodas. The steak to my surprise was perfectly cooked! Too often I walk into a breakfast place and get over cooked obviously frozen steaks so I was excited to see the quality of the product was worth what I paid for it. Definitely will return.

No Wifi at all. This spot is bad for business meetings. If you have special dietary needs you may as well skip the place.  They have no idea what to do with a diabetic.  She actually said let's replace your bread with potatoes.  WTF?
This place is great ! It was my 2nd time eating here and it was just as good. I brought my parents along cause I knew they would feel just as comfortable and enjoy the food just as much as I did.
